loans.name: Alodononzo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALODONONZO est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Alphonsine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Alphonsine est âgée de 60 ans et est mariée à un comptable du nom de Godens. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à leur charge. Alphonsine vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant à charge. Alphonsine assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la famille. N’ayant jamais été à l’école, Alphonsine mène comme activité la vente de divers produits alimentaires (maïs, pain) et de vêtements dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Alphonsine  exerce cette activité depuis sept ans. Alphonsine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Alphonsine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Alphonsine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALODONONZO , un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Alodononzo group is made up of three people who all live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, whose name is Alphonsine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. It is the fourth time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé so that they can increase their business volume. Alphonsine is 60 years old and married to an accountant called Godens. The couple has three children, all educated, one of whom remains a dependent. Alphonsine lives with her husband and dependent child. She covers the various family expenses together with her husband. She did not attend school and now has an activity selling various groceries (corn, bread) as well as clothing, in her neighborhood; this allows her to provide for her family's needs, as well as her own, without any difficulty. Alphonsine has been carrying out this business for the past seven years. She gets her supplies in Benin. With a view to responding better to customer demand, she would like to increase her stock. In order to do this, Alphonsine is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé together with the other members of the Alodononzo group. The first three loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, bread and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for laborers on the farm.

loans.name: Zenah

texts.en:
Zenah has been a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya for the past 20 years and also works as a teacher. She currently produces maize and poultry for the local market. She is married and has seven children who are all adults except the last one who is still in school. 

Zenah has made a request for a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase more poultry and boost her poultry business. This is her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo. She is optimistic about poultry farming and says it will help her provide for the basic needs of the family and make life much better. 

She sees stiff competition for the poultry business as a challenge but is hopeful she will succeed all the same. She also appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's services to small holder farmers.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Gida

texts.en:
Gida lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with 2 children, 1 of whom goes to school. She also takes care of her sister.  She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.  
	
For the past 6 years Gida has been selling second-hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her goals are to start importing used clothes and also to buy a plot of land to build rental houses.  Her major challenges are seasonality and defaulters.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is a 34-year-old married man and father of two children. Ramadan has 25 years of experience in the bakery business. This long experience has given him broad talent to blend new tastes and recipes. He was only 14 years old when he opened his own bakery. It was hard for a young boy to start a business so early, but he had a big family to take care of since he was young.

Ramadan works hard to prevent his children from living his miserable childhood, which is why he tries to improve his business as much as he can.  To continue to develop his business, Ramadan requested a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua in order to do necessary maintenance on his shop and on the main oven, in addition to buying necessary raw materials such as oil, flour, and cheese at speciA. wholesale prices.

Ramadan hopes to move his bakery to a wider space, although the present one is located in a high population area, which helps greatly to continually improve business.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance to his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 2 bags of millet, 3 bags of beans, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 34 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past six years, Betty has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells women's bags and clothing. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to puchase more cloth to make clothes, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and to purchase plastics items to add onto her clothing. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to establish a plastics shop alongside her clothing business. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to puchase cloth to make clothes.

loans.name: Halimata

texts.fr:
Mme Halimata est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 02mois 20jours.01 de ses enfants va à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend du savon kabakourou (provenant de la Côte d’Ivoire), des pagnes uni wax et du haricot depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne à ABIDJAN en Côte d’Ivoire. Elle achète les produits Burkinabé pour aller vendre en Côte d’Ivoire et ramène les produits Ivoiriens qu’elle vend au Burkina Faso. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 20 moutons, 10 sacs de gombo sec, 02 sacs de soumbala et un sac de feuille de baobab.

Mme veut agrandir son commerce avec ses économies et aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales. Elle ambitionne améliorer son activité en exportant ses produits dans les autres pays et payer  la scolarisation de ses enfants .
texts.en:
Mrs. Halimata is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 20, and the youngest is 2 months and 20 days. One child attends school. She has five persons to support.

For ten years, she's been selling "kabakourou" soap (coming from Côte d'Ivoire), pagnes "uni wax" (colorful African cloth), and beans. She gets her supplies in Abidjan (Côte d'Ivoire).

She buys products in Burnika Faso and travels to Côte d'Ivoire to sell them, and then purchases products there, that she brings back and sells in Burkina Faso. Her customers are women. 

She wants to buy 20 sheep, 10 sacks of dried okra, 2 sacks of soumbala (African condiment), and of sack of baobab leaves.

Mrs. Halimata wants to expand her business with her savings, and help her husband with the family expenses. She ambitions to bolster her business by exporting products to other countries, and pay her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep, 10 sacks of dried okra, 2 sacks of soumbala (African condiment), and of sack of baobab leaves

loans.name: Iye Bah

texts.en:
Iye is 33 years old and is married to a business man. She has two school-going children, ages six and three. She also has two additional dependents, her sister's children, who live with her in order to attend school in the city, as their parents live in the village where the school standard is low.  

In 2000, Iye established her imported foodstuff business. She began this business because she could not further her schooling, as she was not bright in school and her parents felt that it was a waste of their resources. She got married as a teenager. 

Iye had helped her husband to manage the business for a year when he thought of her starting her own business. He provided the initial capital of SLL 1,500,000 to start.  This business is special to her because she is able to prove herself that she can be what she wants to be in life. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from the business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Iye has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires this new loan in order to purchase 3 cartons of Bama mayonnaise, 5 cartons of Maggie seasonings, 10 bags of onions, 10 cartons of popcorn, and 10 cartons of Gino spaghetti. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. 

In the future, Iye plans to build a house.  This loan will improve her business because she wants to open another outlet, which she is currently working on. She wants her children to obtain a good education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase mayonnaise, seasonings, onions, popcorn, and spaghetti.

loans.name: Komayli

texts.en:
Komayli is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been working in selling beauty cosmetics and wedding dresses since a year ago. Komayli started this business in order to help her husband earn their living.
 
Komayli is a woman with a very good reputation. Most of her customers are neighbors, nearby villagers and many other friends, in addition to passing-by customers. Komayli is working on improving and developing her business as much as she can; that’s why she requested a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua to increase her business merchandise through buying new cosmetics collections in addition to wedding dresses to increase her customers’ choices.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise through buying new cosmetics collections and wedding dresses.

loans.name: Mahuklo Group

texts.fr: MAHUKLO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Catherine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 51 ans. Catherine est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Abraham. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Catherine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Catherine  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Catherine vend depuis une dizaine d’année, des produits alimentaires (maïs, farine de manioc et boisson locale) par le système de distribution. Catherine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Catherine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKLO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: MAHUKLO is a group of three people, of which the members live in the same area in Benin. The representative of the group, Catherine (whose hand is raised in the photo) is fifty-one years old. Catherine is married to a mechanic named Abraham. The couple has two children, both in school and in their care. Catherine lives together with her children and husband. Together, the couple provides for the various needs of the household. Catherine did not attend school. To cope with her various expenses, for a dozen years Catherine has sold food products (corn, manioc flour, and local beverages) through a distribution system. Catherine stocks up in Benin. In pursuit of the satisfaction of her clients and with an eye to the increase of her working capital, Catherine is requesting her third loan from Alidé, together with the other members of the MAHUKLO group. This credit will be used by them to better respond to the demands of their customers and to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy bags of corn and manioc flour, and local beverages

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas has been in farming for over five years with his produce of maize, beans and potatoes going to the local market. He is married and has two children aged five and three who are both in school. He runs a cereals retail shop in the local market for additional income. 

Douglas has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to enable him to venture into pig farming. He says the business will enable him provide for the family's basic needs due to high demand for pork and the high cost of other meat, which makes many clients resort to pork. He plans to acquire more land for more expansive farming and hopes to grow his cereals business to reach further markets. 

He mentions unreliable rainfalls as the major challenge to farming.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a 47-year-old married woman with six children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in firewood for four years. She started with a few customers in the area and now supplies to a primary school. Her vision is to have a wholesale shop plus educating her children. Justine needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de 5 enfants.Pour appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille, elle a implanté une boutique devant son domicile pour vendre des produits ménagers et des denrées de premières nécéssité notamment le mil, le riz, l'huile, l'arachide et d'autres produits divers...Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter du riz, de l'huile et des ustensiles ménagers.
texts.en: This borrower is a married mother of five children. To support her husband in providing for the family, she established a store in front of her home to sell household products and basic food items, notably millet, rice, oil, peanuts, and various other products. In order to strengthen her working capital, she is seeking a loan of 300,000 F to buy rice, oil, and household utensils.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, and household utensils.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Osman. He is married and has two children, aged 5 and 2 years. He has seven additional dependents who live with him because they are his relatives. In 2007, Osman established his used clothing business. He got his initial capital from his uncle. 

"This business is my only source of income to provide food and other basic things for my family," said Osman. 

Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le)  every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Osman now requires a loan in order to buy more used clothing for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Osman plans build a dwelling house for his family and to give his children a good education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for his business.

loans.name: Maléki

texts.fr:
Maléki est un homme âgé de 24 ans. Il est marié å une  couturière et ont  ensemble un enfant.  
Maléki travaille comme revendeur de cartes de recharges  depuis 04ans. 
Il est distributeur de cartes dans les environs de la ville de Lomé. Ses marchandises sont achetées chez les grossistes. 
Maléki a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’augmenter son activité par l’achat des cartes de recharge.
texts.en:
Maléki is a twenty-four year old man. He is married to a seamstress and they have a child together. 
Maléki has worked as a reseller of mobile phone recharge cards for four years.
He is a card distributor in the surroundings of the city of Lomé. His merchandise is purchased from a wholesaler. 
Maléki has received his fourth loan from WAGES in order to increase his business through the purchase of recharge cards.

loans.use: to buy recharge cards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wheat flour, soft drinks and sweets for sale.

loans.name: Habib

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire sans enfant qui exerce comme tailleur.Il a arrété ses études il y'a cinq ans et s'est engagé dans ce métier auprès de son frére qui l'a formé.Il a ensuite ouvert son atelier de couture et a acheté sa première machine sur un pret de l'UIMCEC.La position de son atelier situé au coeur du marché lui donne une grande clientèle; ce qui lui assure des revenus assez importants.Il supporte ainsi une grande partie des dépenses d'entretien de sa famille ainsi que ses propres besoins.Actuellement, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter une machine à coudre "cornière" afin d'améliorer la qualité de ses services.Son ambition est d'ouvrir un second atelier de couture.
texts.en: This borrower is a young single man without any children, who works as a tailor. He stopped studying five years ago and took up this trade with his brother who trained him. He then opened his own sewing workshop and bought his first machine with a loan from UIMCEC. His workshop is situated at the heart of the market giving him a large customer base; this ensures that he has a reasonably significant income. He thus bears a large proportion of his family's running expenses as well as providing for his own needs. He is now requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy a "Cornière" sewing machine so that he can improve his service quality. His ambition is to open a second workshop.

loans.use: to buy a "Cornière" sewing machine

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a farmer in Murang'a, Central Kenya where he lives with his family of three children between 11 and 6. He sells his produce of tea, milk and fruits to the local market. He is 42 and has been in active farming for over 10 years. 

Joshua has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy a motorcycle and venture into the transport business. He says the transport business is currently booming with the government's reduced taxes on motorcycles which has motivated him to make the venture. He says it will also help him make cheap deliveries of his farm produce for better farming returns. 

He notes that farming business is facing challenges due to unpredictable rainfalls.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Melissa M.

texts.en: Melissa is 28 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has two children, ages four and twelve, who attend school and live at home. For two years, Melissa has been operating a salon and boutique in her community. She has customers, but faces the problem of unfaithful employees in her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase wigs and clothes for her business. She plans to give her children the best in life, and to educate them.

loans.use: to purchase wigs and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Kadidja

texts.fr:
Kadidja est une femme  âgé(e) de 49 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Kadidja travaille comme revendeuse de bazins de façon ambulante depuis 1996. Afin de répondre à la demande de la population elle achète ses produits à Lomé et chez les grossistes qui viennent du BURKINA-FASO.
Kadidja a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bazins. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kadidja voudrait ouvrir une boutique pour ne plus se déplacer, aider son mari et voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en:
Kadidja is a forty-nine year old woman. She is married to a driver. She has two children.
Kadidja has worked as a traveling reseller of bazins (a type of pagne, or colorful wax cloth) since 1996. In order to respond to the demand of the population, she buys her products in Lomé and from the wholesalers who come from Burkina-Faso. Kadidja has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase bazins. 
In the coming years, Kadidja would like to open a store so that she does not need to travel anymore, and to help her husband and see her children grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy bazins (a type of colorful wax cloth).

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 27 years old, and is married to Jacinta. He makes shoes and has been in the business for the past ten years. He realizes an income of KES 7,000 from the business.

This is his fourth loan with KADET. He repaid his previous loans successfully. He will use this loan to purchase shoes and shoe soles.

He will use the anticipated profits to cater to his family's needs. His dream is to expand his business in order to have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and shoe soles.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is a 34-year-old married mother of four children aged 18, 16, 14, and 8 years, all of whom attend school. In 2006, Mariatu established her clothing and household utensils (cotton and dishes) business, having gained experience after working with her sister for two years. Until 2009, Mariatu conducted the enterprise out of her home, after which she was given a place in the central market. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month.

Mariatu is requesting a loan for Le 3,000,000 in order to buy english wax cotton and hopes that it will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, she plans to open a big shop, as she wants her children to have a good education and a better standard of living than she and her husband experience. Mariatu thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy English Wax Cotton.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, who has operated her cereal shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years, also practices dairy farming in the area. She is 49 years old, married and has two school-going children.

Introduced to KADET LTD by other clients, this will be Catherine's first loan with which she will buy more cereal stock to sell in her shop. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and earn more income as well as improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more cereal stock.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya and has been producing maize, milk and poultry birds for the local market. She lives with her family of three children in Kitale. She has been in farming for 15 years and owns low-cost rental houses in the local market to supplement her farming income. 

Gladys has requested a loan of 85,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo. She will use 25,000 KES to purchase more poultry birds, and the rest to buy milk cans and a cooler to avoid the waste incurred when the milk goes bad, which has been a major challenge for her milk business. She hopes the loan will boost her income and help in educating the children. 

She laments the high cost of managing animal diseases and low market prices for milk and other farm products.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and milk cooling cans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Adoline

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme célibataire qui tient une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques et de mercerie. Située dans l'enceinte du marché central, la boutique est très fréquentée par les tailleurs et la clientèle féminine.L'emprunteuse a étudié jusqu'au lycée avant d'arreter les études du fait des mauvaises conditions d'hebergement et d'entretien dans lesquelles elle se trouvait.Elle a préféré retourner dans son village et se lancer dans le commerce.Aujourd'hui, sa boutique lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge, de satisfaire aux besoins de ses trois soeurs et d'appuyer son père dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Elle sollicite un pret de 500000f pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en cette période de forte demande en achetant notamment du popeline, des fils à coudre, des tissus, des boutons et d'autres produits divers.Son ambition est de devenir grossite.
texts.en:
This borrower is a single woman who has a store where she sells cosmetics and sewing supplies.  Her store is located within the central market and is very popular with tailors and female customers.  The borrower studied up to high school level before she stopped her education due to bad housing conditions and lack of support.  She preferred to return to her village and start a business.  Her store currently makes her income which she uses to support herself, meet the needs of her three sisters and support her father in covering the family's expenses.

The borrower is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to strengthen her business during this period of high demand by purchasing, in particular, poplin, sewing thread, fabrics, buttons and other miscellaneous products.  Her ambition is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy poplin, sewing thread, fabric, buttons and other miscellaneous products

loans.name: Blima

texts.fr:
Blima est une femme âgé(e) de 38 ans. Elle est mère d’un enfant et est mariée à un topographe.
Blima est revendeuse de céréales et de tchouk (boisson locale faite à base de mil) depuis 10ans. Elle répond à la demande de la cliente dans une maison située à Kégué (un quartier de la ville de Lomé).
Blima a requis son troisième cycle de prêt  de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de maïs, de mil, des sacs de charbons.
texts.en: Blima is a 38-year old woman, who has one child and is married to a surveyor. She has been selling cereals and "tchouk" (a local drink made from millet) for the past ten years. She satisfies customer demand in a house in Kégué (a district of the town of Lomé). She has requested a third loan from WAGES in order to buy sacks of corn, millet and charcoal.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 45 years old and married with six children, four of whom are still schooling. He is a resident of Muranga where he carries out his farming with the current output of fruit, tea and milk going to the local market.
 
Francis has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water pump at 35,000 KES and water pipes, which he will use to carry out irrigation on his farm. He says the rampant drought hinders adequate production. He adds that availability of the water pump will enable him to use his land effectively. 
 
He reiterates that pests and drought are really hurting the farmers' efforts.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and  irrigation pipes

loans.name: Mathews

texts.en: Mathews is a married man, 28 years old and blessed with one child who is in school. For the last five years, he has been running a welding business to bring up his family. He also makes bricks for additional income. Mathews has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. With 50,000 Kenya shillings, he wants to add to his stock of metals for his business. In the next five years, he wants to establish his business and become an employer. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more metal.

loans.name: Ra'ed

texts.en: Ra'ed is a 42-year-old man who is married and has three sons and two daughters. He has a project raising broilers and laying hens and benefits from selling their products. Ra'ed wants to expand his project by purchasing more broilers and laying hens, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $1,100 from FATEN. When Ra'ed gets the loan, he will be able to purchase more broilers and laying hens and increase his sales from its products. This will increase his income and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family. Ra'ed is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more broilers and laying hens

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is married and blessed with three children. He describes himself as a hard-working business man. He has been selling shoes for the last ten years to support his family. He employs two people to assist him in managing the business. The major challenge he faces is competition. With 40,000 Kenya shillings, he wants to add to his stock of leather shoes and slippers for resale. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: to add to his stock of leather shoes and slippers

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a hard-working business woman. She is 37 and married. She has been running a grocery business for the last three years to earn a living. Eunice employs one person to assist her in managing the business. Her potential customers are those passing by. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy tomatoes and vegetables for resale. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to manage the business with her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 40 years old and lives in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, with five of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Moses has been working hard to manage his business of selling timber. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more trees and will help Moses to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to start supplying lumber to nearby districts. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans micro loans.

loans.use: to puchase more trees

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is a focused business man. He is 28 and single. He has been running a hardware business for the last two years to make a living. He  is also a plumber to increase his income. He employs two people to assist him in running the business. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to open another outlet of his business. Since Walter joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. In the next five years, he wants to become more financially stable.

loans.use: to open another outlet of his hardware business.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune marié et père de deux enfants.Après avoir suivi des études générales jusqu'au collége, il a arrété et a fréquenté pendant deux mois la boutique de son oncle qui vend des appareils électroniques.Ce dernier lui a ouvert une boutique de vente de téléphones mais surtout d'accessoirs téléphoniques dont la demande est très forte  actuellement.Son commerce lui rapporte ainsi des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent d'entretenir sa famille.Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en achetant notamment des téléphones et des accessoirs téléphoniques.
texts.en: The borrower is a young married man and father of two children. After having completed his general studies as far as middle school, he stopped and frequented his uncle's store for two months, which sells electronic devices. His uncle opened him a store for phone sales, but especially phone accessories, for which the demand is very high right now. His business thereby brings him quite consistent revenue, which permits him to look after his family. He seeks a loan of 250000F in order to increase his business equipment by buying in particular, phones and phone accessories.

loans.use: to buy phones and phone accessories.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a hardworking businessman who is 34 years old. He is married and blessed with one child who is in school. For the last 10 years, he has been selling chicken to bring up his family. Jackson has employed one person to help him to manage the business. The major challenge he faces is competition. In the next five years, he plans to own a wholesale business. Since Jackson joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens for resale.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Imaculate

texts.en:
Imaculate is 38 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, with four of them currently in school. For the past four years, Imaculate has been working hard to manage her mini supermarket, which sells food ingredients, cosmetics and basic items. 

To help expand her business, Imaculate has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy new kinds of food items for resale, and will help Imaculate to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Imaculate hopes that in the future she will be able to grow the business into a bigger supermarket. 

Imaculate is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Imaculate who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of food items for resale

loans.name: Okello

texts.en:
Okello is 50 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. For the past three years, Okello has been working hard to manage his farm supply business, which sells fertilizers, pesticides and seeds. 

To help expand his business, Okello has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more farm supplies and will help Okello to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Okello hopes that in the future he will be able to grow the business to attract farmers from all corners of the district. 

Okello is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Okello who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more farm supplies

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 21-year-old young lady who used to buy and re-sell birds with her brother FaisA. when they needed money as kids.  A few years ago, after having a good experience in the trading system and learning about birds and how to breed them, both of them officially started a bird sale business on their house roof.

And through the years, they were able to buy some rare birds and sell them for a very good price. Now Alia wants to add new types of birds and pigeons to what they sell so they can make more money in order to build a new birds' house, and that’s why she has applied for this loan.

Because Alia is a conservative person, her brother FaisA. has agreed to appear in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy more birds and build a new birds' house

loans.name: Yassuy

texts.en:
Yassuy is 45 years old and lives in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has eight children, with five of them currently in school. For the past ten years, Yassuy has been working hard to manage his butcher shop, which sells fresh cuts of meat to restaurants and local customers. 

To help expand his business, Yassuy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cows and will help Yassuy to generate greater profits and open another branch. Yassuy hopes that in the future he will be able to continue growing his business. 

Yassuy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yassuy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to purchase more cows

loans.name: Madial

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de 7 enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Pour entretenir sa famille, il avait ouvert une boutique de vente de produits de consommation courante.Mais du fait de la faiblesse de ses revenus, il l'a arrété et  a démarré un commerce de produits alimentaires agricoles.Ainsi, il achéte en gros de l'arachide, du mil, de l'huile d'archide qu'il revend en détail auprès des commercants de sa localité.Aujourd'hui, il arrive à supporter l'essentiel des dépenses familiales.Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce , il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter de l'arachide, du mil et des aliments bétail.
texts.en: This borrower is married and the father of 7 children, all of whom attend school.  To support his family, he had opened a shop which sold popular items.  However, because of weak sales, he stopped doing this and went into the business of selling agricultural food products.  Now he buys peanuts, millet, and peanut oil which he sells at retail to merchants in his region.  Today he is able to meet his family’s essential financial needs.  To increase his working capital, he is requesting a loan of 400,000f to buy peanuts, millet and livestock feed.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, millet, and livestock feed.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
After his father's death, Ahmad, a 22-year-old guy, was left with a shop to manage with few employees.

The shop is basically a four-room store for selling frozen meat and other food items like cheese, noodles, etc. Although Ahmad is still new in the business himself, he is managing the business in a very good way.

Now Ahmad has applied for a loan because he wants to buy another showing fridge for his store as a way of expanding.

loans.use: to buy another refrigerator for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a cow shed

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in Kampala, Uganda. Kevin lives in a rented house and her family has no access to electricity and running water. For the past five years, Kevin has run a restaurant. She works seven days a week and her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent. Kevin’s major business challenges are seasonality and transportation.


Kevin is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan from MCDT SACCO to buy bananas, rice, and beef. Her aspiration is to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy bananas, rice, and beef

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is 23 years old and single. For the past year, he has been a dairy farmer and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. Boaz is a member of KADET LTD and has taken out a previous 40,000 KES loan. 

Boaz is requesting a loan to purchase a dairy cow.  He will use his profits to repay his loan and to invest in a fixed asset. In the future, Boaz hopes to be a prosperous dairy farmer.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en:
Victoire is married to a house builder and has six children between the ages of one and 17. For the past four years, she has been running a clothing store. 

Victoire is requesting a loan to buy more clothing to sell. She will save the profits from her loan. In the future, Victoire would like to work as a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 23-year-old married lady. She lives with her two kids and husband who is a police officer.

Aya is known for her artistic talent in making crafts like arranging fake flowers, and antiques, but especially embroidery. As shown in the picture, Aya does embroidery as mirror frames, tray bottoms, and different types of covers and wall hangings.

It has been two years since she started to sell what she makes and add another source of income to the family.

Now Aya has applied for a loan to buy more embroidery materiA. to make more pieces of art to sell, and look for the opportunity to participate in locA. exhibitions if she can.

loans.use: to buy more embroidery material

loans.name: Soaibu

texts.en:
Soaibu is 45 years old and lives in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has nine children, eight of whom are currently in school. For the past fifteen years, Soaibu has been working hard to manage his shop, where he sells sewing machines and makes and sells clothes. 

Soaibu is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to expand his business and buy more sewing machines. This will help him to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Soaibu hopes that in the future he will be able to continue growing his business. 

Soaibu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Soaibu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Tashinga Group

texts.en:
Juliet is a cross-border trader who goes to South Africa, Mozambique, Zambia, and Botswana, where she buys groceries. She also rears chickens. She is operating with one male employee and two women.

She is married, and her husband is formally employed as a human-resources supervisor. She has a house where she receives rentals every month of 100 dollars. She is 41 years old. She has eight children with her husband and has four orphans: two from her aunt and two from her young brother, whom she is looking after.

Her main challenge is that she cannot meet the high demand for poultry at the end of the month when people get their salaries. She works with her group members at the border to maximize their duty-free allowances. Juliet will buy more poultry feed and clothes from Zambia with her loan.  

Juliet looks forward to continuing to grow her poultry business and hopes to take larger loans in the future. These loans will help in the wellbeing of the family and help the children to complete their education.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and clothes from Zambia

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is 42 years old, married to Sicay, and together they have three children ages 17, 15, and 12. He sells electronics and has been in the business for the past 10 years. He gets a monthly income of 6,350 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the business.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the amount to purchase more electronics to stock his shop.

He will use the anticipated profit to open another outlet. His dream is to be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 years old and lives in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and cooking oil for resale, and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to continue growing his business. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 20 years. She is 33 years old and married to Isaiah. They have four children who attend school.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

In the future, Lucy hopes to buy a pick-up, which she will use to transport her farm produce to the market in Ndunyu Njeru area and therefore increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old and is married to Paul. The couple has four children, all of whom attend school. For the past three years, Susan has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a field officer and this will be her first loan.    

Susan is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray. In the future, she hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 38 years old and lives in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, Hassan has been working hard to manage his grocery store, where he sells home supplies and local foods such as sugar, salt, and cassava. 

Hassan is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to help expand his business and buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell. This will help Hassan to generate greater profits and pay for his children's school fees. Hassan hopes that in the future he will be able to continue growing his business. 

Hassan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hassan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basins, cups, plates

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 31 years old and single. For the past 11 years, she has operated a salon and she earns a monthly income of 40,000 KES. 

Rose is requesting a loan to buy hair weaves, hair pieces, and massage oils. This will be her first loan with KADET LTD.  She will use her anticipated profits to diversify her business by keeping poultry. Rose’s dream is to have a high-class salon that will increase her income and raise her living standards.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves, hair pieces, and oils

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 1 child who goes to school. She has one additional family member (sister). 

Doreen sells bananas from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for one year. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of matooke (green bananas). 

Doreen's aspirations and goals are to be a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land and build rental houses. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en: Dorris is 32 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has a 12-year-old child that is presently in school and lives at home. For the past 8 years, Dorris has been selling fashion clothes in her shop. She has a lot of customers and her daily sales are very high during the dry season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her business. She plans to expand her business and wishes her child to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 35 years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past 12 years, James has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells local liquor and beer. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more crates of beer, and will help James to generate greater profits and purchase ad space to attract more customers. James hopes that in the future he will be able to continue growing his business. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like James, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: Julieta de 41 años de edad, vive muy cerca al mar con sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 20 años; allí tiene el negocio de vender mercancías,  mediante guías especializada de productos, el cual  inició hace 3 años cuando decidió genera ingresos a través de la comercialización de unas cuantas mercancías  a una clientela domestica;  gradualmente fue creciendo y a sus jeans, calzados, y ropa, agregó productos ofrecidos  mediante catálogos, como cosméticos, colonias perfumes, accesorios etc. Las mercancias que vende Julieta las distribuye para que sus clientes las paguen en dos partes, su rotación de inventarios es de 31 dias y su marge de utilidad promedia es no menor del 30%. En la actualidad esta aplicado a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está solicitando un credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancía variada que tiene en su catálogo en ofertas,  y de las cuales sus clientes han hecho pedidos; Con este financiamiento Julieta,  se está preparando para finalizar el año con un importante volumen de ventas,  debido a que esta es la época de mayor repunte comercial. Su meta más adelante es tener un almacén de variedades bien posicionado en pleno centro de Puerto Colombia, municipio donde habita.
texts.en:
Julieta, 41, lives very close to the ocean with her two children who are 14 and 20 years old.  She has her business there selling merchandise via catalogue.  She started it three years ago when she decided to earn income selling some merchandise to a domestic clientele.  Gradually she grew and to her jeans, footwear and clothing she added catalogue merchandise like cosmetics, colognes, perfumes, accessories, etc.  The merchandise that Julieta sells is paid back to her in two installments by her customers.  Her stock turnover rate is 31 days and her average profit margin is no less than 30%.

She is currently applying for her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’s asking for a Kiva loan to buy assorted merchandise from her catalogues that is on special promotion and which her customers have ordered from her.  With this financing, Julieta is preparing for the end of the year with an important spike in sales because this is the season of highest sales.  Her goal for later on is to have a well-situated variety store right in downtown Puerto Colombia, the town where she lives.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.en: Emilienne is 41 years old and is married to a farmer. She has 8 children ages 2 to 17. Emilienne sells fresh milk which she has been doing for one year.  Her business has enabled her to care for her family and send her children to school.  She would like the loan to buy more milk to sell. She will use the profits to make savings for her future.

loans.use: to buy more fresh dairy for sale

loans.name: Martín Horacio

texts.es:
Martín es un luchador que desde hace 6 años se dedica a la distribución de refrescos en el municipio de Angostura del departamento de Antioquia, su mayor propósito desde que sus 3 hijos nacieron ha sido ofrecerles un mejor futuro, trabaja con empeño para prestar un buen servicio, acortar los tiempos de entrega y que las gaseosas, cervezas y agua en botella que distribuye lleguen en el mejor estado, es un emprendedor que sueña con ser reconocido en el sector, que su negocio progrese y que le genere mas ingresos para mejorar la difícil situación económica que enfrenta su familia.

Con la ilusión de que su negocio progrese Martín quiere comprar mercancía al por mayor para obtener mas utilidades, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para hacer dichas compras, por lo que solicita un préstamo que invertirá en gaseosas, cervezas y agua en grandes cantidades, así generará más ingresos, las ventas mejorarán, su negocio logrará posicionarse y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida se verá beneficiada.
texts.en:
Martín is a fighter who has worked distributing beverages for six years in the city of Angostura in the department of Antioquia.  His main goal since his three children were born has been to give them a better future.  He works with dedication to give good service, cut the delivery time, and deliver the soda, beer, and bottled water in the best condition.

He is an enterprising man who dreams about being recognized in his sector.  He wants his business to progress and generate more income for him to improve the difficult economic situation that his family faces.  With the hope that his business might progress, Martín wants to buy merchandise wholesale to earn more profit.

Martín doesn't have the capital necessary to make these purchases, so he is requesting a loan to invest in soda, beer, and water in large quantities.

In this way he will generate more income, his sales will improve, his business will be able to position itself, and he will see his quality of life benefit proportionately.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer, and water wholesale for distribution

loans.name: Angie S.

texts.en: Angie is 37 years old and lives in  West Point.  She is married and has two children ages 10 and 15, who live with her and are  presently in school.   For the past six years, Angie has been selling fashion clothes  in her community.   She has a lot of customers and makes a good profit, since she is the only one who sells fashion around the community, especially during Christmas season.  Angie is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes for her business, she plans to expand her business and send her children to a good quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.es: Joselyn de 23 años de edad,  vive al sur Occidente de la ciudad y en su vivienda tiene un punto comercial,  donde vende variedades de productos como fantasías, artículos de piñatería, para bebé, accesorios etc. Inicialmente vendía solamente cosméticos mediante revistas especializadas; con ello le empezó a ir muy bien, hasta que logró ampliar su oferta e involucrar nuevas líneas de productos, como ahora lo hace, pues además de vender mediante catálogos, compra directamente, surte su punto comercial y maneja las líneas de contado y a crédito. Joselyn empezó su emprendimiento hace 2 años, orientada por su madre, quien por su experiencia de comerciante logró encaminarla, para que obtuviera sus propios ingresos y no dependiera de un empleo. Al principio le regaló una vitrina y le dio productos para que los vendiera.  En la actualidad  Joselyn se esmera por vender a sus clientes productos con la calidad que sus clientes ameritan; valor en el   cual trabaja para diferenciarse de su competencia y por eso da de sí misma lo mejor, para conservarlos y convertirlos en sus fieles compradores.  Actualmente está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; con su credikiva comprará mercancía variada alusiva a la temporada navideña, preparándose para responder como ella sabe a este final de año en el que espera tener la mejor venta.
texts.en:
Joselyn, age 23, lives to the southwest of the city and has a store in her home where she sells a variety of goods such as costume jewelry, piñatas, baby products, accessories, and other items. She started out only selling cosmetics through specialized magazines. When she began doing well, Joselyn expanded her product lines and now sells through catalogs in addition to making direct purchases to restock her store. She sells her products for cash or on credit.

Joselyn started this venture two years ago and received guidance from her mother. She relied on her experience as a traveling merchant so that she could generate her own income and not have to depend on a job. At first, her mother gave her a display cabinet and some products that she could sell. Today Joselyn strives to sell quality products that her customers deserve. She places great value in her work in order to differentiate herself from the competition, so she does her very best to hold on to her customers and turn them into loyal buyers.

Joselyn is currently applying for her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the Kiva funds to buy a variety of merchandise for the upcoming Christmas season. Joselyn wants to prepare herself for the year-end season because she expects to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Koamivi

texts.fr:
Koamivi est un homme âgé de 23 ans. Il est marié à une coiffeuse avec un enfant en charge.
Koamivi travaille comme coordonnier depuis 2005. Il fait des chaussures, des ballons et les répare également.
Koamivi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des outils de travail.
Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit rendre sa famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Koamivi is 23 years old.  He is married to a hairdresser and they have one child in their care. 

Koamivi has been working as a cobbler since 2005.   He makes shoes and balls and also does repairs on them. 

Koamivi received his first loan through WAGES in order to buy tools for his work. 

He says that with these profits, he will make his family happy.

loans.use: to buy tools for his business.

loans.name: Varbah

texts.en: Varbah  is 42 years old and lives in West Point.  She is single and has four children between 7 and 17 years old, who live at home and are currently in school.  For two years, Varbah has been operating a grocery store where she sells toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice and many other items.  Most importantly, she has many customers since her business is in a very good location. She is requesting a loan to buy toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice and other inventory for her business. She plans to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice and other items for her business

loans.name: Affossogbe Group

texts.fr: AFFOSSOGBE est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Blandine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 24 ans et est mariée à un enseignant nommé Romane. Le couple a un enfant, qui est scolarisé et à leur charge. Blandine vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Blandine a arrêté l’école au cours primaire, mais a appris la couture, activité qu’elle exerce depuis six ans environs et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Parallèlement à cette activité, Blandine vend des produits divers (savons, produits de beauté) dans son quartier. Blandine achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Blandine et les autres membres du groupe AFFOSSOGBE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: AFFOSSOGBE is a group of four people who all live in the same district.  The representative of the group, Blandine (with her hand raised in the photo), is 24 years old and is married to a teacher named Romane. The couple has one child in their care who attends school.  Blandine lives with her husband and child.  Together, the couple meets the different needs of the household.  Blandine stopped attending school at the primary level, but she learned to sew.   She has been in this line of work for about six years and this brings her a considerable income.  Along with this work, Blandine sells various products (soaps, beauty products) in her area.  Blandine buys her products in Bénin.  This is the second time that Blandine and the other members of the AFFOSSOGBE group have requested a loan through ALIDé.  Their goal is to increase their working capital and the level of their work and to respond better to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap and beauty products.

loans.name: Nelvadis

texts.es: Nelvadis de 58 años de edad vive muy cerca al mar, con su cónyuge , discapacitado visual, tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 28 a 36 años y tiene un nieto a su cargo. En Puerto Colombia, municipio donde habita, se dedica a la preparación y venta de frituras; actividad a la que está dedicada desde sus 26 años de edad. En la actualidad sus principales clientes son las tiendas del municipio a quienes distribuye diariamente. Ella en su casa de madera, se levanta a las 2:00 a.m. para empezar su proceso productivo. Sus principales productos son las arepas,, carimañolas, y su especializad es la arepa de huevo. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, el cual invertirá en la compra de una olla de aluminio, en la reparación de su molino eléctrico y en la compra de materias primas e insumos para la preparación de sus productos. Su inversión será exitosa porque realizará las compras de insumos en mayor cantidad y de contado, ahorrando por los descuentos que ofrecen por esta forma de comprar. Así mismo con sus herramientas listas sus tiempos de producción son mejores y esto impactará su respuesta a sus clientes. Su sueño es tener una casa en materiales de cemento y por eso se esmera trabajando y con el apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos logrará salir adelante y cumplir su meta de cambio habitacional.
texts.en:
Nelvadis is 58 years old and lives near the sea with her husband who is visually impaired. They have four children, who are between the ages of 28 and 36, and a grandson who is under their care. In Puerto Colombia, the town where she lives, Nelvadis has a business preparing and selling fried foods. She has been in this business since she was 26. At the moment, her main customers are the stores in town that receive daily deliveries. Nelvadis lives in a wooden house and wakes up at 2am to begin her work. Her main products are “arepas” (corn patties) and “carimañolas” (meat pies), with her specialty being “arepas” with eggs.

Nelvadis is currently applying for her first Kiva loan so that she can invest in the purchase of an aluminum pot, repairs to her electric grinder, and ingredients and supplies for preparing her dishes. This investment will be successful because her purchases will be made in bulk and paid with cash. She will save money because of the discounts offered to her for purchasing in this manner. By having these same supplies, her production time will improve so that she can respond more quickly to customer orders.

Her dream is to have a cement house, so she strives to work toward that goal. With the support of her husband and children, Nelvadis will be able to move forward and accomplish her goal of having a new house.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her electric grinder and to buy an aluminum pot, ingredients, and supplies for making her dishes.

loans.name: Vivomingbe Group

texts.fr: VIVOMINGBE est un groupe D. trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Rita (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée D. 50 ans et est une veuve et mère D. quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à sa charge. Rita vit seule avec l’enfant à sa charge et assure seule ses différents besoins. Rita n’a jamais été à l’école. Il y a près D. neuf ans que Rita vend des produits divers (charbon D. bois, condiments, pain) dans son quartier. Rita exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet D. subvenir à ses besoins. Rita s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête D. la satisfaction D. sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds D. roulement, Rita sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe VIVOMINGBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes D. leur clientèle et à se faire plus D. profits.
texts.en:
VIVOMINGBE is a group of three people, whose members resiD. in the same district in Benin. The representative of the group, Rita (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 50 years old and is a widow with four children, all educated, and of whom one is still under her care. Rita lives alone with her dependent child and is the family's sole provider.

Rita has never been to school. For the past nine years Rita has been selling various products (charcoal, condiments, bread) in her neighborhood. Rita is passionate about her business activity, which enables her to support herself. Rita gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking customer satisfaction and to increase her working capital, Rita is requesting a third loan along with the other VIVOMINGBE group members. This credit loan will serve to better meet the demands of their customers and increase their profits.

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal and condiments.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”KANTUS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Patricia;  La socia tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 7, 3 años de edad, la socia se dedica a la administración de sus tienda internet, la socia trabaja atendiendo en casa su internet, ella desea en esta ocasión invertir el crédito en la compra de artículos de librería, como papales, lápiz, borradores, cuadernos, plumones entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artículos de librería como cuadernos, papeles, lapiceros, lápiz entre otros útiles escolares.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Patricia is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantus” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 32 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 7 and 3). Patricia manages an Internet café in her home. On this occasion, she wants to invest in bookstore products such as paper, pencils, erasers, notebooks, pens, and other school supplies. Therefore, she is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Patricia is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payment on schedule.

loans.use: to buy paper, pencils, erasers, notebooks, pens, and other school supplies.

loans.name: Abdou-Bariou

texts.fr:
Abdou-Bariou est un homme âgé de 42 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et n’a pas d’enfant.
Abdou-Bariou travaille comme frigoriste et vendeur de frigidaire et congélateurs depuis 2001. Il vend à ses clients dans un quartier de la place après achat au port autonome de Lomé.
Abdou-Bariou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 04 congélateurs et 20 compresseurs. Il désire rendre sa famille heureuse avec les bénéfices réalisés sur la vente de ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Abdou-Bariou is a 42-year-old man. He is married to a retail merchant and has no children.

Abdou-Bariou has been working as a refrigerating engineer and seller of refrigerators and freezers since 2001. He sells to his customers from the local neighborhood after buying from the Autonomous Port of Lomé.

Abdou-Bariou is requesting his first WAGES credit loan to purchase four freezers and 20 compressors. He wants to ensure his family's happiness with the profits from his sales.

loans.use: Buy freezers and compressors

loans.name: Maibel Antonia

texts.es: Meibel de 42 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de Barranquilla, allí se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir  de manera individual y a la medida,  y también aplica el sistema de maquila a terceros,  es decir grandes empresas le envían las piezas cortadas y ella aplica la costura.  Su negocio lo inició en el año 2000, pues en el año 1989 había estudiado modistería y con una máquina sencilla, poco a poco empezó a ganar clientela; su trabajo en la  microempresa, le ofreció la oportunidad de ahorrar y comprar 5 máquinas más y generar un empleo. Sus ventas las hace a crédito a negocios en Ciénaga ( departamento del Magdalena) y a vecinos del sector de Soledad. La necesidad del negocio es la adquisición de una cortadora industrial y una mesa de corte, porque esta fabricando jeans y es muy lento el corte con tijera.Su meta más adelante es agregar a su taller la venta de telas, ubicándose en un local en la vía principal.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una cortadora industrial, una mesa para corte , planeando mejorar  los tiempos productivos por la cantidad de productos, que a futuro con esta infraestructura puede fabricar. Su margen de contribución promedio actual es del 30,33% , mientras su rentabilidad sobre las ventas no es inferior a un 25,89% y desde aquí proyectamos su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Meibel is 42 years old and lives in the town of Soledad, which is 15 minutes away from Barranquilla. There she sews clothing that she designs herself or is designed by other people through a third-party system. In other words, large companies send her pieces to sew and she assembles the final product. Meibel started her business in 2000. She completed her fashion studies in 1989 and owned a simple machine. Over time, she began gaining customers. The work in her microenterprise provided the opportunity for her to save. She bought five more machines and was able to start offering jobs. Meibel sells her products on credit to businesses in Ciénaga (in the Department of Magdalena) and to her neighbors in Soledad. Her business needs an industrial cutting machine and a cutting table because it is very slow to cut with scissors when making jeans.

Her goal further on in the future is to combine her sewing workshop with a fabric store that is located in a shop on the main avenue. Meibel is currently applying for her first Kiva loan, which is also her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The money will be used to buy an industrial cutting machine and a cutting table. She plans to improve her production times so that she can generate more products. In the future, she will have the infrastructure to handle this. Her contribution margin currently averages around 30.33%. Meanwhile, her sales profitability is no less than 25.89%, which is a an indication of growth.

loans.use: to buy an industrial cutting machine and a cutting table.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La socia tiene una panadería y actualmente a incorporado los pasteles para la venta, ella prepara kekes de vainilla y chocolate llamados kekes marmoleados, la socia también prepara pastelitos y pie de manzana, entre otros pastelitos, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de harinas, levaduras, escencias entre otros. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de harinas, levaduras y otros.
texts.en: This member owns a bakery and has just incorporated pastries into her sales.  She prepares marbled cupcakes, which contain vanilla and chocolate batter.  She also prepares miniature pastries, apple pies, and other desserts.  The member wants to invest in the purchase of flour, yeast, essences, and other ingredients.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to use for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, essences, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou habite dans une localité du territoire  sénégalais. Elle est âgée  de 37 ans. Elle évolue dans le commerce  et la vente de tissus et prêts à porter. Elle a choisi son activité par amour. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et prêts  a porter pour les besoins de son commerce. Son objectif est de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle  en cette période d’approche de la fête  de tabaski.  L’augmentation de  ses gains financiers lui permet d’améliorer son niveau de vie et de soutenir certains membres  de sa famille dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en: Mrs. Fatou lives in a community in the territory of Senegal. She is 37 years old.  She works in the business and sale of fabric and ready-to-wear clothing.  She chose her trade out of love.  She is a member of a branch of UIMCEC. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy fabric and ready-to-wear clothing to meet the needs of her business.  Her goal is to satisfy the demands of her customers during this period leading up to the Tabaski holiday.  The increase in her financial gains will enable her to improve her standard of living and to support certain family members by taking care of their household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es:
La señora Maria, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres viven con ella.

Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros, niños,ropa interior y calzado, desde hace 8 años. Ella lo aprendió de una amiga que la invito a salir a vender y así comenzó con poquita mercadería, pero poco a poco lo fue ampliando.

La mercadería la compra en la capital del país, tarda aproximadamente dos horas en llegar allí, se transporta en vehiculo propio. A veces compra en una ciudad más cercana, que esta a una hora de distancia de su comunidad. Maria se levanta a las 4:00 de la mañana para ir a comprar la mercadería y para venderla cuando tiene que salir lejos; pero cuando es más cerca se levanta a las 5:00 de la mañana. 

Ella recorre distancias de más o menos una hora o una hora y media, esto lo hace en vehiculo propio y busca los días de comercio en cada ciudad o que tengan algun dia feriado o actividad, por que sale todos los dias.

El prestamos era invertido en la compra, de mas cantidad de ropa para damas, caballeros, niños,ropa interior y calzado, ya que comprando los paquetes, le resulta más barato y se ira preparando para la época navideña. Comprara más y a más bajo precio, lo que permitirá la obtención de mejores ganancias y crecerá al mismo tiempo su negocio. Lo que desea Maria es ampliar su cobertura y vender otra clase de productos a parte de la ropa, como es la venta de lácteos.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and a single mother of four children; three of them still live with her.  She’s been selling clothes for women, men and children, underwear and footwear for 8 years.  She learned from a girlfriend who invited her to go out selling and she started out this way with just a little merchandise but gradually expanded it.

She buys the merchandise in the nation’s capital and it takes her about two hours to get there; she transports herself in her own vehicle.  Sometimes she buys in a nearer city that’s only an hour away from her community.  When she has to go far to get it, María rises at 4am to do so to then sell it but when she goes to get it closer she gets up at 5am.  She travels distances of more or less an hour or an hour and a half in her own vehicle and she seeks out the market days in each city or if they have a holiday or special activity so she goes out every day.

She will use this loan to buy larger amounts of clothes for women, men and children, underwear and footwear because by buying the bundles it’s less expensive and she can start preparing for the Christmas season.  She will buy more for a lower price which will allow for higher profits and more business growth at the same time.  What María wants is to expand her coverage and sell other types of products, like dairy products, besides clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, underwear and footwear.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ”KANTUS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Nicanor;  El socio  tiene 68 años de edad, El socio  es casado, El socio  tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja dentro del banco comunal 4 años y el  es carpintero, el socio trabaja para diferentes obras y lo contratan por años, el también pudo invertir sus anteriores créditos en la compra de una cepilladora, un circular, y una compresora, entonces ahora cuando tiene tiempo y generalmente se da espacio, el socio realiza diversos trabajos de manera independiente de carpintería como muebles, estantes, reparaciones y otros, el socio en esta ocasión requiere el crédito para invertir en su taller de carpintería comprando herramientas varias para mejorar las que ya tienen años, el socio comprara serrucho, taladro, martillo, clavos entre otros, el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas para su trabajo, como serrucho, clavos, martillo, taladros entre otros.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sr. Nicanor is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantus” which is located in the District of Huanchac in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 68 years old, married, and has two children. Nicanor has worked with the Communal Bank for four years and is a carpenter by trade. He works on different jobs on which he has been hired over the years. Nicanor invested his previous loans in the purchase of a planer, a circular saw, and a compressor. When he has the time and the space, he also performs different independent carpentry jobs such as making furniture, shelves, or doing repair work. On this occasion, he wants a loan to invest in his carpentry workshop. Nicanor plans to buy different tools to replace the ones that he has had for years. He plans to buy a saw, a drill, a hammer, as well as nails and other supplies. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to use for this purpose.

Nicanor is grateful for this loan and promises to complete his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy a saw, a drill, a hammer, nails, and other supplies.

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr:
Dovi est un homme âgé de 33 ans. Il est marié à tresseuse et est père de 2 enfants dont un scolarisé. Le premier enfant à 7 ans et le second 3 ans. 
Dovi travaille comme menuisier depuis 2000. Il est sollicité par toutes personnes pour construire ou réparer des bâtiments à Lomé avec un apprenti. 
Dovi a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des planches dans le compte de l’exercice de son activité 
Dans les prochaines années, Dovi voudrait avoir plus de moyens pour son travail. Il prévoit avec les profits de son activité, assurer une vie heureuse à sa famille.
texts.en:
