Dovi is a 33-year-old man. He is married to a hair braider and is the father of two children of whom one is in school. The first child is seven years old and the second is three.

Dovi has been working as a carpenter since 2000. He is approached by all-comers to construct or repair buildings in Lome along with his apprentice.

Dovi has requested his fourth WAGES credit loan to purchase boards in support of his business activity.

In coming years, Dovi would like to have more resources for his trade. He expects the profits of his business will ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: Buy boards

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El socio Emilio tiene 49 años de edad, el socio es conviviente, El socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio se sigue dedicando al trabajo como maestro de construccion,el construye casas,pinta casas entre otras obras,el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar en su trabajo como maestro de construccion . El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y herramientas para su trabajo.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Emilio is 49 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. He continues at his job as a master builder. Emilio builds and paints houses, and also does other jobs. He works from 5am to 6pm. Through this job, he is able to move his children forward. Emilio wants to expand and improve his construction business, so he is requesting a loan to buy materials and tools for his work.

He is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for his work.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en: Ayesha sells cooked rice and serves it with tomato sauce, macaroni, gari, salad leaves and other items near a school at Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana.  She is married and has five children.  Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in taking care of the children. Her loan will be used to buy rice, tomatoes, cabbage and more to cook to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, tomatoes, cabbage, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of tires and inner tubes for retail sales

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua has arranged on a wooden tray a variety of smoked fish. She is married and has three children. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her income to support her husband to educate, feed and clothe her children. Ekua will use the loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and then sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence, who achieved a junior high school education, is married to a farmer and has seven children.  For the past 20 years, she has been selling food items such as fish, powdered pepper, beef, spices, canned tomatoes, yams, etc. Florence will use her loan to acquire more food items to sell and she hopes to open another shop with the increased profits arising from the loan.

loans.use: to acquire food items to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila pertenece al banco comunal “San José de Urubamba” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Cirila vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Cirila es la venta de tubérculos y granos secos como por ejemplo maíz, cebada y trigo. 

En esta oportunidad Cirila requiere el préstamo para comprar más granos secos como maíz y cebada así de esa manera poder abastecer su puesto de venta de más mercadería. 
  
Cirila agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Communal Bank “San José de Urubamba” which is located in the city of Urubamba. The members of this Communal Bank conduct their meetings every 30 days in the city of Urubamba in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

Cirila lives in the city of Urubamba, which is where she conducts her business activities. Her main business is selling tubers and dried grains such as corn, barley, and wheat. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more dried grains, such as corn and barley, so that she can restock her vending post with more merchandise.

Cirila appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy dried grains, such as corn and barley.

loans.name: Francisco Agustin

texts.es:
Francisco Agustín tiene 28 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de siete y cinco meses de edad  en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá comprar los insumos y semillas sin ningún problema.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es seguir trabajando para poder adquirir otro préstamo pero ya el monto más alto para comprar más terreno.
En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el futbol.
texts.en:
Francisco Agustín is 28 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. He lives with his wife and children (ages 7 and 5 months) in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “Dulce Sentimiento” (Sweet Feeling) is located in the Caimito II neighborhood in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This Communal Bank consists of farmers who grow short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Francisco engages in farming by growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas. His purchases and sales are conducted in the canton of Ventanas. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and farming supplies such as urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer so that he can keep his crops in good condition. This loan will be of great help because he can buy supplies and seeds without any problem.

The challenges he must face on a frequent basis include the competition and the pests. His dream is to continue working so that he can acquire another loan that is a larger amount in order to buy more land.

In his free time Francisco enjoys practicing sports, especially soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has three children. Her husband is a civil servant. She operates a chop bar (a place where people come to eat) at Takoradi, which she has done for 15 years. Some of the foods she cooks are banku with okra stew or soup, fufu with light soup or fishermen’s soup and others. Esi assists her partner to educate her children.  Esi will use the loan to purchase food items to cook to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to build a better structure.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Antero German

texts.es:
El socio Antero tiene 39 años de edad, el socio es conviviente, El socio tiene 3 hijos ; El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de distribucion de vinos y venta de vinos,el socio distribuye a diferentes negocios como tiendas de abarrotes y bares,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de distribucion y venta de vinos. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar vinos al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antero is 39 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children. He continues with his business of distributing and selling wine. Antero sells to different businesses, such as grocery stores and bars. He works from 8am to 7pm. Through this job, he is able to move his children forward. Antero wants to expand his distribution business, so he is requesting a loan to buy wine in bulk.

He is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy wine in bulk.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Agnes is into multiple trades such as the production and the smoking of fresh fish, which she has done for 10 years. Agnes uses her earnings to clothe the children. She wants to increase her stock and so the loan will be used to buy additional fresh fish to smoke to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy additional fresh fish to smoke

loans.name: Lisbet Mayra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”KANTUS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lisbeth;  La socia tiene 25 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad, la socia se dedica a la atención de su panadería, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de harinas, levaduras, para elaborar los panes, pasteles, kekes que la socia prepara en su panadería, la socia tiene una muy conocida panadería – pastelería; la socia desea ahora el préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, grageas, caritas, todo esto porque la socia elabora pan gua gua, esto quiere decir que en el mes de Octubre e inicios del mes de noviembre es tradición preparar panes guaguas, lo que quiere decir los panes los preparan en formas de bebes envueltos y esto compran las familias para todas las niñas en casa y para los varones se prepara en forma de caballo con la carita de cerámica de un caballito, esto compran para aquellos que tienen en casa un niño; esta tradición es casi una obligación en nuestro país. 
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Lisbeth belongs to the communal bank "Kantus."  This bank is located in the Huanchac district of the province and department of Cusco.

Lisbeth is 25 years old.  She lives with a partner and has a son who is 2 years old.  Lisbeth has a bakery, and she wants to invest this loan in the purchase of flour and yeast to make the breads, pastries and cakes that she prepares in her bakery.  She has a bakery/pastry shop that is very well known.  She wants a loan now to invest in flour, yeast, sprinkles and cookies with little faces to use in making "gua gua" bread, or "bread babies."  This is because in the month of October and the beginning of November, it is the tradition to prepare these "bread babies," which are breads formed in the shape of babies that have a sweet filling.  During this time of year families buy these for all of the girls in the house, and for the boys, they buy cookies in the form of a horse with the ceramic face of a little pony.  These cookies are purchased by those who have a child in the household; this tradition is almost an obligation in our country.  

Lisbeth is grateful for this loan, and she is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sprinkles, and cookies with little faces to make the traditional "gua gua" bread.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a single parent taking care of five children. She has received a junior high education. Eunice sells cooking utensils. She is a hairdresser by profession. Her business is just four years old and she wants to increase the sale of utensils by procuring other types of utensils to resell. Any profit that will be realized as a result of the loan will be used to revive the hairdressing business.

loans.use: to buy other types of utensils to sell.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena tiene 26 años, ha sido un gran éxito para ella pues tiene más de 2 años en este negocio. El ambiente de su salón es muy tranquilo y relajado la mayoría de sus clientes vienen a su local por los buenos precios que ofrece y además por ser una persona muy carismática. Ella aprendió esta actividad porque realizo un curso en un colegio técnico en donde le enseñaron manicure, pedicure entre otros. Martha está contenta por proporcionarles a sus hijos de 11 y 1 año respectivamente los ingresos necesarios. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de tintes, maquillaje, polvos, cremas, tratamientos, planchas, secadora, peines y cepillos.
texts.en: Martha Lorena is 26 years old and has had a lot of success since she started her business more than two years ago. The atmosphere of her salon is very calm and relaxed, and the majority of her customers come to her for the good prices she offers as well as her charismatic personality. She learned the trade after taking a course at a technical school that taught her how to do manicures, pedicures and other treatments. Martha is content because she provides for her two children, ages 11 and 1, with her income, which is sufficient. She is requesting the loan to purchase dyes, makeup, powders, creams, treatments, irons, dryers, combs and brushes.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, makeup, powders, creams, treatments, irons, dryers, combs and brushes.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia sigue trabajando en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de utiles escolares,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche,fideos y galletas y tambien vende utiles escolares como cuadernos,lapiceros,lapices,borradores entre otros utiles escolares,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de utiles escolares. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas y tambien para comprar cuadernos,lapiceros,libros y lapices al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Luz Marina is 32 years old, married and has two children. She continues to work at her business selling groceries and school supplies. She sells primary-need products like rice, sugar, milk, noodles and cookies, as well as school supplies like notebooks, pens, pencils, erasers and other items. She works from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m., and through these businesses is able to make headway for her children. Luz Marina wants to expand and improve her store. She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies, as well as notebooks, pens, books and pencils at wholesale. She feels happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies, as well as notebooks, pens, books and pencils at wholesale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a farmer. Her educational background is up to the junior high level. Margaret is a baker at Takoradi. She bakes bread and moves from one place to another in the early hours of the morning to sell to her customers. The loan which is going to provide additional income will be used to purchase flour, sugar, salt and others to use in baking so that Margaret can meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt and others to bake to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela de 35 años de edad vive muy cerca al mar en el Municipio de Puerto Colombia, a 20 minutos de Barranquilla; ella es casada y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, con el que sueña ofrecer las mejores posibilidades de bienestar. Mariela en su propia vivienda tiene un almacén de variedades, donde ofrece artículos de papelería, útiles escolares, ropa, colonias, calzado, accesorios femeninos. Adicionalmente ofrece el servicio de llamadas a celulares, recargas y venta de chips. Inicialmente su negocio funcionaba con una sola vitrina, pero gradualmente ha logrado capitalizar sus utilidades y su crecimiento es muy visible en infraestructura.  Mariela es una diseñadora de modas que no ejerce, porque se ha dedicado a su negocio y el tiempo es escaso para el ejercicio de su profesión. El esposo de Mariela es también comerciante y muchas veces saca de su tiempo para apoyarla en su negocio.  En la actualidad tiene planes de incrementar el volumen de sus ventas, pero el capital de trabajo no es suficiente para alcanzar su sueño. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará juguetes, ropa, especialmente para responder a la demanda de la gran clientela, que se avecina con este requerimiento en la época de Diciembre, donde rota el dinero, las ventas se incrementan y eso es lo que justamente hace de esta inversión un éxito.
texts.en: Mariela is 35 years old and lives very close to the ocean in Puerto Colombia, about 20 minutes from Barranquilla. She is married and has a 3-year-old son, from whom she dreams of providing only but the best. Mariela runs a variety store out of her home, offering stationery supplies, school supplies, clothing, cologne, footwear and female accessories. Additionally she sells and reloads cell phone cards, and sells cell phone chips. Initially her business only had a display case, but gradually she was able to capitalize on her profits and her growth is very visible in her business' infrastructure. Mariela is a fashion designer but doesn't practice her trade because she has dedicated herself to her business and the profession is scarce right now. Her husband also is a merchant, and many times he uses his time to support her with the business. Currently Mariela plans to increase her sales volume, but she doesn't have sufficient capital to stock her store. It's for this reason she is requesting the Kiva loan, her first through partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she plans to purchase toys and clothing, specifically to respond to the high demand to her customers with December looming, when her money turns over quickly and her sales increase. This is exactly why this investment will be a success.

loans.use: to purchase toys and clothing to respond to the high demand from her customers.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. She has a junior-high educational background. She makes tea and breakfast for sale in Takoradi. Mama uses her income to assist her husband to take care of the home. She will use the loan to purchase beverages, eggs, magarine and others to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, eggs, magarine and others to expand her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is standing in her shop. She sells a variety of things such as groceries, slippers and others. She is married and has 3 children. She attended junior high school. Anita uses her income to support her husband in educating, feeding and clothing their children. Anita will use the loan to buy groceries for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Anita plans to save to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy groceries for sale.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Binta. She is a widow and has three children, aged 21, 18 and 10. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because he is her relative.  

In 1994, Binta established her foodstuffs, beverages and drinks business. She began her business by selling drinks to passengers traveling to Freetown. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,300,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Binta has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase a new type of drink sold at Le 22,000 per gallon. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Binta plans to build a house and educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for foodstuffs, beverages and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. Eunice operates a food store in Takoradi where she sells a variety of dishes like rice, banku (cooked fermented cassava dough), fufu (pounded cassava and plantain dish), and others. She has done this for 6 years. Eunice uses her earnings to assist her husband in paying the utility bills. The loan will help to purchase bags of rice, cassava (starchy tuberous root), and other food items. With the new profits from her expanded business, Eunice plans to graduate to a restaurant level.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, cassava, and other food items.

loans.name: Camila Eleodora

texts.es: La Sra. Camila es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes; ella es una mujer que constantemente lucha por salir adelante y para ello se dedica a la venta de comida a pedido, ya sea a trabajadores de construcción o vecinos en general;  lleva trabajando así alrededor de 4 años, le encanta cocinar, gana aproximadamente S/. 290 nuevos soles semanalmente. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la remodelación de su cocina y la compra de accesorios de cocina. La Sra. Camila tiene el sueño o la meta de tener su propio restaurante en donde ganara mas vendiendo a sus amigos y vecinos. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Camila is a single mother. She has two grown and independent children. This mother is always fighting to get ahead, and so she sells food on order to construction workers and neighbours. She has done this for four years. She loves cooking, and makes approximately 290 nuevos soles per week. She will invest this loan in remodeling her kitchen and buying kitchen accessories. Camila hopes to open her own restaurant--this is both a dream and a goal. There she will make more money, selling food to her neighbours and friends.
She is very grateful for this loan.

loans.use: to remodel her kitchen and buy accessories (pots, cutlery, plates).

loans.name: Zoumba Group

texts.fr:
Mme Foudailatou est la représentante du groupe Z.. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 17mois. Les 03 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des habits (pagnes) depuis 03ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.

Mme veut ajouter de l’argent pour s’acheter une balle de pagnes.

Mme avec ses économies veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et épargner. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin de pagne et aider à la construction de leur maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Foudailatou is the representative of the Z. Group. She is married and the mother of four children ranging from 19 years to 17 months of age. Three of her children  are in school, and she has five dependents. 

She has been selling clothing (traditional color “pagnes” fabric) for the last three years. She stocks up at the Sector 10 market. Her clients are both men and women. She would like to increase her working capital to buy a bale of “pagnes” fabric. She would like to use her savings to help pay for her children’s education and to put money away. Her goal is to open a big store selling “pagnes” and help with the construction of the family home.

loans.use: to buy a bale of "pagnes" fabric

loans.name: Emerita Candida

texts.es: La señora Emerita Candida tiene 37 años, su actividad es una pulpería, que es atendida desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.  A pesar de no tener muchos clientes Emérita sabe brindar una buena atención  a los que llegan a comprar la variedad de productos que ofrece. Este negocio lo ha sido todo para ella es por medio de la actividad que le ha proporcionado a ella y a su familia  los ingresos necesarios. Desea realizarle mejoras a su negocio y al mismo tiempo mejorar sus ingresos. Con el crédito lograra comprar granos básicos, leche, crema, pan, huevos, fideos, refrescos y golosinas.
texts.en: Emerita Candida is 37 years old. She runs a convenience store from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. Despite not having many customers, Emerita knows how to provide good service to those who come to buy the variety of products she offers. This business has been everything to her since it has provided her and her family with necessary income. Emerita wishes to make improvements to her business and at the same time increase her income. With the loan, she plans to purchase basic grains, milk, cream, bread, eggs, noodles, beverages and snacks.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, milk, cream, bread, eggs, noodles, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana es una mujer de 46 años de edad, divorciada hace un año atrás. Tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo vive con 1 y sus 2 nietos, en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini. Diana comenta que su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de ropa. Dicha mercadería lo adquiere por mayor en las galerías de “Gamarra”, en la ciudad de Lima, una vez comprado, viaja hacia las comunidades nativas de Pichanaki y las vende, para ello, ya tiene clientes que le hacen pedidos con anticipación, por esa seguridad siempre tiene compradores fieles. Al mismo tiempo, pero en menor proporción, se dedica a las labores del campo sembrando plátanos, palta, café y frutas cítricas. Asegura que, la venta de ropa siempre ha sido rentable, con tal de captar clientes fijos. “Cuando hay días buenos mi inversión de 1000 soles, se triplica”, dice emocionada. En cuanto a los problemas que tuvo que superar, Diana menciona a la falta de capital como principal, con el tiempo y gracias a su inagotable labor, ésta emprendedora mujer piensa abrir una tienda de abarrotes para no tener que estar viajando demasiado. Con su apoyo, ella podrá obtener su préstamo número 4 de MFP, entidad de la cual se siente agradecida y comprometida a pagar con esfuerzo y puntualidad. Diana, a la vez se siente contenta trabajando con su banco comunal por que algunos de sus integrantes también se dedican a su rubro. Una vez obtenido el crédito, ella viajará a la ciudad de Lima para invertir los 2000 soles en la compra de ropa, pues ya tiene clientes asegurados para la campaña de diciembre y enero.
texts.en: Diana is 46 years old and got divorced a year ago. She has four children, of which only one lives with her along with two grandchildren in a home she owns in the native community of Pucharini. Diana says her business consists of buying and selling clothing. She acquires her merchandise at wholesale from the "Gamarra" center in the city of Lima. Once purchased, she travels through the native communities of Pichanaki and sell the items, since she has customers there who make orders in advance, so she has the security of always having faithful buyers. At the same time, although at a smaller scale, she works in the fields harvesting bananas, avocado, coffee and citrus fruits. She assures that her clothing sales have always been lucrative, attracting regular customers. "On good days my investment of 1,000 soles triples," she says excitedly. As far as problems she has had to overcome, Diana mentions the lack of her own capital as principal, but with time and thanks to her tireless work, this enterprising woman plans to open up a convenience store so she won't have to travel as much. With your support, Diana will obtain her fourth loan through Kiva partner MFP, an organization she is grateful to, and promises to work hard to make her payments. At the same time she feels content working with her community bank because some of the members also make a living in the same trade. Once she obtains the credit, she will travel to the city of Lima to invest 2,000 soles in the purchase of clothing, since she already has confirmed clients for December and January.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in the city of Lima.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a perimeter wall around her house.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”KANTUS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Norma;  La socia tiene 63 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 7 hijos; la socia se dedica a la administración de su farmacia, la socia tiene una farmacia en pleno corazón del distrito de Huanchac, la socia también realiza otras actividades que le permiten tener un ingreso extra para ahorrar, la socia en esta ocasión desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de algunos productos para la farmacia, ella implementara su farmacia y desea aumentar a sus ahorros para dar la primera inicial de los productos que le entregaran. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago inicial de la compra de mercadería para implementar su farmacia.


La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank "Kantus," which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

She is Señora Norma. She is 63 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has seven children. Her work is the administration of her pharmacy. She has a pharmacy right in the heart of the district of Huanchac. She also has other business activities that allow her to have extra income to save. At this time she wants the loan to invest in the purchase of some products for the pharmacy. She will set up the pharmacy and wants to increase her savings to make the initial payment for the products that they will deliver to her. She is applying for the loan to invest in making the first payment for the purchase of merchandise to set up her pharmacy.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the initial payment for the purchase of merchandise to set up her pharmacy

loans.name: Luis Mariano

texts.es: El Luis Mariano es un hombre trabajador que siempre está al pendiente de los que su familia necesita. El se dedica al transporte de carga pesada. Desde hace mas de 14 años  que tiene experiencia con este tipo de actividad. Luis conoce a todos sus clientes y lo que le solicitan es por eso que él se esfuerza todos los días por brindar un buen servicio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de llantas y brindarle otras mejoras al camión. Se siente muy agradecido por la confianza depositado en su persona.
texts.en: Luis Mariano is a hardworking man who is always on top of what his family needs. He works in heavy cargo transportation. He has more than 14 years experience in this type of activity. Luis knows all of his customers and what they ask of him. That is why he works hard every day to offer a good service.     The reason for the loan is to buy tires and do some improvements on he truck. He is very grateful for the trust put in his person.

loans.use: to buy tires and do some improvements on his truck.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor tiene 39 años, es una mujer felizmente casada hace 12 años. Vive en su casa propia en el caserío de Huaylahuichan a lado de sus 2 hijos y esposo. Leonor, empezó con las labores de la agricultura desde joven, poco a poco y gracias a la iniciativa de sus vecinos, pudo ingresar al negocio de la compra y venta de cuyes, los que vende cada semana, ganando de 5 a 10 soles por cuy. Del mismo modo cuenta con una bodega en su casa, ahí vende productos de primera necesidad, como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc., obteniendo de 80 a 90 soles diarios. Por su parte, su esposo se dedica al servicio de transporte con un auto de su propiedad.  “He tenido varios problemas en los últimos años, primero la falta de capital, la falta de personal, pérdidas en los sembríos, pero hemos sabido afrontarlos y ahora nos va bien”, comenta Leonor. Ella espera que después de ahorrar lo suficiente, enviar a sus hijos a la ciudad de Lima para que puedan estudiar carreras universitarias y buscar trabajos en distintos ámbitos. Y quizás con el tiempo también irse a vivir con ellos. Con éste sería el préstamo número 13 que Leonor obtendrá de MFP, por lo que necesita de su ayuda para continuar con sus metas. En cuanto a su Banco Comunal comenta que le gusta y se siente cómoda con el sistema de trabajo. Con el dinero Leonor podrá empezar una  nueva siembra para la temporada de abril y mayo, en la que cultivará arvejas, para ello comprará bolsas de abonos. Así también implementará su bodega y si hay suerte comprará una refrigeradora.
texts.en: Leonor is 39 years old. She has been a happily married woman for 12 years. She lives in her own home in the community of Huaylahuichan with her husband and 2 children. Leonor started doing agricultural work when she was young. Little by little, thanks to her neighbors' initiative, she was able to get into the business of buying and selling guinea pigs. She sells them every week, making 5 to 10 soles per cuy. She also has a small store in her house, where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, oil, etc., making 80 to 90 soles a day. Her husband works in transportation with his own car. "I have had several problems in the last few years, first the lack of capital, the lack of personnel, lost crops, but we have been able to face them and now we are fine." Leonor remarks. She hopes that after saving enough, she can send her children to the city of Lima so they can get college educations and look for jobs in different areas. Maybe after time, she will be able to join them. This loan would be the 13th that Leonor will get from MFP, because she needs help to continue with her goals. About the communal bank, she remarks that she likes it and feels comfortable with the work system. With the money, Leonor will be able to start a new crop for the season of April and May. She will plant peas, and for that she will buy bags of fertilizer. She will also outfit her store and with luck she will buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and buy products to outfit his business.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El socio se dedica  a la elaboración de tortas, panes, pasteles, y en esta ocasión preparara la maza y todos los últimos retoques de las famosas muñecas gua guas, los panes en forma de bebes envueltas con caritas de ceramica y con decoración de grageas, confites en todo el cuerpo para las ñiñas y para los niños los famosos caballos hechos en pan con la carita de caballos en ceramica, estas fiestas de todos los santos se celebra en todas las casa en especial del Cusco con panes guaguas que es una palabra quechua que significa pan  bebe y todas las familias tradicionales que tienen en casa una nena compran las nuñecas hechas en pan y los que tienen varones menores en casa compran caballitos de pan que se los pueden comer. El socio no ajenoa  a estas costumbres desea invertir el credito para la compra de harina, levadura, confites, caritas entre otros ingredientes.
texts.en: Edgar has a business making cakes, breads and pastries.  This time of year, he will prepare the dough and all of the finishing touches for the famous "gua gua" bread dolls.  These are breads made into the form of babies, and they are wrapped around little ceramic faces and decorated all over with sprinkles and candy.  These bread dolls are made for little girls, and for the boys he makes bread dolls in the form of horses with little ceramic horse faces.  The All Saints holidays are celebrated in every home, especially in Cusco, with the gua gua breads.  The name comes from a Quechua word that means "bread baby," and all of the traditional families that have a little girl in the house buy the dolls made of bread, and those that have young boys in the house buy the little horse breads so that the children can eat them.  Edgar is familiar with these customs, and he wants to invest the loan in the purchase of flour, yeast, candies, little ceramic faces, and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, candies, little ceramic faces and other ingredients

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora  Rosa, tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos.

Ella ha adquirido una excelente experiencia, en la panificación, ya que desde que nació sus padres se han dedicado a esta actividad. Cuando ella se caso instalo su propia panadería y ya tiene 17 años de estarla manejando con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ellos asisten a la escuela por la mañana y por las tardes ayudan a los oficios del hogar.

Rosa se traslada  en su vehiculo, a una ciudad del oriente del país, para comprar la harina, azúcar, manteca, levadura, entre otros ingredientes, los huevos se los van a dejar a su casa. Ella esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar mayor cantidad de esta materia prima, con el objetivo de aumentar la producción de pan y ofrecerles mejor calidad a sus clientes. 

Al producir más pan, recibirá mayores ingresos y esto le servirá para financiar el estudio de sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida. Rosa desea comprarle una casa a su hijo mayor que esta estudiando medicina, para que él este más cómodo y ella más tranquila.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old. She lives with her life's companion and their four children. 

She has acquired excellent experience in bread making. Since she was born, her parents have worked in this activity. When she got married she opened her own bakery and now she has been running it for 17 years with her husband and their four children. They go to school in the morning and in the afternoon help with the household tasks. 

Rosa travels in  her vehicle to a city in the eastern region of the country to buy flour, sugar, lard, yeast, and other ingredients. The eggs are delivered to her house. She is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy a larger quantity of these raw materials. Her aim is to increase bread production and offer her customers better quality.  

When she produces more bread, she will receive more income and this will help finance her children's studies and improve their quality of life. Rosa wants to buy a house for her oldest son, who is studying medicine, so he will be more comfortable and she will be less worried.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of flour, sugar, lard, yeast, eggs and other ingredients.

loans.name: Joshep Christian

texts.es: El socio no a cambiado de opinión y su vida tampoco a variado en estos meses, el socio Joshep continua trabajando como restaurador de cuadros de la escuela cusqueña, el socio es experto en el arte de recuperar los cuadros antiguos de la época d ela colonia, el socio se desempeña en las distintas tecnicas que relaiza para una perfecta restauracion usando los acabados finos de las antiguas pinturas y liezos, el estudió el arte con sus tecnicas y formas, sus estilos y conocedor de nuestro pasado el socio sigue realizando muchos aportes a nuestra cultura, en esta ocasión el socio sigue en el bacno comunal ya que ellos tiene en conjunto sus ahorros que les ayuda a generar sus propios intereses, el socio en esta ocasión solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de arte que en el mes de diciembre traen los artesanos al pueblo para ser exhividas y venderlas. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de uno o dos cuadros de los artesanos tradicionales.
texts.en:
The member hasn’t changed his opinion nor has his life varied in the last months.  Joshep continues working as a painting restorer in the Cusco school.  He is an expert in recovering old paintings from the colonial period.  He performs the different techniques needed for a perfect restoration using fine finishes of the old paints and canvases.  He studied the techniques and forms of art, its styles and he knows our past.  He contributes much to our culture.  

A this time the member continues with the communal bank because his savings are in an account there and they help him yield some interest.  He is requesting a loan to buy art in December since this is when the artists from the villages bring them for exhibition and sale.  He will use the loan to buy one or two paintings from the traditional artists.

loans.use: to buy one or two paintings from traditional artists

loans.name: Freddy Daniel

texts.es: El Señor Freddy Daniel, es una persona de 53 años es casado y tiene 3 hijos ya mayores de edad, el se dedica a brindar el servicio de taller de soldadura desde hace 31 años tiene de poseer esta actividad, a pesar de que es mucho tiempo siempre está aprendiendo cosas nuevas. Inicio gracias a su Papa que le enseño a realizar este negocio la mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran contentos con los trabajo que Freddy realiza. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de soldador y cortador, guantes, lentes, varillas de soldadura entre otros.
texts.en:
Freddy Daniel, 53, is married and has three children of legal age.  He has been working for 31 years offering service in a welding shop.  Despite how long it has been, he is always learning new things.  He began thanks to his father, who taught him to work in this business.  The majority of Freddy's customers are happy with his work.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a soldering iron and cutter, gloves, glasses, and solder bars, among other things.

loans.use: to buy a soldering iron and cutter, gloves, glasses, and solder bars, among other things

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a fishmonger at Takoradi. Abena has a junior high education.  She is married and has three children, and her husband is a driver.  Abena has been selling fish for 11 years. Her work supports her spouse's effort to provide education for her children. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish to smoke and then sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Neyd

texts.es: Neyd, es una joven madre soltera de 19 años pues tiene una hija de 1 año de nacida. Vive con su hermano en la comunidad nativa de Pumpuriani, en la casa de su ex pareja quién le manda una mensualidad por manutención. Gracias a la preocupación y apoyo de  Ángel, su ex pareja, hacia su pequeña hija; Neyd ha podido abrir una tienda de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en la casa. Ahí se encarga de atender a sus clientes, que mayormente son sus vecinos. De la misma manera inauguró un restaurante, donde ofrece almuerzos y cenas. “No me puedo quejar, el padre de mi hija siempre nos ayuda, a pesar de que ya estemos separados”, menciona Neyd, “la tienda es rentable, cada 15 días voy a la ciudad de Pichanaki a comprar más insumos, al día mas o menos estoy ganando 40 soles”, agrega. Unos meses más adelante, ella espera implementar su restaurante, con el servicio de comida, ofreciendo desayuno, almuerzo, cenas y quizás atender con platos extras. Con el apoyo de su prima, quién cocina, anhelan captar clientes de la zona y hasta extranjeros, “todo depende de lo duro que trabajemos”, menciona, con una sonrisa esperanzadora y a la vez tierna. Con su ayuda, Neyd podrá obtener su primer crédito con MFP, por esa razón se muestra alentada, por que sabe que con el capital ella podrá iniciar su camino hacia la autosuperación. El dinero que piensa obtener lo destinará en la ampliación de su restaurante con la compra de mesas, sillas y estantes, así como adquirir una refrigeradora para mantener su alimento en buen estado.
texts.en: Neyd is a young, 19-year-old single mother who has a one-year-old daughter. She lives with her brother in the indigenous community of Pumpuriani. She lives in the house of her ex-partner, who sends her a monthly support payment. Thanks to the concern and support of Ángel, her ex-partner, for her little daughter, Neyd has been able to open a store selling groceries and other basic products in her home. There she deals with her customers, who for the most part are her neighbors. In the same way, she began a restaurant, where she offers lunches and dinners. "I cannot complain. The father of my daughter always helps us, in spite of the fact that we are separated," Neyd mentions. "The store is profitable. Every two weeks I go to the city of Pichanaki to buy more supplies. I am earning more or less 40 PEN (about $15) a day," she adds. In a few months, she hopes to enlarge and furnish her restaurant, with food service, offering breakfast, lunch, dinner, and perhaps serve a few extra dishes. With the support of her cousin, who cooks, they want to attract customers from their district and even outsiders. "Everything depends on how hard we work," she comments, with a smile that is hopeful and at the same time tender. With your help Neyd will be able to obtain her first loan through MFP, and for this reason she looks courageous, because she knows that with the capital she will be able to begin her journey to self improvement. The money that she hopes to obtain is destined for the enlargement of her restaurant with the purchase of tables, chairs, and shelves, as well as acquiring a refrigerator to keep her food in good condition.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs and make the first payment for the purchase of a refrigerator.

loans.name: Badu

texts.en: Badu is in this picture, pouring soup on fufu in an earthen-ware bowl (in her left hand) for one of her customers. She has 4 children. Her husband is a welder. She operates a chop bar (food joint where people come to eat) at Takoradi, which she has done for 2 years. Badu will use the loan to purchase food items to cook and sell.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric, perfume and various other dry goods.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa smokes fish and chicken at Takoradi. Adjoa has received junior high education.  She is divorced and has 3 children. She is responsible for the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish and chicken to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and chicken to sell.

loans.name: El Limoncito Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El limoncito” esta integrado por nueve mejeres emprendedoras y responsables, el grupo volvi a renovar su credito, el cual la señora Maria Elena ya no prticipo sin embargo tienen una nueva integrante la señora Maribel.
Maribel  tiene 35 años D. edad está casada con el señor José quien trabaja en el campo, juntos han procreado 5 hijos, Miriam D. 15 años D. edad ya no pudo seguir estudiando por falta D. dinero, Luis Manuel D. 13 años que esta en la secundaria, Álvaro D. 11 años esta en sexto año, Isaac D. 9 años pero se encuentra en cuarto grado D. primaria y Maribel D. 8 años segundo D. primaria.
La señora Maribel es ama D. casa, su actividad ganadera es criar borregos en la actividad lleva ya 2 años D. experiencia por el momento en casa tiene 5 borregos esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar 2 o 3 borregos mas ya que quiere llegara tener mas también comenta que si le sobra comprara pastura, desparacitantes y vitaminas.
Su único problema que tiene es cuando los animales legan a enfermar ya que se llegan a morir pero esta  vez hará todo lo posible para que no le vuelva a pasar.
Una meta que tiene doña Maribel es que sus hijos terminen D. estudiar y que su hija Miriam vuelva a estudiar la prepa, también desea llegar a tener su propia casa propia.
"Gracias al crédito hemos podido salir adelante y mas que nada nuestra calidad D. vida ha mejorado y todo gracias a FRAC y KIVA"
texts.en:
The “El Limoncito” [The Little Lemon Tree] group is maD. up of nine enterprising and responsible women. The group renewed its loan again. Maria Elena didn't participate this time but there is a new member named Maribel.

Maribel is 35 years old and married to José, who works in the fields. They have 5 children. Miriam is 15, and couldn't go to school anymore due to a lack of money. Luis Manuel is 13 and in high school, Álvaro is 11 and in sixth graD., Isaac is 9 and in fourth graD., and Maribel is 8 and in second graD.. 

Maribel is a housewife and her activity is raising sheep. She has 2 years experience doing this and at this time has 5 sheep at her house. This time she has asked for the loan to buy 2 or 3 more sheep, since she wants to have more. She also remarks that is there is enough, she will also buy fodder, D.-worming medicine and vitamins.

Her only problem is when the animals get sick because they can die but this time she will do everything to avoid that happening again. One goal that Maribel has is for her children to finish their studies and for her daughter Miriam to go back to high school. She also wants to own her own house. 

"Thanks to the loan, we have been able to get ahead and more than anything, our quality of life has improved and it's all thanks to FRAC and KIVA"

loans.use: to buy 2 or 3 sheep, fodder, grass cuttings, corn and de-worming medicine.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia  se dedica a el comercio D. artículos D. hogar (electrodomésticos, sabanas, copas , focos y otras mercaderías) desD. hace diez años que se dedica a esta actividad, ofrece sus productos a distintos sectores, ya sea oficina e incluso en los mercados otorgando sus productos a crédito como al contado, los cuales los compra en la ciudad D. Oruro y posteriormente entrega la mercadería a clientes que le hacen pedido en la ciudad D. Cochabamba, vive actualmente con su esposo en domicilio D. su propiedad, solicita el crédito para compra D. mercadería como electrodomésticos para estas fiestas D. fin D. año y poder incrementar su capital D. trabajo y D. esta manera  incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Virginia has been selling articles for the home (electrical appliances, sheets, glasses, lights, and other merchandise) for ten years.  She offers her products to different groups, whether in offices and even in markets, offering her products on credit as well as for cash.  She buys in the city of Oruro and later delivers the merchandise to customers who have ordered from her in the city of Cochabamba.

Currently she lives with her husband at home on her property.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise like electrical appliances for the holidays and to be able to increase her working capital and in this way increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena fries varieties of fish to sell at a market near Takoradi. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a driver. Abena uses her income to assist her husband to take care of the home. Abena will use the loan to purchase varieties of fish to fry and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is married and has 4 children. She has been through junior high school. Nana bags corn dough in transparent bags to sell. She also sells charcoal at Takoradi, which she has done for 3 years. Her husband is a mason. The income from her sales is added to that of her husband to take care of their home. 

Her loan will be used to buy maize to make corn dough and cassava dough to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to make corn dough and cassava dough to sell.

loans.name: Olin

texts.es: Olin de 22 años de edad, es un joven padre que convive con Yeny de 19 años. Ambos tienen un hijo de 1 año. Olin aún vive solo en Pumpuriani, en una casa propia. Olin, sonriente y alegre cuenta que desde muy niño se inició en la agricultura con la siembra de maíz, plátanos, yuca y café, siendo éste último el que sustenta a la familia y le brinda algunos y escasos gustos.  Así también, Olin trabaja como obrero en obras como construcción y reparación de carreteras, cuyos contratos son por 3 meses, del mismo modo se desenvuelve como operario en parcelas ajenas. “Al inicio desconocía sobre la alza y baja del precio del café, por ejemplo en octubre siempre baja, a 5 y a 6 soles el kilo, en cambio en abril sube a 10, 11 y 12 soles”, describe como uno de los principales inconvenientes que tuvo que superar con el tiempo. Más adelante a él le gustaría casarse con Yeny y tomar las riendas de su familia, para ello debe establecer e implementar su hogar para recibirlos. De esa manera las familias de ambos se sentirán a gusto con la unión. Gracias a su ayuda, Olin podrá obtener su préstamo número 6 de MFP, con ello él podrá empezar a concretizar sus proyectos.  Olin está satisfecho con su banco comunal, siente que en grupo se puede llegar más rápido a las metas. Con el dinero, Olin podrá colocar café entre las plantaciones de plátanos. Así comprará las plantas y los 10 sacos de abono necesario, y si sobra pagará a los peones que apoyarán en el proyecto.
texts.en:
Olin is 22 and a young father. His girlfriend is Yeny, who is 19.  Together, they have a one-year-old son.  Olin still lives alone in Pumpuriani, in his own home.  Olin was smiling and happy when he told us that he started working in agriculture when he was very young by growing corn, plantains, yucca, and coffee.  Coffee was what supported his family and offered them limited luxuries.  Olin also works some in construction and repairing highways.  His contracts for this work are for 3 months at a time.  He works operating equipment on other pieces of land.  "At first, I was unfamiliar with the rise and fall of coffee prices, for example, in October, it always lowers, to between 5 and 6 soles per kilo.  But in April in climbs to 10, 11, or 12 soles."  He describes one of the biggest inconveniences of this work as having to face the weather conditions.

In the future, he would like to marry Yeny and take the reins of his family.  To do that, he should establish and fix up his home to receive them.  In this way, both of their families will feel comfortable with their marriage.  Thanks to your help, Olin will be able to obtain his sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  With it, he will start to fulfill his projects.  Olin is satisfied with his communal bank.  He feels that he can reach his goals more quickly as part of a group.  With this money, Olin will be able to plan coffee between his plots of plantains.  He will buy coffee plants and 10 sacks of the necessary fertilizer.  If he has enough left, he will pay workers to help him with this project.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and 10 sacks of fertilizer, and to hire temporary workers.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida de 26 años, es una mujer soltera, con 2 hijos de 9 y 1 año.  Después de la separación con el padre de sus hijos, sólo vive con sus dos hijos en una casa propia. A pesar de ello, no se amilana y trabaja la tierra, por que es lo que le gusta hacer y lo que sabe hacer muy bien. A su corta edad, ésta madre joven siembra plátanos, café, paltas, yuca, etc. Lida muestra seguridad cuando se trata de comandar sus cultivos. Ante ello Lida menciona: “anteriormente lo que nos dificultaba era el personal, no tenía el apoyo de amigos ni familia, pero tenía que recurrir a préstamos para contratar personas”. Además menciona que la mala yerba había destruido gran parte de sus sembríos, situación que ha sabido manejar con esfuerzo. Cuando sus 2 hijos crezcan, Lida espera tener el dinero suficiente para tener una bodega bien surtida y equipada, del mismo modo trabajar la tierra paralelamente. Con éste serían 6 los préstamos que obtendría de MFP, por esa razón ella necesita de mucha ayuda para conseguir lo que se trazó como meta. A Lida le encanta trabajar con su banco comunal por que son personas que están siempre alrededor suyo y comparten los mismos ideales. Con el dinero Lida podrá comprar abono para los cultivos de café y plátano, cuyo precio asciende a 120 soles la bolsa.
texts.en:
Lida, 26, is a single mother with two children, ages 9 and 1. After separating from her children's father, she lives alone with her kids in their own home. In spite of that, she isn't discouraged, and works as a farmer because that is what she likes to do and what she knows how to do well. This young mother plants plantains, coffee, avocados, yucca, etc. Lida shows confidence when it comes to taking care of her crops. She says "before our biggest difficulty was staff, not having the support of friends or family, but I had to take out loans to hire laborers." She also mentions that weeds destroyed a lot of her plantings, a situation that she has learned to manage through hard work.

When her two children grow up, she hopes to have enough money for a well-stocked store and to also continue farming. This will be her 6th loan with MFP. She needs a lot of help to achieve her goals. Lida loves to work with her village bank because they are people who are always around her and share the same ideals. With the loan money, Lida will be able to buy manure for her coffee and plantain crops, which costs 120 soles per bag.

loans.use: to buy sacks of compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar-cane to sell.

loans.name: Khadim

texts.fr: Monsieur Khadim est âgé de 28 ans. Il vit au Sénégal. Il s’active dans le secteur de l’aviculture et est en meme temps surveillant. Il a choisi son métier par nécessité  dans  le but d’augmenter ses revenus. Il est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2005. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000frs prévu pour l’achat de poussins et d’aliments en vue de renforcer ses sujets. Il souhaite préparer une bonne  opération de vente  de poulets d’ici un mois. Son souhait est d’élargir son activité et avec l’augmentation de ses revenus il  pourra améliorer son niveau de vie et soutenir ses proches.
texts.en: Monsieur Khadim is 28 and he lives in Sénégal. He works in the poultry field and is also a monitor. He chose his trade out of necessity in order to grow his income. He has been a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC since 2005. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs intended to buy chicks and chicken feed in order to grow his flock. He hopes to have a good operation selling young chickens in a month's time. His desire is to expand his business and with the expansion of his income, he will be able to improve his living conditions and support those near and dear to him.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloths to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome pertenece al banco comunal “San José de Urubamba” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Salome vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Salome es la venta de cereales y menestras. Ella tiene una puesto de venta en unos de los mercados de la ciudad de Urubamba.    

En esta oportunidad Salome requiere el préstamo para comprar más cereales como trigo, cebada, avena, kiwicha y otras más. 

Salome agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Salome belongs to the “San José de Urubamba” community bank in the city of Urubamba, province of Urubamba, department of Cusco, Peru. The group meets every 30 days in Urubamba, where Salome lives and makes a living. Her principal activity is selling grains and legumes. She has a sales post at one of the markets in the city. At this time she is requesting the loan to purchase more grains, such as wheat, barley, oats, amaranth and others. Salome is grateful and values the loan, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more grains, such as wheat, barley, oats, amaranth and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase provisions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and other food items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Yeni Adriana

texts.es: Yeni Adriana tiene 23 años, ella es docente de primaria lamentablemente con lo poco que gana no había podido realizarle las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda. Ella trabaja todos los días, es por eso que quiere realizar este crédito es para la compra de bloques, arena, piedrín entre otros. Este es uno de sus sueños el poder realizarle las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda ya que se acerca la temporada de verano y así podrá construir. Yeni es una mujer trabajadora y agradece el financiamiento que será utilizado en los productos necesarios.
texts.en: Yeni Adriana is 23 years old. She is an elementary-school teacher but sadly with the little money she makes she has not been able to make necessary improvements to her home. She works every day, and she is requesting the loan to purchase blocks, sand, gravel and other items. This is one of her dreams, to make the necessary improvement to her home since summertime is approaching and she will be able to work on it. Yeni is a hard-working woman and is grateful for the loan, which she will use to purchase the necessary products.

loans.use: to purchase blocks, sand, gravel and other items.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is married and has 2 children. She has received junior high education. Dorcas sells gari (flour made from cassava tubers) and fried fish in Takoradi, which she has done for 5 years. She assists her husband to take care of the home. Dorcas will use the loan to acquire more fresh fish to fry for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dorcas plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to acquire more fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda pertenece al banco comunal “San José de Urubamba” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Eduarda vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Eduarda es la elaboración y venta de helados de hielo y de crema. Ella tiene su taller en su domicilio en la ciudad de Urubamba.     

En esta oportunidad Eduarda requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, tintes, cremas y otras cosas más. 

Eduarda agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Eduarda belongs to the communal bank "San José de Urubamba" in the city of Urubamba. The meetings of the members of the communal bank are held every month in the city of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Eduarda lives and has her businesses in the city of Urubamba. He principal business is the preparations of ices and ice cream. Her workshop is in her home in the city of Urubamba.

At this time Eduarda needs a loan to buy ingredients such as sugar, coloring, cream, and other items.

Eduarda is grateful for and values the loan and promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, coloring, cream, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks, chicken feed, and veterinary products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to procure chicken, fish and meat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain frozen fish to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet de 25 años de edad, convive hace 5 años con Daniel, ambos vieron nacer a 2 hijos que ahora tienen 6 y 2 años. Esta familia vive en una casa alquilada en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini. A Janet le gusta lo que hace, todos los días de feria viaja a la ciudad de Pichanaki y vende ropa la que compra en cantidades mayores de la ciudad de Lima. De igual forma cuenta con un negocio en la ciudad de Lima, ahí vive su hermana y juntas realizan los movimientos de compra y venta; “el oficio es rentable, por que se obtiene ganancias semanalmente”, explica Janet. Muchas veces la falta de capital impidió que ésta joven madre sea constante con el negocio. Otro tiempo de inconvenientes aún no han vivido, pero es consciente de que tarde o temprano vendrán periodos difíciles.
Por su parte, Daniel se dedica integralmente al campo, sembrando plátanos y maíz, constituyendo otros ingresos que giran alrededor de la agricultura, ya sea para seguir sembrando o para gastos de abonos. Con su ayuda, Janet podrá obtener su préstamo número 4 de MFP, entidad de la que se siente agradecida y respaldada por la ayuda que brinda a los sectores más humildes pero progresistas. Ella y su banco comunal guardan sentimientos de confianza y gratitud. Con el dinero, Janet podrá invertir en la compra de ropa al por mayor en todas sus variedades, polos, chompas, pantalones, etc., y expenderlas en la ciudad de Pichanaki.
texts.en:
Janet is twenty five years old and lives with her partner, Daniel, and their two children, who are six and two years old. Their family lives in a rented house in the native community of Pucharini. Janet enjoys what she does, every festival day she travels to the city of Pichanaki and sells clothes that she purchases in large quantities in Lima. She also has a business with her sister who lives in Lima, and together they take care of all the purchasing and selling. Janet says, “the work is profitable because it brings in weekly earnings.” Many times, the lack of capital kept this young mother from being consistent with her business. They have not faced another time of hardship, but she is conscious that sooner or later difficult times will come.
Daniel only works in the field, planting bananas and corn, which makes other agricultural-related income, be it to continue planting or to cover fertilizer costs. With your help, Janet will be able to obtain her fourth loan from MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma]. She feels very grateful for and supported by the help MFP offers the most humble but progressive sectors. She and her communal bank feel confidence and gratitude. The money will allow Janet to purchase a wide variety of clothes wholesale – shirts, sweaters, pants, etc., and sell them in Pichanaki.
.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga pertenece al banco comunal “San José D. Urubamba” D. la ciudad D. Urubamba. Las reuniones D. las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad D. Urubamba D. la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Dominga vive en la ciudad D. Urubamba y donD. realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal D. Dominga es la venta D. comida en la ciudad D. Huayllabamba ósea a la ciudad esta a unos 15 minutos D. la ciudad D. Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Dominga requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, verduras, menestras, cereales y otras cosas más. 

Dominga agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Dominga belongs to the San José D. Urubamba communal bank in the city of Urubamba. Every month, the members of the communal bank meet in Urubamba, which is in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cuzco.

Dominga lives in the city of Urubamba, where she engages in economic activities. Her principle economic activity is to sell food in the city of Huayllabamba, which is about 15 minutes from Urubamba. She has spent several years in this business, and it continues to go well for her.

At this time, Dominga needs a loan to purchase ingredients, such as rice, vegetables, beans, grains, and other items, for example.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients, such as, rice, vegetables, beans, grains, and other items, for example.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and other food items to cook and sell.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucy Jacqueline tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 4 hijos a los cuales ha criado sola a base de mucho trabajo.
Ella forma parte del grupo “Fortaleza” formado por 7 integrantes los cuales residen en el distrito de Carabayllo.
La Sra. Lucy Jacqueline se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado, inició hace dos años vendiendo solo ceviche y poco a poco fue aumentando los platos de comida para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad.
Con su trabajo ha logrado darles estudios a sus hijos, brindarles las necesidades básicas en su hogar.
Con el préstamo recibido alquilará un local en una zona comercial para instalar un restaurante con la mira de más adelante lograr tener un local propio para desarrollar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucy Jacqueline is 42 years old, single, and has four children who she has raised through lots of work.
She is part of the Fortaleza group, which consists of seven members who live in the district of Carabayllo.
Lucy Jacqueline sells food at the market. She started two years ago just selling ceviche, and has slowly added other dishes to offer her customers a greater variety.
Through her work, she has managed to educate her children and offer them basic necessities at home.
Lucy Jacqueline will use the loan to rent space in a commercial area to open a restaurant, while looking ahead to managing to have her own space where she can develop her business.

loans.use: To rent space for a restaurant.

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: Madame Penda habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 34 ans.  Elle s’active dans le commerce et vend du poisson au marché de sa localité. Elle a choisi son activité par nécessité. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2004. Elle a déjà remboursé 1 crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poissons destinés a augmenter l’offre quotidienne  pour ses clients en anticipant sur  la commande auprès  de ses fournisseurs. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus  pour mieux se prendre en charge et soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Madame Penda lives in Sénégal. She is 34 and she works selling fish at the market in her locality. She chose her activity by necessity. She has been a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC since 2004. She has already reimbursed one prior loan. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 100,000 francs intended to expand the amount of fish she can make available to her customers daily by ordering from her suppliers ahead of time. This loan will allow her to earn more so that she can better support herself and help her husband cover the expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food items to cook and sell.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime de 27 años de edad es soltero y sin compromisos. Vive en la casa de sus padres con algunos de sus hermanos en la comunidad de Pucharini. Jaime se entrega su tiempo y dedicación a dos actividades, una de ellas es la agricultura. En sus parcelas de terrenos agrícolas que su comunidad les designa, siembra piñas, paltas, café y plátanos. Por otro lado, con una camioneta que heredó de sus padres, brinda servicios de transporte a pobladores que trasladan sus productos desde sus comunidades hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki. “Estos dos negocios son rentables, por que de la siembra obtengo cada ciertos meses, pero del transporte saco dinero diario, los dos me convienen”.
Quizás por tener pocas responsabilidades en la vida, Jaime no ha experimentado fracasos hasta el momento, pero aún así anhela tener una familia e hijos, a los que mantendrá y cuidará, “siento que puedo solventar una familia y hacer cargo de ella, es uno de mis deseos para más adelante, además de tener una casa propia”, confiesa algo avergonzado. Mediante su ayuda, Jaime obtendrá su préstamo número 4 de MFP, por esa razón promete ser puntual en sus pagos y constante en la organización y participación en su banco comunal, de l que se siente agradecido. Si se concretiza el crédito, comprará abonos para sus extensas parcelas, lo cual calcula costará 800 soles. Del mismo modo invertirá en semillas de piñas para esta nueva temporada.
texts.en:
Jaime, who is 27 years old, is single and without commitments. He lives in his parents' house with some of his brothers in the community of Pucharini. Jaime gives his time and dedication to two activities; one of them is agriculture. In his parcels of agricultural land that his community designates, he plants pineapples, avocados, coffee, and bananas. On the other hand, with a truck that he inherited from his parents, he offers transportation services to the people who carry their products from their communities to the city of Pichanaki. "These two businesses are profitable, because from the planting I obtain earnings every few months, but the transportation brings in money daily. The two work out well for me."

Perhaps because he has few responsibilities in life, Jaime has not experienced failures up to this time, but even so he yearns to have a family and children, whom he will support and care for. "I feel that I can support a family and be responsible for it. It is one of my desires for the future, besides having my own house," he confess with some embarrassment. Through your help, Jaime will obtain his fourth loan from MFP, and for this reason he promises to be punctual in his payments and steadfast in the organization and participation in his communal bank, for which he feels thankful. If his loan is approved, he will buy fertilizer for his extensive parcels of land, which he calculates will cost 800 PEN. In the same way, he will invest in pineapple seedlings for this new season.

loans.use: to buy pineapple seedlings and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Fatou Dia

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de trois enfants.Son mari n'étant pas pourvu de beaucoup de moyens, elle s'est engagée dans le commerce de produits alimentaires pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins et participer à la prise en charge des frais d'entretien de la famille.Elle vend des arachides, du mil, des haricots et d'autres produits divers.Actuellement, elle sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter 2 sacs de mil de 50kg , 1 sac d'arachide de 50 kg et 1 sac de haricot de 50kg.Elle ambitionne de remplacer la table sur laquelle elle vend ses produits par une cantine devant son domicile.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married woman, mother of three children. As the resources provided by her husband were insufficient, she began the commerce of food products to support herself and participate in managing household expenses.

She sells peanuts, millet, beans and various other products. She is currently applying for a loan of 100,000 francs to purchase two 50-kg bags of millet, one 50-kg bag of peanuts, and one 50-kg bag of beans.

She is hoping to replace the table on which she sells her products by a shop in front of her home.

loans.use: buy two 50-kg bags of millet, one 50-kg bag of peanuts, and one 50-kg bag of beans

loans.name: Mercedes Susy

texts.es:
Susy pertenece al banco comunal “San José de Urubamba” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Susy vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Susy es la elaboración de tejidos con maquinas de coser y también de forma artesanal. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Susy requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana y hilo. 

Susy agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Susy belongs to the “San José de Urubamba” community bank in the city and province of Urubamba, department of Cusco, Peru. The group meets every 30 days in Urubamba, where Susy lives and makes a living. Her principal activity is making woven products, using a sowing machine and knitting. She has dedicated herself to this business for a number of years and it is going very well. At this time, Susy is requesting the loan to purchase materials for her work, such as wool and thread. She is grateful and values the loan, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wool and thread.

loans.name: San Ramon Solidarity Group

texts.es: La Delmi Raquel y Martha Lorena  conforman el grupo solidario San Ramón. Delmi se dedica a la venta de comida, refrescos y postres desde hace mas de   9 años que tiene este negocio, su otra compañera también tiene la misma actividad económica por lo que juntas han sabido sobrellevar los problemas que se le presentan. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, platos desechables, refrescos, azúcar, café, entre otros. Ellas están felices por el préstamo y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Delmir Raquel and Martha Lorena form San Ramón Solidarity Group. Delmir has made a living selling food, beverages and deserts for more than nine years. Martha also makes a living in the same activity, so together they have been able to cope with problems that have arisen. They are requesting the loan to purchase rice, beans, oil, disposable plates, beverages, sugar, coffee and other items. They are happy about the loan and promise to make their payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, disposable plates, beverages, sugar, coffee and other items.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora  Catalina  se dedica  a la  venta de artesanías  desde hace veinte años, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque de él se mantiene.
Tiene  cuarenta y ocho años de edad  es dejada  pero eso le da más fuerzas para enfrentarse a la vida.
Tiene la cantidad de  cuatro hijos dos se le murieron  y le quedaron  dos mujeres  Ofelia Catalina  de treinta años  y Luz de veinte ocho años de edad.
Está muy contenta con el crédito   por que  gracias a  eso puede seguir  asiendo lo que más  le gusta que es  bordar.
Pidió el préstamo para comprar  más: manta, hilos  de colores, hilo de ceda blanco  e hilo para maquina.
Uno de sus sueños es  seguir trabajando  y hacer  un local para exhibir sus huipiles,  sus batas y sus  blusas  que están bien bonitas.
Si  quisiera  tener otro negocio sería  el de vender  ropa para bebes  que es lo que más le gustaría parte de bordar.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo  que le ha dado para seguir trabajando y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Catalina has been selling crafts for 20 years. She likes her works very much because it supports her. She is 48 years old, and her husband has left her, but that gives her more strength to face life.  She has four children; two have died and two women remain, Ofelia Catalina who is 30 years old and Luz who is 28 years old.

Catalina is very happy with the loan because thanks to it she can continue doing what she likes which is embroidery. She has asked for a loan to buy more fabric, different colored thread, white silk thread, and sewing machine thread.
