For her part, Hida is available when he needs her, whether to clear the sown fields and harvest.  They don't neglect any aspect of their lives, since harmony and trust live in their home.

Paúl would be very happy if, through your help, he can continue devoting himself to his family and his land, since the loan would be his sixth with MFP.  "I am happy about MFP because of the credit, and with my communal bank for the trust I find there."

With the money he will buy bags of fertilizer at 120 PEN each.  He needs seven bags per hectare, and will supplement with his savings.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Vivogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement VIVOGBE est formé de douze personnes qui se connaissent de par leurs activités. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Félicienne est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Félicienne est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Godence. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Félicienne assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Félicienne vend des tissus et des chaussures dans sa région ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Parallèlement à cette activité, Félicienne vend des fournitures scolaires. Félicienne achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Félicienne et les autres membres du groupement VIVOGBE sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur fonds de roulement, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The VIVOGBE group consists of twelve people who became acquainted through their activities. Felicienne, the representative of the group, is the one raising her hand in the photo.

Felicienne is 40 years old and is married to a mechanic named Godence. The couple has five children, all under their care. Some of the children attend school. Felicienne and her ​​husband share responsibility for the various household expenses.

Over the past twenty years Felicienne has been selling fabrics and shoes in her area. Alongside this activity, Felicienne also sells school supplies. She gets her supplies in Benin.

This is the first time Felicienne and other members of the VIVOGBE group have sought a credit loan from Alida. This loan will allow them to strengthen their business and increase their working capital in order to better meet their customers' needs.

loans.use: Buy fabrics and shoes.

loans.name: Erick Crisantos

texts.es: En la comarca Wiscaral localizada en las afueras de Estelí, zona conocida por sus suelos fértiles para siembra, vive Erick, de 33 años , un joven agricultor de hortalizas, casado, padre de tres hijos de 13,9 años respectivamente y el ultimo un bebe de tres meses. El empezó en este negocio desde, muy joven cuando termino su secundaria. Empezó sembrando hortalizas en las tierras de su padre, después aprendió a lidiar con el ganado, ordeñar vacas, ayudarlas a parir y criar terneros  actividades propias del campo, su familia ha sido su principal apoyo ya que son muy unidos y trabajan como un solo equipo según nos cuenta Erick. El realizo el préstamo para comprar 4 novillos para vender y reproducir. Ya que podrá reproducir un ganado de mejor calidad, porque posee buenos pastos pero no tiene muchos animales para reproducir, así que el préstamo la ayudara mucho a poder aprovechar al máximo los recursos. Su próxima meta es mejorar la raza del ganado , mejorar las condiciones de la finca.
texts.en: Erick lives in the region of Wiscaral located on the outskirts of Esteli, an area known for its fertile planting land. Erick, a young vegetable farmer, is 33 years old, married and the father of 3 children aged 13 and 9 years and a baby of 3 months. He started out in the business as a young man on finishing secondary school. He started by planting vegetables on his father's land. Later he learned to deal with livestock, milk cows, help them give birth and raise male calves, activities appropriate for the countryside. His family has been his main support as they are very close and work as one team so Erick tells us. He took the loan to buy 4 male calves for breeding and selling. He will be able to breed livestock of a better quality because has good pasture but he does not have many animals for breeding. This is why the loan will help him a lot to make full use of his resources. His next goal is to improve the breed of cattle and improve the farm's condition.

loans.use: to buy 4 male calves for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary  Luz es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito J., provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad, es conviviente  y tiene un hijo.  Ella cuenta con estudios superiores.
La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicita un préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementará al capital de su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de combustible.  Piensa comprar un cilindro de combustible (gasolina y petróleo), en sus tiempos libres vende artículos artesanales. Trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja en otra institución.
Su sueño es tener su casa  y tener un grifo grande, lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la unió y el compañerismo entre las socias.
texts.en:
Mary Luz is a member of the communal bank "Santa Rosa de Lima", which is loacted in the district of J., in the province of Chucuito and department of Puno. She is 19 years old, lives with a partner and  has a child. She has higher education. 

She is a new member having recently started working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos. She is asking for a loan of S/. 500.00 nuevos soles (PEN), money which will increase her working capital. She sells fuel. She is thinking of buying a gas and petrol cylinder. In her free time she sells handicrafts. She works her business alone. Her husband works in another institution. 

Her dream is to have her own house and have a large tap. What she likes about her communal bank is the unity and camaraderie between the members.

loans.use: to buy a gas and petrol cylinder

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos,  dos de ellos  independientes.  Estudió la secundaria pero no puedo culminarla.
La señora se dedica a la venta  de artículos artesanales, bordados en bayeta (tela) y compra y venta de ovinos y porcinos, trabaja más de once años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles dinero comprará diez metros de bayetas, lanas de diferentes colores para realizar matices, cultura y paisajes.
Ella cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos en el negocio, su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Arequipa.
Su sueño es tener una tienda de artesanías.  Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y el compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a member of the communal bank "Santa Rosa de Lima", located in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito and department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married and has 6 children, 2 of them independent. She studied at high school but was not able to finish. 

The lady sells handicrafts, embroidered material, and buys and sells sheep and pigs. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than 11 years. Her first loan was for the sum of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles (PEN). 

With this new loan of S/. 500.00 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy 10 metres of cloth, wool of different colours to use for shade, culture and landscapes.

She has the help of her children with the business. Her husband works in the city of Arequipa.

Her dream is to have a handicraft shop. What she likes about the communal bank is the punctuality and sharing with the members.

loans.use: to buy 10 metres of cloth and different colours of wool.

loans.name: Sisimukha A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sisimukha A Group in Western Kenya! Lena is the facilitator of the Sisimukha A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Lena takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Lena had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Lena was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Lena and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Lena will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Sisimukha A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture, the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Makutano Star Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Makutano Star Group in Western Kenya! Irene is the facilitator of the Makutano Star Group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Irene takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Irene had a good maize yield harvesting nine bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Irene was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irene and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Irene will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Makutano Star Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Bidii S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii S.H.G Group in Western Kenya! Solomon is the facilitator of the Bidii S.H.G Group. Some members of this group joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and are re-joining for a third season!

Solomon takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Solomon had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Solomon was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Solomon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Solomon will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Bidii S.H.G Group will each plant between ½ and 1.5 acres of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al banco comunal “San José de Urubamba” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Maria vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Irene es trabajar en unos programas especiales de educación del estado. Ella también se dedica a la agricultura ósea vende y comprar choclo.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Maria requiere el préstamo para comprar choclo.   

Maria agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the communal bank "San Jose de Urubamba" of the city of Urubamba. The members of the communal bank meet every 30 days in the city of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Maria lives in the city of Urubamba where she carries out her economic activities. Irene's main business is working in one of the state's special educational programs. She also farms or rather she sells and buys corn. She has been doing this work for several years now and she is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

This time Maria needs the loan to buy corn.

Maria is grateful for and values the loan and agrees to make her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Umoja S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Umoja SHG Group in Western Kenya! Samuel is the facilitator of the Umoja SHG group. Some members of this group joined One Acre Fund as early as 2010 and are now entering their third season with the program.

Samuel takes care of three children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access very competitive input prices. In the recent 2011 season, Samuel had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Samuel was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samuel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Samuel will pay for school fees and other major annual expenses.

In 2012, the members of Umoja SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria Del Carmen se dedica a la destace de cerdo y venta de nacatamales.  Maria tiene 1 hijo a su cargo que ha sacado adelante gracias a este negocio es que podido brindar los gastos necesarios de su hogar. Siempre está buscando la manera de innovar con su negocio ofreciéndoles buenos precios a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos ya que tiene buenas ofertas para comprar.
texts.en: Maria Del Carmen butchers pigs and sells tamales. Maria has 1 child under her care who she has raised thanks to her business with which she has also been able to cover her household expenses. She is always looking for ways of innovating her business by offering her customers good prices. She is asking for the loan to buy pigs as she has been offered some good deals.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mulembe Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mulembe in Western Kenya!  Alex is the facilitator of the Mulembe. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alex takes care of three children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Alex had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alex was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alex and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Alex will pay for major family expenses such as school fees.

In 2012, the members of Mulembe will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photo, Alex is pictured with his group members and at the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Villa Rica Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana Rosa, tiene 34 años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos pequeños. Ella forma parte del grupo Villa Rica formado por 7 integrantes residentes del distrito de Carabayllo, en la zona de Villa Rica.
Ella se dedica a la venta de chocotejas, inició su negocio hace dos años, aprendió la preparación en una institución que brinda apoyo y capacitación a las zonas con menos recursos en Lima, como toda persona emprendedora e innovadora para aumentar sus ventas empezó a  variar  los modelos de los chocolates, por lo que es requerida para la preparación de chocotejas para ocasiones especiales o con motivos especiales.
Gracias a su trabajo ha brindado estudios a sus hijos y comprar artículos de primera necesidad para su casa.
Una de sus metas es tener un negocio propio o una pequeña empresa de chocolatería.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en insumos para la preparación de chocolates para poder atender los pedidos que ya tiene en espera.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana Rosa, 34, is single and has three small children.  She is a member of the communal bank Villa Rica which is comprised of seven members from the Carabayllo district in the Villa Rica area.

She sells "chocotejas" (chocolate covered pecans or nuts and caramel) for a living and started her business two years ago.  At an institution in Lima that supports and trains low-income communities she learned how to make the chocolates.  Being the enterprising and innovative person she is, in an effort to increase sales she began to introduce variations of the chocolate and now has many chocoteja orders for special occasions and events.

Through her work she has been able to give her children an education and buy essential items for the household.  One of her goals is to have her own business or a small chocolate company. She plans to use the loan to buy ingredients to prepare the chocolates so she can fill the orders she already has.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make chocolates.

loans.name: Subira Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Subira Group in Western Kenya! Ridah is the facilitator of the Subira group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ridah takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ridah had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1.5 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ridah was only able to harvest one bag of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Ridah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Subira group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Shake

texts.ru:
Шаке 33 года , родилась ,выросла  и живет в любимом  городе Капан.Она окончила Капанскую среднюю школу.                В 1997 году вышла замуж и живет с мужем.Имеет трех сыновей – по 13, 10 лет а младшему из них 2 годика.
Шаке  с 2007года  занимается частным предпринимательством  и имеет свой продовольственный магазин в родном городе Капан, где она продает конфеты, сладости, молочные и мясные изделия,масло, соки, хлебо-булочные продукты и тд. Бизнес у Шаке семейный - во всем ей помогает муж, который  закупает продукты для магазина  в оптовых рынках в Капане а так-же привозит из Еревана . Шаке уже имеет постоянных клиентов в городе, которые уже многие годы предпочитают сделать свои покупки из магазина Шаке.  Не смотря на то что у Шаке нет высшего экономического образования ,она хорошо знает толк в бизнесе и сама справляется с бухгалтерскими и другими учетами связанныими с магазином.Шаке с мужем работают почти без выходных и по этому с воспитанием детей им помогают их родители .
Шаке нужен кредит 900.000 армянских драмов для покупки  новых продуктов для Новогодней  и Рождественской продажи.
texts.en: Shake is 33 years old.  She was born, raised and still lives in her beloved town of Kapan.  She graduated from the Kapan secondary school.  Shake got married in 1997, lives with her husband and their three sons, who are 13, 10 and 2 years old.  Since 2007, Shake has been involved in private enterprise and has her own food market in her native town of Kapan.  She sells candy, sweets, dairy and meat products, oil, juice, bakery goods, etc. there.  This is a family business, and her husband helps her with everything.  He buys products for the store at wholesale markets in Kapan and also in Yerevan.  Shake already has loyal customers in town, who have preferred to make their purchases from Shake's store for many years.  Despite the fact that she does not have a higher economics education, she understands business well and handles accounting and other financial matters relating to the store.  Shake and her husband work almost without days off, and this is why their parents assist with raising their children.  Shake needs a loan in the sum of 900 000 Armenian dram to buy new products for the New Year's and Christmas sales.

loans.use: to buy a new products for the New Year's and Christmas sales

loans.name: Siyambula Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Siyambula Group in Western Kenya!  Florence is the facilitator of the Siyambula group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Florence  takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Florence had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Florence was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Florence and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Florence will pay for major annual expenses such as school fees for her children.

In 2012, the members of Siyambula group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture, the field officer is standing on the far left holding a child.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is from the village Sameba, South Georgia. He is 30 years old, married and lives with his family (wife, Nazibrola, 11 year-old son and 8 year-old daughter). The children go to school. The primary source of income for the family is agriculture. They have a dairy farm with 6 milk cows and 5 calves. Levan sells milk to a local milk processing company.  Along with the dairy farm, the family owns 0.5 hectare of land, where potatoes are grown. Levan sells potatoes in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). Also, Levan works as a shepherd.  During most parts of the day he is in the pasture. 

Levan requested credit for the renovation of the cattle-shed, as it is already old and needs some improvement before winter comes. Also, a big part of the loan will be used for purchasing two additional milk cows. The family will get more milk and increase their income, which will be used for proper education of the children and better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows and materials for a cattle-shed renovation

loans.name: Hope W.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Hope Women's Group in Western Kenya! Beatrice is the facilitator of the Hope Women's Group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now re-enrolling for a 3rd planting season.

Beatrice takes care of two children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 25 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Beatrice was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Beatrice will invest in key assets such as livestock and pay for major expenses such as school fees.

In 2012, the members of Hope Women's Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca tiene  44 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales nada mas uno vive con ellos el cual estudia el preparatoria. Ella se dedica principalmente al cultivo de aguacates dice que aproximadamente tiene unos 200 árboles y también cultiva flor de cempasúchil ya que en la temporada de día de muertos es cuando tiene ventas altas. Ella platica que cultiva de todo un poco como frijol, maíz, avena, trigo, calabaza etc. dice que desde muy joven su familia le enseño al cultivo de diferentes plantas, ella está muy contenta por los créditos que le ha hecho la financiera por que poco a poco está haciendo realidad su sueño que es el tener una huerta propia y el ver que sus árboles están dando fruto esa es su satisfacción, dice que con el crédito ella comprara mas platas de aguacate y fertilizantes y abonos orgánicos para que ayuden a sus árboles a dar fruto de mejor calidad. Francisca sale a vender a la central de abastos de una población cercana a su localidad.
texts.en:
Doña Francisca is 44 years old, married, and has three children. Only one child lives with her and attends preparatory school. Francisca spends most of her time growing avocados. She says that she has approximately 200 trees, but she also grows marigold flowers for the Day of the Dead since she experiences high sales during that holiday. In addition, Francisca mentions that she grows small amounts of beans, corn, oats, wheat, squash, and other crops. As a young girl, her family taught her how to grow different types of plants.

She is very pleased with the loans she has received because they have helped her to gradually fulfill her dream of having her own orchard. In order for her trees to bear fruit that is to her liking, Francisca says that she will buy more avocado plants, fertilizers, and organic compost. These supplies will help produce fruit of better quality. Francisca sells at the central supply depot in a nearby town.

loans.use: to buy avocado plants, fertilizers, and organic compost.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: Don Rogelio tiene 53 es casado y vive con una hija que es madre soltera y su nieto de un año, el se dedica desde hace 5 años al cultivo de aguacate, el sale a venderlo a una ciudad cercana a su población en la central de abastos. Dice que cuando no es temporada de aguacate se dedica a la venta de guajolotes y venta de borregos como dice el “hay que hacerle a todo mientras sea honrado el trabajo” el es muy trabajador ya que es el sustento de su familia, platica que hay días que tiene que salir a trabajar a otra ciudad en la construcción para poder sacar lo de los pagos y para seguir invirtiendo en su huerta. Platica que él está pidiendo un crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abonos e insecticidas para que den fruto de mejor calidad y quiere comprar una bomba para regar sus árboles.
texts.en: Rogelio is 53 and married. He lives with one of his daughters, who is a single mother, and his one-year old grandson. He has been growing avocados for five years and sells them in a nearby city at a wholesale market. When it is not avocado season he works selling turkeys and lambs. He says, "You have to do everything you can as long as it is honorable work." He works very hard to provide for his family. Rogelio tells us that some days he travels to another city to work in construction to make money, so he can invest in his farm. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides to improve the quality of his fruit. He also wants to buy a pump to water his trees.

loans.use: grow and sell avocados

loans.name: Simana A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Simana A Group in Western Kenya! Isabela is the facilitator of the Simana A group. Most of the farmers in this group joined One Acre Fund in 2010 and are now enrolling in their third planting season with the program.

Isabela takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Isabela had an excellent maize yield harvesting 32 bags on 2 acres of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Isabela was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 2 acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Isabela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Isabela will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Simana A group will each plant  between ½ and 2 acres of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Don Juan tiene 53 años de edad, el tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 12 años la cual la tiene en su casa, el está muy contento porque dice que ha tenido buenas ganancias por que la carretera que pasa por su casa la están arreglando y la están pavimentando y eso lo tiene muy contento porque así su localidad será más conocida, ahí es muy conocido por el cultivo de aguacate de muy buena calidad. Don Juan está pidiendo un crédito para surtir su tienda de abarrotes el comprara aceite, frijol, arroz, huevo, leche, atún, chiles, papel higiénico etc. Don Juan dice que el comprara en diferentes tiendas de una población cercana a su comunidad donde le dan precios bajos. Dice que gracias al crédito él puede tener su tienda surtida para que sus vecinos no se trasladen a otras localidades lejanas.
texts.en: Juan, 53 years old, has run a small general store out of his home for the past 12 years. He is satisfied with his business because he has made a good living. He is also encouraged that they are improving and paving the highway near his home because it will make his store better known. The area is well-known for having excellent avocados. Juan will use the loan to purchase products for his store. He will buy products such as cooking oil, beans, rice, eggs, milk, chilis, and toilet paper. He says that he will buy the products from various stores in a nearby town where the prices are lower. He is thankful for the loan because he can stock his store so that his neighbors do not switch to other shops in other communities.

loans.use: restock his general store

loans.name: Felix Manuel

texts.es: Félix Manuel tiene su negocio que es la venta de frutas y verduras. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo de 16, 17 y 19 años respectivamente. Tiene más de 22 años de poseer esta actividad, Félix siempre ha sido una persona luchadora y al mismo tiempo muy trabajador. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que ha demostrado que ha aplicado el financiamiento en lo que él se ha propuesto. El crédito es para la compra de tomates, cebollas, bananos, naranjas entre otros. El desea aumentar sus ventas con más productos.
texts.en: Félix Manuel sells fruit and vegetables for a living.  He has three children in his care, aged 16, 17 and 19.  For over 22 years he has been in this business.  Félix has always been a hard-working, determined person.  This not his first loan which shows that he has applied previous financing toward his goals.  This loan will be used to buy tomatoes, onions, bananas and oranges, among other items.  He is intent on increasing product sales.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, bananas, and oranges to increase sales.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis tiene 18 años, es soltero y dice que ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios porque sus padres no tenían los recursos para solventar sus gastos de la escuela. Pero dice que la mejor herencia que sus padres le han dejado es el trabajar la tierra. Dice que también él se dedica a la construcción en la capital del país ya que es donde le pagan un poco mejor y que de ahí sacara para dar los pagos del crédito. El pidió un crédito para la compra de plantas de aguacate por que quiere hacer su propia huerta que es su gran sueño él dice “quiero hacer mi propia huerta para tener algo en donde trabajar y hacerme responsable y tener algo propio para cuando me case pueda sostener a mi familia”. Dice que cuando es temporada de Aguacate el ayuda a sus padres a vender el fruto en diferentes poblaciones. Luis está agradecido por la oportunidad de darle un crédito y de tener confianza en él”.
texts.en: Luis is 18 years old. He is single and says that he could not continue his studies because his parents did not have the resources to pay for his schooling. However, he says that his parents have given him the skills and knowledge to work the land. When it is not growing season, he works in construction in Mexico City, where they pay higher wages, so he can make loan payments. He applied for the loan to purchase avocado trees because he wants to make his own orchard. He says, "I want to have my own orchard to have a place that I am responsible for and that I can use to provide for my family when I get married."  During avocado season he works with his parents selling the fruit in different towns. Luis is thankful for this opportunity and that people are confident in him.

loans.use: grow and sell avocados

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe tiene 82 años es casado y vive solo con su esposa en una población llena de vegetación, donde tienen unos paisajes hermosos, el se dedica desde hace 5 años a cultivar aguacate en su casa ya que tiene un terreno muy amplio y veía a sus hijos que si le dejaba ganancias y después el decidió iniciar su propio negocio de cultivo. El está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de plantas de aguacate, abonos, fertilizantes e insecticidas para el cultivo de sus aguacates. Dice que ya ha tenido varias cosechas las cuales sus hijos le ayudan a vender en una población donde hay una central de abastos donde los venden a muy buen precio.
texts.en:
Felipe is 82, married, and lives with his wife in a village full of vegetation and beautiful landscape. For the past five years, he has grown avocados at his home. He already had a lot of land and saw that his grown children were able to make a profit at it. He decided to start his own farming business. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase avocado plants, fertilizers, and insecticides to better grow his avocados. He says that he has already had various harvests. His sons help him sell the avocados for a good price in a village with a central market.

loans.use: purchase avocado plants, fertilizers, and insecticides to help him in the cultivation and sale of avocado

loans.name: Tuinuane A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tuinuane  in Western Kenya!Gladys is the facilitator of the Tuinuane A. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Gladys takes care of three children at home, together with his wife.  He joined One Acre Fund  in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season,Gladys had an excellent maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,Gladys was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Gladys and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales,Gladys will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tuinuane A will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Hope B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Hope B Group in Western Kenya! Elidah is the facilitator of the Hope B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Elidah takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Elidah had a very good maize yield, harvesting 7 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elidah was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elidah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Elidah will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Hope B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The person standing on the far left in the photo is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina tiene 41 años es casada y tiene dos hijos que estudian en la secundaria, ella dice “yo tengo varios trabajos por que la vida es muy cara en mi localidad y tengo que ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de los muchachos de las escuelas”. Dice que desde hace 6 años tiene su tienda de abarrotes en un local que tiene a un costado de la carretera, dice que los últimos 4 meses no ha tenido  buenas ventas por que están arreglando la carretera por que no estaba en buenas condiciones, dice que con la nueva carretera la gente de su localidad se beneficiara por que habrá mas turismo ya que cerca hay una zona arqueológica y un santuario de mariposas monarcas. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito por que una parte lo invertirá en surtir la tienda de abarrotes ella comprara jabón, leche, refrescos, enlatados, papel higiénico, pañales, café, focos, etc. y otra parte la invertirá en material para hacer coronas para los muertos ya que en el mes de noviembre en su país festejan a los difuntos y ella hace los arreglos los cuales los vende en la central de abastos de una población cercana a su localidad. Ella esta muy agradecida por que le hacen el crédito ya que podrá comprar lo necesario para hacer las lindas coronas con flores que vende.
texts.en:
Carolina is 41 years old, married, and has two children studying in secondary school. She says, "I have several jobs as it is very expensive to live in my town and I have to help my husband out with the boys' school fees." She says that for the last six years she has had a roadside grocery store and that sales have been bad for the last four months because they are repairing the road, which was in poor condition. She says that the new road will bring benefits to the locals as it will increase tourism to the nearby archaeological site and the monarch butterfly sanctuary. 

Carolina is by asking for a loan to invest one part in stocking up the grocery store. She will buy soap, milk, soft drinks, canned goods, toilet paper, diapers, coffee, light bulbs, etc.. The rest she will invest in materials for making wreaths for the dead, as November in her country is the time when the dead are celebrated. She makes the flower arrangements, which are sold in a central supply site in a nearby village. She is very appreciative of this loan, as it will allow her to buy what she needs for making these nice floral wreaths that she sells.

loans.use: to buy grocery supplies and items for making wreaths for the day of the dead.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña Nico como de cariño tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales la mayor estudia la secundaria y el menor la primaria.  Ella es originaria de una comunidad donde la principal fuente de empleo es el cultivo de maíz, aguacate y guayaba. Platica que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de temporada, surte sus frutas a diario en la central de abastos a las 4 de la mañana ya que es la fruta y la verdura mas fresca y sale a venderla en el mercado, ella esta pidiendo un crédito para invertirlo en sus verduras. Abecés ella cultiva, el maíz, chayotes, calabaza, rábanos para así ganarle un poco mas de ganancias. Esta muy contenta con el crédito que le harán por que surtirá un poco mas de frutas y legumbres, la meta que tiene es poner un negocio estable ya que anda con sus cubetas ofreciendo por el mercado y eso abecés la cansa.
texts.en: Doña Nico, as she is affectionately known, is 35 years old. She is married and has two children. The oldest is in middle school and the youngest is in primary school. She is from a community where the main source of income is growing corn, avocados and guayaba. She remarks that she sells fruits and vegetables in season. She stocks her fruit every day from the distribution center at 4 a.m., since the freshest fruit is there. She goes to sell it in the market. She is asking for  loan to invest in her produce. Sometimes she grows corn, chayote squash, pumpkins, and radishes to make a little more income. She is happy with the loan that she will take out which will stock her fruit and vegetables a little more. Her goal is to have a stable business, since she goes around selling with her buckets in the market and sometimes this is tiring.

loans.use: to sell fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Federica

texts.es: Doña Federica tiene 58 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos pero ya todos casados, ella se dedica a hacer costuras desde hace poco mas de 10 años dice que su mama fue que le enseño hacer las costuras como almohadones, servilletas, manteles, etc. ella ofrece sus costuras casa por casa en su localidad y a veces se va a los tianguis a venderlas, doña Federica esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material ella comprara tela, hilos, aros, agujas, estambre etc. dice que esta muy contenta por que con el crédito podrá tener material, la meta que tiene la señora es invertir en frutas y verduras para vender.
texts.en: Federica is 58 years old. She is married and has 4 children, all of them married. She has done sewing for a little more than 10 years. She says that her mother taught her to sew and embroider things like pillow cases, napkins, tablecloths, etc. She offers her embroidered items from the locale she has in her house and sometimes she goes to sell it in street markets. Federica is asking for a loan to buy materials. She will buy fabric, thread, rings, needles, worsted yarn. etc. She says she is very happy with the loan because with it she will be able to have materials. Her goal is to invest in fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to do artisanal embroidery.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is a 58 year-old farmer from the village of Gantiadi, South Georgia.  He is married and lives with his wife, Mzevinar. 

Merab and Mzevinar have 7 milk cows. They sell milk locally to a milk processing company. Also, the family grows potatoes on family owned land. Merab sells harvested potatoes in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

Merab requested a loan for purchasing 5 or 6 calves. He will grow the calves during the winter months and sell them in spring for a higher price. The family will earn additional income, which will be used for improving family members’ living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Evangelisto

texts.es: Evangelisto, de 52 años de edad, originario de Estelí un humilde campesino, que se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de ganado, el padre de 4 hijos, casado. Dos de sus hijos mayores trabajan on el en el campo y los otros dos están en la escuela. Sus comienzos fueron muy difíciles para el porque no contaba con muchas herramientas ni maquinaria para trabajar tenia que alquilar bueyes para arar la tierra , tenia que cuidar durante jornadas enteras sus siembras para que no le robaran o los animales entraran al campo a comerse sus siembras poco a poco fue surgiendo como agricultor por si solo, con la ganancia que obtenía la fue ahorrando  y con eso compro  su  propia tierra para trabajar también compro sus vacas para criar ganado y venderlo. Hoy en día su familia lo ayuda con las labores del campo, pero su casa esta en deterioro debido a las fuertes lluvias que esta sufriendo  el país. Es por ello que esta solicitando del crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para ir reparando su casa poco a poco. Con el crédito podrá comprar parte de los, materiales que necesita  y que sus hijos ya no esta  sufriendo por las malas condiciones del techo debido a las goteras que tiene. Por lo pronto quiere mejorarles las condiciones de vida a su familia y salir adelante con su negocio de venta y crianza de ganado.
texts.en: Evangelisto, 52, is a humble peasant from Estelí.  His business is agriculture and livestock farming, and he is married and the father of four children.  His two older children work in the fields and the other two are in school.  His beginnings were difficult because he had no tools or machinery to work with so he had to rent oxen to plough the land.  For entire days on end he would stand guard to prevent thieves or animals from damaging the crops.  Little by little he became a crop farmer on his own and was able to save enough to buy his own land.  He also bought a cow to start raising livestock.  Now his family helps with the field work but his house is in disrepair because of the heavy rainfall in his country.  This is why he is requesting a loan to buy construction materials so he can repair the house little by little.  He plans to use the loan to buy part of the material he needs to repair the holes in the roof so his children don't suffer.  He wants to improve his family's living conditions and get ahead in his livestock business.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for home repair.

loans.name: Sarait

texts.es: Sara como de cariño le dicen tiene 23 años es casada desde hace 7 años, ella tiene un niño el cual estudia el preescolar, platica que se dedica a vender productos por catalogo de plástico para cocina de una reconocida marca, dice que comenzó este negocio por que su suegra la invito a que vendiera y vio que si tenia ganancias y para ayudarle con su esposo decidió emprender el negocio, ella vende con sus conocidas los productos por que los vende en pagos, dice que esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera platica que la animo su suegra por que le explico que es una buena oportunidad para invertir en su negocio, dice que comprara, recipientes de plástico de diferentes tamaños, flaneras, moldes de gelatina, jarras, vasos, azucaras, paneras, platos, cucharas etc. ella esta muy emocionada por que dice que podrá surtir su negocio y tendrá que ofrecer a sus clientas.
texts.en: Sara, as she is affectionately known, is 23 years old. She has been married for 7 years and has a son in pre-school. She says that she sells plastic kitchen items from a recognizable brand via catalog. She started this business because her mother in law invited her to do it, and she saw that it was profitable, so to help her husband she decided to start the business. She sells the products to her acquaintances in installments and says that she is asking for a loan because her mother in law explained to her that investing in her business is a good opportunity. She says she will buy different sized plastic containers such as flan and gelatin molds, pitchers, cups, sugar bowls, bread baskets, plates, spoons, etc. She is very excited because she can stock her business and have something to offer her customers.

loans.use: to sell plastic items via catalog.

loans.name: Subira B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Subira B Group in Western Kenya! Wyclife is the facilitator of the Subira B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Wyclife takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Wyclife had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Wyclife was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Wyclife and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Wyclife will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Subira B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to sell fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Chikaze A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chikaze A in Western Kenya! Leonard is the facilitator of the Chikaze A. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Leonard takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Leonard had an excellent maize yield harvesting 23 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Leonard was only able to harvest nine bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Leonard  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Leonard will educate his children, ensure food security and save for the future of his family.

In 2012, the members of Chikaze A will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photo, Leonard is pictured with his group, at the far left is the field officer and in the front is a child in a red vest.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Blanca Ligia

texts.es:
Desde hace 30 años Blanca Ligia se dedica a la confección directa y a terceros, es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha soñado con tener un mejor futuro, y por ello trabaja con gran esmero para hacer progresar su negocio. Hoy en día quiere mejorar el servicio, y para ello debe comprar una máquina recubridora que agilice el proceso de confección y le de mayor calidad a sus productos terminados, pero Blanca no cuenta con la suma de dinero necesaria para la compra de la máquina, por lo que solicita un préstamo con que hacer dicha compra, pues es conciente que así su negocio tendrá mayores pedidos y nuevos clientes.

A sus 57 años de edad y como madre de 2 hijos su único propósito es llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida, mejorar las ventas y la capacidad de producción y finalmente estabilizar su difícil situación económica.
texts.en:
For 30 years Blanca Ligia has been sewing for other people and third parties.  She is an enterprising woman who has always dreamed about having a better future.  She works very hard to grow her business.  In an effort to improve her service she must buy an overlock sewing machine which will facilitate the sewing process and lend greater quality to the finished product.  Blanca does not have enough money to buy the machine so she is requesting a loan for the purchase, especially since she knows it will bring in more orders and new customers.

At her 57 years of age and as the mother of two children, her only goal is to have a better lifestyle, increase sales and production capacity, and eventually stabilize her difficult economic situation.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Leyla Maria

texts.es: Leyla Maria de 54 años, es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de artesanía. Desde hace mas de 8 años que tiene este negocio, fue desarrollando su negocio con capital propio, anteriormente ella fue ayudante de ventas en el mercado, fue debido a este negocio que decidió establecer su propio negocio. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de cintas, bolsas, pinceles y pinturas. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar materia prima necesaria para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en: Leyla Maria, 54, is a hard-working woman who sells handicrafts.  She started her business over eight years ago using her own capital to develop it.  Previously she was a sales assistant at a market and because of that business she decided to branch out on her own.  She is requesting a loan to buy ribbons, bags, brushes and paints.  She has many goals for her business and wants to buy the supplies she needs to make her products.

loans.use: To buy ribbons, bags, brushes and paints.

loans.name: Luz Marleny

texts.es:
Perseverancia, fortaleza y dedicación, son buenas palabras para describir a Luz Marleny, quien a sus 52 años de edad, viuda y madre cabeza de familia de 5 hijos, fue desplazada por la violencia del municipio de Uraba en el departamento de Antioquia y llego a la ciudad de Medellín con sus hijos y nada más que algunas prendas de vestir, sobreviviendo de la ayuda de sus familiares.

Actualmente Luz Marleny, vive con sus hijos en una casa que construyeron por la indemnización por la muerte de uno de sus hijos, el cual fue soldado profesional, allí en la parte trasera de la casa construyo 2 marraneras pequeñas donde cría las cerdas con la ayuda de sus hijos, aunque por el momento solo puede adelantar 6 cerdos cada 3 meses a causa de la falta de espacio que es una de sus mayores dificultades.

El sueño de Luz Marleny, es ampliar sus marraneras y lograr engordar cerdos de diferentes tiempos de gestación con el fin de sacar mensualmente una producción a la venta, por eso luz tiene la necesidad de un préstamo, para poder comprar cuido, insumos necesarios para el cuidado de los que tiene actualmente con el fin de conseguir mas recursos para ir acumulando dinero y lograr su sueño en compañía de sus hijos mejorando así sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Perseverance, strength and commitment are good words to use to describe Luz Marleny.  At 52 years of age, widowed, and in charge of a family of 5 children, Luz Marleny was displaced by violence from the town of Uraba in Antioquia department and brought her children to the city of Medellín.  All they had with them was some clothes and they survived thanks to the help of their family members.

Luz Marleny currently lives with her children in a house that they built with the compensation they received on the death of one of her children who was a professional soldier.  In the area behind her home she built two small pigsties where she raises pigs with the help of her children.  However, right now she can only manage to look after six pigs every three months owing to a lack of space, which is one of her main difficulties.

Luz Marleny's dream is to expand her pigsties and fatten pigs with different gestation times in order to have pigs available to sell every month.  She  needs to take out a loan so that she can buy feed and the supplies she needs to care for the pigs she currently has.  Her aim is to make more income so that she can accrue some money and, together with her children, achieve her dream of improving their income and their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies for the pigs that she fattens

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 23 years old and a farmer from the village Gantiadi, South Georgia. He married recently and lives with his wife Eka. The main source of income for the young family is agricultural business, which is led by Nodar. Eka is a teacher in local school. 

Nodar and Eka have 4 milk cows. They sell milk locally to a milk processing company. Also they have 2 hectare of land, 0.2 hectares of which is used for potato growing. Nodar sells harvested potatoes in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). The rest of the land is used for mowing. Nodar uses hay for feeding cows in the family dairy farm. 

Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris (approximately 480 USD). Nodar has requested credit for purchasing calves. He will grow the calves in winter and sell grown calves in spring for higher price. The family will get additional income. They plan to reinvest half of it for further development of the family farm, and use the other half for purchasing household goods, in order to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Jairo Antonio se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, el es un hombre de familia responsable tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 6 años a su cargo. A pesar que la situación esta difícil por el precio de la gasolina, el no se desespera porque todos los días se prepara para trabajar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra  de llantas, gasolina, repuestos para su automóvil.  Este es su segundo crédito que realiza y lo va a invertir en la comprar de la materia prima necesaria.
texts.en: Jairo Antonio provides a transport service.  He is a responsible family man who has two children, aged 4 and 6, in his care.  In spite of the fact that his situation is difficult owing to the price of gas (petrol), he does not become discouraged and every day he gets himself ready to work.  He is requesting this loan to buy tires, gas and spare parts for his vehicle.  This is his second loan and he will invest it in buying necessary raw materials.

loans.use: to buy tires, gas (petrol) and spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Ajijimu Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ajijimu Group in Western Kenya! Wycliffe is the facilitator of the Ajijimu group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Wycliffe takes care of 15 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Wycliffe had a good maize yield harvesting four bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Wycliffe was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Wycliffe and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Wycliffe will educate his children and save for future use. 

In 2012, the members of Ajijimu group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photograph, he is pictured with his group members and the Field Officer is on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Darlin Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Darlin Marcelino está agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito. El se dedica a la venta de leche, cuajada y crema. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es que la producción de leche el tiempo de verano disminuye. Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compra de leche y poder obtener los derivados como queso, crema, leche agria entre otros. Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas del negocio. Desea aumentar los ingresos del negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Darlin Marcelino is grateful for your cooperation on his previous loan. His business is selling milk, curds and cream. One of his main challenges is that his milk production decreases over the summer. He is requesting a loan to invest in buying milk from which to obtain derivative products such as cheese, cream, leche agria (fermented milk), etc. He plans to repay his loan with the profits he makes from his sales. He would like to increase his income from his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Nícolas Florentino

texts.es:
El Señor Florentino, tiene 50 años de edad y vive en una aldea rural del municipio de San Marcos, Santa Barbara. Esta casado, tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales 2 están estudiando.
Su actividad económica es la agricultura, dedicado específicamente a la producción de granos básicos y mantenimiento de una pequeña finca de café.
El se inicio sus labores en la agricultura desde muy joven. Dispone de un terreno que le fue heredado de sus padres. El cual ha logrado hacer producir con mucho trabajo, empeño y dedicación. En la actualidad produce maíz y frijoles que le sirven para consumo y venta.
Su experiencia crediticia la obtuvo manejando créditos de la modalidad grupal con lo cual las ganancias obtenidas las invirtió para ampliar las áreas de producción. En la actualidad esta trabajando con un crédito de manera individual.
Se siente motivado a seguir con su negocio productivo ya que considera que le generan buenas ganancias si maneja bien el crédito.
A futuro planea utilizar sus ganancias para poder comprar más tierra y heredarla a sus hijos y producir más.
texts.en:
Florentino, age 50, lives in a rural village in the San Marco municipality in Santa Barbara.  He is married and has eight children; two of them are in school.

His business is farming.  Specifically, he devotes himself to the production of basic grains and maintaining a small coffee farm.  He started doing farm work when he was very young.  He has land that he inherited from his parents.  He has managed to make the land productive through a lot of work, determination, and dedication.  He currently produces corn and beans, which are used for personal consumption and to sell.  

He got his loan experience handling group loans, which he used to expand the production areas.  He is currently working with an individual loan.

He is motivated to continue with his productive business.  The business generates good income if he manages his loan well.

In the future he plans to use his income to buy more land to bequeath to his children and to produce more.

loans.use: to plant beans and corn and for maintenance on his coffee farm.

loans.name: Lutaso Inyakho B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lutaso Inyokha B Group in Western Kenya! Simon is the facilitator of the Lutaso Inyokha B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Simon takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Simon had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Simon was only able to harvest four bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Simon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Simon will educate his children and ensure that the family has enough food.

In 2012, the members of Lutaso Inyokha B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Rut Maria

texts.es:
A sus 34 años de edad Ruth es una mujer y madre emprendedora que ha luchado por el bienestar de sus hijos, trabaja cada día con la ilusión de progresar y sacar su negocio adelante, Ruth se dedica a la confección a terceros pero actualmente enfrenta una dificultad con la máquina ya que su funcionamiento no es el adecuado y debe comprarle un repuesto, pero ella no cuenta con el monto de dinero necesario para comprar el repuesto, por lo que solicita un crédito que invertirá en el arreglo de la máquina, y compra de insumos para la confección como hilos telas botones y otros.

Ruth sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, para ello quiere mejorar el servicio en calidad y efectividad, así mejorarán las ventas y sus ingresos se incrementarán logrando estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
At the age of 34, Ruth is an enterprising woman and mother who has fought for her children’s wellbeing.  She works every day with the hope of making progress and of moving her business forward.  Ruth manufactures clothing for third parties but she’s currently facing the problem that one of her sewing machines stopped working properly and she has to buy a replacement part for it but she does not have enough money to do so.  She is asking for a loan, therefore, to pay for the machine’s repair and to buy sewing supplies like fabric, thread, buttons and others.

Ruth dreams with improving her and her family’s quality of life and to do so wants to improve the quality and efficiency of her work so that sales will improve and income will increase thus attaining economic stability.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and to repair a sewing machine.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda una madre abnegada de 2 hijos de 14 y 1 año de edad convive con Walter, su pareja hace 16 años. Olinda y su familia viven en la casa de su tía en el caserío de Huaylahuichan. La principal actividad a la que se dedica junto a su esposo, es la agricultura, en las parcelas de su propiedad y algunas que son arrendadas, siembran arvejas, papas y maíz. A la vez se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, los que vende a 15 y 18 soles. Olinda es una mujer hogareña, mientras Walter se encuentra en el campo, ella cuida de sus hijos y se encarga de preparar los alimentos. Olinda cuenta que, a veces en la siembra de maíz, solo recupera lo invertido, “eso se debe a las heladas y enfermedades, y por no saber como aplicar los insecticidas”, agrega. Con el pasar del tiempo ella se ve en la ciudad de Lima, viviendo con su familia, ya que Kevin, su hijo mayor, terminará de estudiar la secundaria y piensa matricularlo en una academia para que tenga posibilidades de estudiar una carrera universitaria o lo que él elija. Con éste sería el crédito número 13 que Olinda obtendría de MFP, por eso ella necesita de su ayuda para concretar sus proyectos. Lleva un buen tiempo trabajando con su banco comunal, de lo que menciona sentirse bien y cómoda con los integrantes de su grupo. El dinero del préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de arvejas, 3 sacos de abonos, lo que asciende a 1500 soles por parcela, y Olinda piensa sembrar en 2.
texts.en:
Olinda is a self-sacrificing mother of two children who are 14 and 1 year old.  She lives with Walter, her partner of 16 years.  Olinda and her family live in her aunt’s house in the hamlet of Huaylahuichan.  Her main activity is farming with her husband on parcels they own and some that they lease.  They grow peas, potatoes and corn.  She also raises guinea pigs that she sells for 15 and 18 soles.

Olinda is focused on her home.  While Walter is in the fields she takes care of the children and prepares the meals.  Olinda relates that sometimes with the corn crops she only recuperates her investment.  “This is due to the freezes and illnesses and not knowing how to apply insecticides correctly,” she adds.  

In time, she sees herself and her family living in the city of Lima since Kevin, her oldest son, will finish secondary school and she hopes to enroll him in an academy so that he’ll have the opportunity to study a university career or whatever he chooses.

This will be Olinda’s 13th MFP loan.  She needs your help to make her projects a reality.  She’s been working with the communal bank for some time and she mentions that she feels good and comfortable with her fellow members.  The money from the loan will be used to buy pea seeds and three sacks of manure which adds up to 1500 soles per parcel and Olinda plans to plant on two parcels.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and three sacks of manure.

loans.name: Serzhik

texts.ru:
Сержик  родился 1983г. в  селе Н.Анд(N.Hand) Сюникской области. Имеет среднее образование.В данный момент работает в Капанской Дорожно-ремонтном управлении . Сержик женат и  имеет двух дочерей - трех и двух лет.  
Сельскохозяйственным бизнесом занимается почти 7 лет и имеет в деревне Н.Анд  собственый земельный участок где выращивает овощи. Кроме того у него есть крупно рогатый скот, свиньи ,пчелы(14 улей).Сержику в хозяйстве помогает его жена .Вместе с женой он реализует овощи из огорода на рынках Сюникской области а мясо, молоко и мед у него покупают постоянные скупщики прямо из дома .
Сержик получал  кредит от Kiva и раньше срока погасил его. Благодаря кредиту он добавил количество пчелиных улей и получил большой прибыль от продажи меда.
Сержику нужен кредит 700.000 армянских драмов, для покупки корма для свиней на зиму и для покупки новых улей.
texts.en:
Serzhik was born 1983 in the village in the Syunik region. He has a high school education and is working at the Kapan road-building management. Serzhik is married and has two daughters - three and two years old.

He has been engaged in agricultural business for almost seven years and owns the land where they grow vegetables. In addition, he has cattle, pigs, and 14 bee hives. Together with his wife, they sell vegetables from the garden in the markets of Syunik as well as meat, milk and honey that wholesalers purchase from his home.

Serzhik received a loan from Kiva and it paid off ahead of schedule. Thanks to the loan, he added the number of bee hives and got a big profit from the sale of honey. He is asking for a loan for 700,000 drams for the purchase of feed for pigs in the winter and to buy new hives.

loans.use: To buy feed for the pigs and  add the number of bee hives

loans.name: Morocollo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MOROCOLLO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Basilia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, venta de comida, agricultura, venta de pollo, tienda de barrio. 

La señora Basilia  indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tienda de barrio y de verduras desde años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de víveres) para la tienda que comprará de La Paz y lo comercializa en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
A.C. “MOROCOLLO” will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Achacachi which consists of 9 members and is lead by a board headed by Señora Basilia. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses among which are: trade, food sales, farming,sale of chickens, grocery store.

Señora Basilia says that this is the first time she works with Pro Mujer at the invitation of a promoter. Currently she has a grocery store and a vegetable store which she has run for many years.

The loan she will currently take out is to increase her merchandise (to buy groceries) for the store which she will buy in La Paz and sell in her neighbourhood. This kind of workflow allows her to generate the resources to support her family all she can as she lives with a partner and has 3 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César un hombre fuerte y empeñoso de 39 años de edad convive hace 18 años con Irma, su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 6 años de edad. Esta familia vive en una casa rústica qu él mismo construyo propia en el anexo de Cochayoc. Sus tierras son ricas en minerales, por esa razón no vacila al momento de sembrar sus productos en cantidades considerables. La agricultura es su vida, la tierra le ha enseñado como sobresalir junto a su familia. En sus terrenos propios siembra arvejas de las distintas variedades, así también zanahorias, lechugas, espinacas, papas, habas, maíz etc. “he aprendido a distribuir mis terrenos, por que todas mis cosechas se venden bien, principalmente las arvejas”, comenta. Por otra parte también se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacas, ovejas y cuyes, los que engorda cada 4 meses y los vende para la ciudad de Huancayo, “los animales de Tarma son bien solicitados para distintas partes y eso nos conviene”, cuenta César orgulloso de su ciudad.
Las inclemencias del tiempo han sido sus peores adversarios, situaciones que ha sabido controlar con la experiencia de tantos años. Gracias a su ayuda, César obtendría su préstamo número 9 de MFP, entidad de la que se siente agradecido por haberle permitido conseguir una estabilidad económica y deseos de progreso, junto a su banco comunal. Con el dinero del crédito podrá adquirir 20 sacos de abonos que ascienden a la suma de 2400 soles, con lo restante comprará semillas para la siembra de papas, cuya cosecha estima estará lista para el mes de mayo.
texts.en:
César is a strong and earnest 39-year-old man who has lived with his partner Irma for 18 years and with whom he has 2 children aged 18 and 6. This family lives in a rustic house that he himself built in the annex of Cochayoc. His land is rich with minerals and for this reason he doesn't hesitate at planting his seeds in significant quantities. Farming is his life. The land has taught him how to excel together with his family. On his own land, he plants different varieties of peas, as well as carrots, lettices, spinach, potatoes, beans, corn, etc. "I have learned to distribute my crops on my land because all the crops sell well, especially the peas," he says. He also raises animals such as cows, sheep and guinea pigs, which he fattens at 4 months and sells to the city of Huancayo. "The animals from Tarma are well sought-after for different uses and this is good for us," says Caesar proud of his city. 

The weather has been his worst enemy, a situation he has been able to control with his many years of experience. Thanks to your help, Caesar will obtain his 9th loan with MFP, an institution he is grateful to for having allowed him to achieve economic stability and given him the desire to progress, together with his communal bank. With the money from the loan he will buy 20 sacks of manure which comes to a sum of S/. 2400 nuevos soles (PEN) and with the rest he will buy seed potatoes which will be ready for harvesting in May he estimates.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of manure and seed potatoes.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando es un hombre trabajador y dedicado, casado y con 3 hijos, desde hace 25 años se dedica al oficio de fabricar calzado y hoy a sus 56 años de edad, vive solo con su esposa, pero no abandona su microempresa ya que según sus palabras, es feliz complaciendo a su clientela con los zapatos ideales para cada uno.

Su sueño es poder trabajar y ser útil a su familia hasta sus últimos días, por eso actualmente solicita un préstamo para poder comprar insumos para sacar una producción y comprar algunos diseños de sandalias para la temporada de aguinaldos, y lograr de este modo mejorar sus ingresos y proporcionalmente mejorar la calidad de vida de el y su esposa.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando is a hardworking and dedicated man. He is married and has 3 children. He has been a cobbler for the last 25 years and now, in his 56th year, he lives alone with his wife. However, he has not abandoned his small business as, according to him, he is happy pleasing his customers with the perfect shoes for every one of them.

His dream is to be able to work and be useful until his final days. That is why he is currently asking for a loan to purchase consumables to bring out a line of shoes and buy some sandal designs for the season bonuses and in this way manage to improve his income and proportionately improve his and his wife's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy consumables to make shoes and buy sandals for the end-of-year season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, sweets, soft drinks, soups and canned goods.

loans.name: Dora Emilse
