She is the owner of a music service.  She provides her services on contract which are usually for Fridays and Saturdays.  Her brother works with her.  She has had this business for more than 5 years and it has gone well, she is no longer needing presentations.

This loan is to be able to buy a set of lights which will improve the service that she provides.  She has been with the community bank for 2 years.  She is the payables administrator for the bank.  She is very happy with the help that she has received.

Her dreams are to continue getting ahead and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to purchase a set of lights for her disco business.

loans.name: Isidora Narcisa

texts.es:
Isidora  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia D. Chucuito y departamento D. Puno, tiene 57  años D. edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos independientes.  Cuenta con educación primaria (incompleto).
Su primer préstamo otorgado por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. comidas.  Nos cuenta que también  venD.  ropas en la ciudad D. Puno.
Solicitara un nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, con el cual comprará ropas como mantas, chompas, llicllas y ponchos. 
La señora desea seguir con el negocio y mejorar sus ventas.  Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, el ahorro y las utilidades generadas por el ahorro.
texts.en: Isidora is a member of the 'Santa Rosa D. Lima' community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito province, in Puno department. She is 57 years old, married, and has four children who live independently. She did not complete her primary education. Isidora's first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her food business. She tells us that she also sells clothing in the city of Puno. Isidora will request a new loan for 500 soles to buy clothing such as sweaters, ponchos, mantas and llicllas (traditional squares of woven cloth that are worn as shawls or used for carrying children on your back). Isidora would like to continue in her business and improve her sales. What she likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans, the savings and the interest she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, mantas, llicllas and ponchos

loans.name: Gioconda Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Al Poder.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gioconda,  tiene 46 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el ultimo de 16 años el cual estudian en colegio, dos de sus hijos  aun vive con ella.
 
Ella con la finalidad de conseguir sus propios recursos y con estos sacar adelante a sus hijos hace varios años puso un bar en su casa, en el vende bocadillos y ciertas bebidas como sodas, jugos, energizantes, entre otras cosas, trabaja de jueves a domingo desde las 15h00 hasta las 22h00 y sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio. Con este negocio ella ha podido sola sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los bocadillos, sodas, jugos, energizantes entre otras cosas. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado y porque los intereses son más bajos que en otros lugares.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Damas al Poder' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the 'City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Here we meet Gioconda who is 46 years old, divorced, and has four children.  Three of her children are already grown up and her youngest is 16 and still in school.  Two of her children still live with her.

With the aim of making her own money and using it to get provide for her children, Gioconda set up a bar in her house several years ago.  In it she sells sandwiches and drinks such as soda, juice, energy drinks, etc.  She works from Thursday to Sunday, from 3.00pm to 10.00pm, and her children help her in the business.  Through this business, she has been able to provide for her children on her own.

Gioconda will use this loan to buy food products with which to prepare her sandwiches.  She will also buy soda, juice, energy drinks and other products.  She has been a member of her community bank for two years and she likes it because of the help that they have given her and because the interest rates are lower than those offered elsewhere.

Gioconda's goals are to continue making progress.

loans.use: to buy food, soda, juice, energy drinks, etc.

loans.name: Judy Antonieta

texts.es:
Judy es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito J., provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y cuenta con grado de instrucción superior.
Trabaja desde hace siete años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles dinero que incrementó a su negocio de venta de combustible, paralelamente se dedica al servicio de alquiler de  escenarios para eventos.
Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar tolderas, maderas y repintar los tubos, éstos los alquila a S/. 200.00 – 250.00 nuevo soles por día.  En el negocio le ayudan sus padres y hermanos.
Su sueño es tener un equipo de sonido, una casa, un carro y mejorar su negocio de venta de combustible.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Judy is a member of the communal bank “Santa Rosa de Lima,” located in the J. district of Chucuito province in the department of Puno.  She is 26 years old, single, and has completed some college studies.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 7 years.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 Peruvian soles, which she used to expand her business selling fuel.  She also has a business renting stages for events.   

She is requesting a new loan in the sum of 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy awnings and lumber, and to repaint the metal tubes used to support the stage.  She rents her stages for 200 to 250 Peruvian soles per day.  Her parents and brothers help with the business.

Her dream is to have sound equipment, a house, a car, and to improve her business selling fuel.

What she likes about her communal bank are the easy payment terms on the loans and the punctuality of her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy awnings, wood and to repaint the metal tubes

loans.name: Jessenia Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Al Poder.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Jessenia, tiene 30 años  de edad, está separada y de esa relación tiene un hijo de 8  años que estudian en escuela.  Ella está estudiando en una universidad a distancia para sacar el titulo de licenciada. Vive en casa de sus padres. 

La Señora Jessenia para ganar el sustento diario y para que a su hijo no le falte nada desde hace varios años se desempeña como maestra en una escuela privada de la localidad, pero además de esto ella también tiene una pequeña  papelería en su casa, en la cual tiene bastante clientela ya que además de vender artículos de papelería también da el servicio de copias. Ella trabaja todos los días y su mamá le ayuda cuando ella está en la escuela trabajando. Lleva 8 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para compara mas cuadernos, lápices, hojas de papel y otras artículos de papelería  que vende en su local. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que dan para mejorar su negocio.

Sus sueños son tener su titulo de licenciada y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Damas al Poder communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we met Jessenia.  She is 30 years old and separated, with an 8-year-old son in school from this relationship.  Jessenia is studying for her degree in a university via distance learning.  She lives in her parents' house.

Jessenia has worked for several years as a teacher in a private school in the area to pay for her daily expenses and to ensure that her son is never lacking anything.  Besides this she also has a small stationery store in her house.  She has lots of customers since in addition to selling stationery she also has a copying service.  She works every day and her mother helps out when she is in school or working.  She has had her business for eight years and it's going very well for her.

This loan is to buy more notebooks, pencils, paper, and other stationery that she sells in her place.

She has completed two loan cycles with the communal bank and she likes it because of the help they offer to improve her business.  Her dreams are to get her degree and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, paper, and other stationery.

loans.name: Union De Cabecera Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Union de Cabecera" esta conformado por un grupo de mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables todas tiene un negocio en donde invertiran su credito como doña Angela invertira en su tienda de abarrotes, Doña Flora invertira para comprar pollos y puercos, Doña Manuela comprara Elotes para vender todas las tardes, la señora Victoria invertira en su papeleria, la señora Cncepcion comprara unos pollos, la señora Sandra invertira en su pequeña tienda de dulces y la señora Silvia representante del grupo invertira en su tienda de abarrotes.
El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque union es como la amistad que se tienen las integrantes del grupo.
En esta ocacion la representante del grupo es doña Silvia ella tiene 32 años de edad esta casada desde hace 12 años con el señor Alfredo quien trabaja en su despacho juridico juntos han procreado 3 hijos, Mariela de 10 años que se encuentra en quinto grado de primaria, Leisy Kena de 4 años que esta en preescolar y Karla de 1 año de edad.
Doña Silvia tiene una tienda de abarrotes esta vez ha solicitado el credito para comprar leche, pan huevo, productos enlatados, refrescos, aguas, jugos, sopas, frijoles, arroz y otras cosas que le hagan falta por lo regular casi siempre compra lo que la gente consume mas que son los alimentos. Su tienda tiene ya 6 años.
Su problema es que ya tiene mucha competencia, pero para no perder clientes y al contrario ganar mas clientes, ella sabe que debe dar los mejores precios y debe tener la tienda mejor surtida.
La meta que tiene doña Silvia es poder arreglar su tienda darle una pintadita y mejorar los precios para poder ganar clientela ya que eso es lo que busca la gente.
"Gracias a Frac por el apoyo que nos da y estoy muy agradecida por su apoyo, tambien nosotras estamos muy contentas de trabajar con una institucion"
texts.en:
The Unión de Cabecera village bank is a group of hardworking, responsible women. They all have businesses in which they invest their loans. Angela will invest in her general store, Flora will buy chickens and pigs, Manuela will buy corn to sell every afternoon, Victoria will invest in her stationer's shop, Concepción will buy chickens, Sandra will invest in her little sweets shop, and Silvia, the leader of the group, will invest in her general store.
The group chose its name because union is like the friendship between the members.
At this time, the group leader is Silvia. She is 32 years old and has been married for 12 years to Alfredo, who has a law practice. Together they have three children: Mariela, ten years old, who is in fifth grade; Leisy Kena, four, who is in preschool; and Karla, who is one year old.
Silvia has a general store, and is requesting this loan to buy milk, bread, eggs, canned goods, soft drinks, water, juice, soups, beans, rice, and other things she needs. She almost always buys what people consume the most, which is food. She has had her store for six years already.
Her problem is that there's a lot of competition, and in order to retain her customers and even acquire more, she knows she has to offer the best prices and have the best selection in stock.
Silvia's goal is to fix up her shop, giving it a fresh coat of paint, and to lower her prices to gain customers, since that's what people are looking for.
"I am grateful to Frac and the support it gives us. We are very happy to be working with an institution."

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, eggs, oil, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land on which to grow cacao

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene  52  años de edad, está separada y tiene dos hijos independientes.  No concluyó la secundaria.

La señora  Catalina trabaja desde hace diez años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta de abarrotes.  Nos cuenta que también  se dedica a la venta de bordados en bayeta (telas).

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará mercaderías como azúcar, arroz, fideos, leches y bayetas para bordarlos.  La señora también tiene criaderos de trucha y recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. 

Su sueño  es mejorar las jaulas de los criaderos.  Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima communal bank in the district of Juli, Chucuito province, department of Puno. She is 52 years old and separated. She has two grown children. She did not finish secondary school

Señora Catalina has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 10 years. Her first loan was for 300 new soles, money which added to the capital of her business selling groceries. She tells us that she is also engaged in the sale of embroidery on flannel.

With this new loan of 1500 new soles she will buy merchandise such as sugar, rice, noodles, milk, and flannel for embroidery. Catalina also has hatcheries for trout and receives assistance from her children. Her dream is to improve the hatchery enclosures.

What she likes most about the communal bank is the ease of getting loans, the meetings, and the timeliness of assistance.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sugar, rice, noodles, milk, and flannel for embroidery.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe - Chupaca Group

texts.es:
L. Señora GLORIA es una mujer muy trabajadora y tiene mucho entusiasmo, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. productos comestibles en su bodega que se encuentra en su propio domicilio, a L. vez también se dedica al tejido D. guantes.

aunque aún tiene poco tiempo con su negocio, elL. pone un gran optimismo en hacer crecer su negocio.  Gloria solicitò el prèstamo para que pueda invertir  en L. compra D. productos como sacos D. azucar,arroz,aceite,leches,etc. y poderlas venderlas en su bodega, a los clientes D. su pueblo.  

Es integrante D. L. Alcancia Comunal "VIRGEN D. GUADALUPE", conformado  por  personas emprendedoras, sueña con hacer crecer, avastecer su bodega y satisfacer a sus cientes, y darle lo  mejor para sus familias.

En L. foto L. socia viste con  polo color anaranjado. faltaron dos personas por motivo D. salud.
texts.en:
Gloria is a very hardworking woman who is very enthusiastic.  She sells foodstuffs in her store located at home.  She also knits gloves although she’s been in this business just a short time; she puts a lot of enthusiasm into it though to make it grow.

Although she's been in this business for just a short time, she is very optimistic in making her business grow. She is asking for the loan so that she can invest in the purchase of food products like sugar, rice, oil, milk, etc. and sell them in her store to the clients of her town. 

She’s a member of the “Virgen D. Guadalupe” communal bank which was initially formed by a few people and now only a few of them still remain in the group but they are all very enterprising and dream with making their businesses grow to give the best to their families.

She’s dressed in the orange sweater and two people were absent due to illness.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, oil, and milk

loans.name: Nuvia Aidee

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Al Poder.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Nuvia, tiene 40 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  4 hijos de 19, 14, 13 y 10 años, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del banco y le gusta por los beneficios que les da la institución.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto sacar a sus hijos adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos  días  en sus ventas y también da el servicio de pintado de uña a domicilio, cuando realizar sus trabajos de manicura también ofrece sus productos. Ella vende a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 8  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, Capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the “Damas al Poder” communal bank meet every two weeks.

We met Nuvia, 40, here.  She’s a single mother of four children who are 19, 14, 13 and 10 years old.  The three oldest go to secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school; all her children live with her still.  She’s been in the communal bank for 5 years; she’s the bank President and she likes it because of the benefits she gets from the institution.

She’s a housewife who in order to earn her own resources to support her children sells clothes via catalogue and Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories).  She works every day at her sales and she also provides in-home manicure services and when she goes out to provide manicures she offers her products for sale.  She sells on credit and collects payment weekly.  She’s been in this line of work for over 8 years and does very well.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda sigue participando en el banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas D. la Asociación  Arariwa. Yolanda sigue con el negocio D. siembra y cosecha D. café.

Yolanda con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho con el negocio. 

Yolanda requiere el préstamo para pagar a los peones que trabajan en la chacra. 


Yolanda se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Yolanda continues participating in Asociación Arariwa’s micro loan unit’s “Qorichaska del Cusco” communal bank.  She continues with her coffee growing business.  Yolanda did very well with her previous loan and was able to obtain good benefits so she now wants another loan because it’s very helpful for her business.  Yolanda needs the loan to pay day laborers that work her fields. Yolanda is grateful for the opportunity provided her through this means and pledges to make her installment payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to pay day laborers that work her fields.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Mercedes, de 59 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León, tiene 3 hijos todos son independientes, ella se dedica a embellecer a las hermosas mujeres de la cuidad, es estilista y modista. Ella inicio su negocio hace 5 años  anteriormente se dedicaba  ala costura pero una de sus hijas estudio belleza y cosmetología y la motivo a que trabajaran juntas fue entonces que comenzó a tomar curso de belleza ,aprender a maquillar, cortar cabello y posteriormente puso el salón de belleza, una de la actividades que disfruta es cuando maquillas  y peina a las futuras novia y  las señoritas quinceañeras pues le hace recordar a sus hijas y disfruta muchos arreglarlas para ese día tan especial nos cuenta también que sus clientes mas exigentes son los varones por ser los mas delicados a la hora de cortarles el cabello pero siempre la buscan por su amable atención y rapidez con que los atiende. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar tintes de cabello, cremas para alisar, tratamientos, maquinas para afeitar a los caballeros pistola y planchas. Esta crédito le permitirá comprar material de trabajo que necesita y comprar nuevas maquinas que necesita. En sus planes futuros quiere convertir su salón de belleza en un salón que brinde servicio de Spa pero por lo pronto quiere mejorar la infraestructura de su salón y comprar material de trabajo que necesita.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 59, lives in the city of León.  She has three children who are all independent.  She works making the city’s beautiful women even more beautiful: she’s a stylist and dressmaker.  

She started her business five years ago.  She used to work sewing but one of her daughters studied hair dressing and cosmetology and motivated her to work together.  She took a beauty course and learned how to apply makeup and to style hair.  Later on, she opened a beauty salon.  

One of the activities she enjoys the most is doing hair and makeup for brides and fifteen-year-olds because it reminds her of her own daughters and she enjoys getting them ready for that very special day very much.  She also tells us that some of her most demanding customers at the moment of getting their hair cut are men but they always seek her out because of her kind treatment and the speed with which she takes care of them.

She needs the loan to buy hair color, straightening creams, treatments, electric shavers for men, hair dryers and hair straightening combs.  This loan will allow her to buy the work tools she needs and to buy the new machines she needs.  In her future plans is expanding her beauty salon and turning it into a full spa but for the moment she just wants to improve its infrastructure and buy the supplies she needs for work.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Cristhian Marlo

texts.es:
Cristhian de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona es agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Cristhian se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz, actividad que realiza desde hace algunos años, además de ser un producto consumido diariamente por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona y fuera de ella,  con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y esposa.  También cría y comercializa animales de corral, lo que le permite contar con otro ingreso para su casa.

Al observar que su negocio va creciendo y a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y alimento balanceado para sus animales, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.  Cristhian con trabajo y dedicación le brinda lo mejor a su hijo, con la intensión de otorgarle otra oportunidad académica en un futuro.
texts.en:
Cristhian, 26, lives with his wife and son in his own house that only has electricity and is located in the rural part of Tambogrande District that belongs to Piura Department.  This zone is noted for farming, livestock raising and crafts making.

Cristhian is a farmer.  He has his own fields where he grows corn, an activity he’s been doing for some years now since it’s a product that’s consumed daily by people.  Once harvest is in he sells it in various markets in the zone and some outside of it as well.  With income acquired he can provide a better quality of life for his son and wife.  He also raises small farm animals that provide another source of household income.

Noting that the business is growing he felt it necessary to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer to improve his land and his crops and to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.  With profits obtained he will be able to repay the loan and meet his family’s daily needs.  With work and dedication Cristhian provides the best for his son with the goal in mind of offering him an academic opportunity in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Santos Deojana

texts.es:
Santos es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesana.

Santos desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cuenta con 16 cabras) y ganado ovino (cuenta con 14 ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y realizar algunos arreglos en su corral, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Santos es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  mejorar económicamente para tener otras comodidades.
texts.en:
Santos is a 40-year-old mother who lives with her children in her own home.  The only service her home receives is electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  This area is noted for its farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

Santos has been raising and selling goats (she has 16) and sheep (she has 14) for some years.  Her pens are located behind her home and they are both suitable and spacious.  She feeds her animals nutritionally-balanced feed and natural fodder so that they reach an optimal level of growth and she is able to sell them in the different markets in her area.  This makes her very good profits with which she is able to cover her family's daily expenses.

Santos has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy nutritionally-balanced feed and make some repairs to her pens.  She will use the income that she makes from selling her animals to repay her loan and improve her family's quality of life.  Santos is a hard-working person and very responsible.  The only thing she wants is for her family to do well and to improve her financial situation so that they can enjoy more comforts and conveniences.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed and to make some repairs to her pens

loans.name: Teodosio

texts.es: Teodosio tiene 57 años, casado con Anatolia de 54 años, que fruto de este amor tiene 6 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Desde muy niño le gustó estar en el campo, cuando en aquellas épocas sus padres se dedicaban a la actividad agrícola, pero el siguió lo pasos de sus padres del cual, se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que le siguen brindando hasta hoy y con todo lo aprendido incursionó en el cultivo de cacao, café y frutas cítricas. Con el pasar del tiempo, poco a poco fue creciendo en su producción y aunque existe algunos inconvenientes siempre él esta preparado para poder afrontarlo. Él siguió en esta labor con la idea de emprender un futuro mejor para su familia y su persona. Casi siempre recibe la ayuda de su querida esposa e hijos, pero en ocasiones tiene a cargo de sus peones. Su producto lo vende en los Centros de acopio del distrito de Pichari. Pero lo que más anhela es adquirir más terrenos, con la finalidad de expandir sus cultivos, de esa manera producir en cantidad y por consiguiente obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2000 soles que solicita, contratará peones para que lo ayuden en limpieza de su parcela agrícola y fertilizarla.
texts.en:
Teodosio, 57, is married to Anatolia, 54; their six children are the fruit of this love.  Together they live in their own house in the district of Pichari.

Since he was very little Teodosio loved to be in the country during the times when his parents were working in agriculture, so he followed in his parents' footsteps.  He feels grateful for the support that they continue offering him today, and with all that he learned he made forays into growing cacao, coffee, and citrus.

With the passing of time, little by little he increased his production and, although there are some inconveniences, he always is prepared to be able to handle them.  He continued in this job with the idea of embarking on a better future for his family and himself.  He almost always gets the help of his beloved wife and children, but occasionally he needs farmworkers.

He sells his product in the warehouses in the district of Pichari.  What he most desires is to acquire more land, with the goal of expanding his crops and producing in quantity and, consequently, having a better income.

This will be his second loan with MFP, and he is committed once again to making his payments punctually.

With the 2000 PEN he is requesting, he will hire farmworkers to help him clear and fertilize his plot of land.

loans.use: to hire farmworkers.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona tiene como actividad agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Verónica desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cerdos, ovejas  y aves de corral), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que sus animales llegan a su crecimiento óptimo podrá ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así pueda obtener muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y para sanidad de sus animales, con la finalidad de que sus animales estén sanos y aptos para el consumo de las personas, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar su nivel de vida.  Verónica es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca cada vez más para brindarle más comodidades a su familia en casa.
texts.en:
Verónica is 34 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own home in a rural area in the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura.  They don't have basic services.  The people in this area work in agriculture, raising livestock and crafts.  

Verónica has been raising and selling farmyard animals (pigs, sheep and poultry) for some time now.  Her pens are located in the back part of her house.  She feeds her animals a balanced meal of natural grains and grasses.  When her animals reach an optimum size she sells them at different markets in her area.  This is how she brings in a good income to cover her household expenses.  

She has requested a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] to buy balanced feed so that  her animals are healthy and suitable for consumption by people.  With her earnings she will make her loan payments and improve her standard of living.  

Verónica is a hard-working and dedicated person.  The only thing she wants is for her business to grow so that she can make her family more comfortable at home.

loans.use: purchase balanced feed for the health of her animals.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La Señora Maria Teresa tiene como actividad su pulpería, ella realiza su negocio de lunes a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche  toda la semana en su vivienda que es donde está ubicado su negocio.Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia, es por eso que solicita  el crédito es para la compra de granos básico, detergentes, golosinas, refrescos, pan, sopas y papel higiénico. Esto le permitirá suplir su negocio y al mismo tiempo agrandar su negocio y mejorara sus ingresos.
texts.en: Maria Teresa's business is a grocery store.  She works in her store from Monday to Friday, from 7.00am to 9.00pm.  Her business is located in her home.  This activity is her main source of income for herself and her family.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, detergents, candies, soft drinks, bread, soups and toilet paper.  This will allow her to stock her business, enlarge her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergents, candies, soft drinks, bread, soups and toilet paper

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años de edad, está separada y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad
Son tres años que viene trabajando con los prestamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, lleva varios años trabajando con estos productos y le está yendo bien.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará 1 crema para mano, 3 jaboncillos, 1 loción para cara,  2 talcos, 3 perfumes, 2 champú, 2 enjuagues, 2 rubores.
Su trabajo le dio muchas satisfacciones, aparte de darle ganancias le dio buenas amistades, porque todo este tiempo conoció a muchas personas a las que aprecia como si fueran su familia.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de pertenecer a su familia y darle los créditos con tanta facilidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 'Mujeres con Futuro' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 56 years old, separated, and has three grown-up children.

Rosa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos loans for three years.  Her business is selling beauty products through a catalog.  She has been working with these products for several years and things are going well.

Rosa will use her new loan for 1,500 soles to buy one lot of hand cream, three lots of soap, one lot of face lotion, two lots of talcum powder, three lots of perfume, two lots of shampoo, two lots of mouthwash and two lots of blusher.

Rosa's work brings her a lot of satisfaction.  In addition to the profits she makes she also makes good friends because, over time, she has come to know many people who she values as if they were family members.

Rosa is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunity they have given her to belong to their family and for the loans that they have given her so easily.

loans.use: to buy 1 lot of hand cream, 3 lots of soap, 1 lot of face lotion, 2 lots of talcum powder, 3 lots of perfume, etc.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania de 32 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de la persona donde trabaja, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Bambamarca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Epifania se dedica a la venta de productos orgánicos, actividad que realiza conjuntamente con el trabajo que desempeña, realiza labores domésticas en una casa en Bambamarca, con ambas actividades trata de tener ingresos económicos para solventar sus gastos personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos orgánicos como una fotocopiadora para que brinde el servicio de fotocopiado, ya que es una actividad que no cuenta con competencia en esa zona y así puede reunir mayores ganancias para enviar a sus padres que vive en otra ciudad y pagar su crédito otorgado.  Epifania es una mujer trabajadora y muy empeñosa que con esfuerzo a sabido salir adelante, con la idea de mejorar siempre y ayudar a sus  padres que se encuentra lejos.
texts.en:
Epifania, 32, is single and lives in the house belonging to the person she works for; it has running water and electricity and is located in the Bambamarca District which belongs to Cajamarca Department.  This zone is dedicated to farming and animal husbandry.

Epifania sells organic products, an activity she does alongside the job she has: she works as a domestic employee in a house in Bambamarca.  She tries to earn income from both activities in order to cover her personal expenses.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy more organic products and also a photocopier to start providing photocopying services since it’s a service that has no competition in the zone and she can earn higher profits to send to her parents who live in another city and also to repay her loan.  Epifania is a hardworking, very enterprising woman who has managed to get ahead through her own efforts with the goal in mind of always doing better and helping her parents who are far away.

loans.use: to buy more organic products and a photcopier.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 28 años, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de tan solo 2 añitos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de quisto valle, Pichari. Dora es una joven mujer, que por cosas del destino se separó de su esposo, quedándose ella de la custodia de su hijo. En un inicio le fue muy difícil, pero poco a poco fue de ese trance dedicándose junto a su queridos padres a las labores agrícolas, cultivando cacao, café y frutas cítricas, productos están teniendo buenos precios en la actualidad. Dora en el poco tiempo que lleva dedicándose a esta labor ha sabido valorar su esfuerzo, ella sabe que esta actividad es pesado y se necesita de fuerza y dedicación constante. Ella está contenta con esta labor que realiza, porque gracias a ello puede percibir ganancias. En un futuro piensa abrir una tienda de abarrotes, de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos de la que ahora tiene. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 soles podrá contratar peones para que la ayuden a limpiar y sacar la malezas de sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Dora is 28 years old and is a single mother of a 2-year-old little boy; they live together in her own house located in the community of Quisto Valle, Pichari.  Dora is a young woman who due to destiny’s capriciousness separated from her husband remaining in sole custody of her son.  At the beginning this was very difficult but she gradually came out of that difficult situation and started farming with her parents growing cocoa beans, coffee and citrus fruit, products that currently are selling for good prices.

In the short period of time that Dora’s been doing this work she’s learned to value her efforts.  She knows that the work is hard and one needs constant strength and dedication.  She’s happy with the work she does because thanks to it she earns profits.  In the future she’d like to open a grocery store to earn better income than presently.

This will be her first MFP loan and she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She will use the 2500 soles to hire day laborers to help her clear weeds from her coffee fields.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy three sheep and grazing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed and enlarge her corrals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock up on rinks, sugar, rice, oil, and vegetables for her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 35 años es una mujer amable. Ella convive desde hace 5 años con, Yimi, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Dayana y Celeste a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Acraquia. Todas las mañanas, desde los primeros rayos del sol. “Eli”, como la llaman de cariño, sale a cuidar a niños de 6 meses de nacido hasta 4 años edad. A los que cuida con mucho amor y responsabilidad, pues según afirma, ve en ellos a sus hijos. Le va muy bien en su trabajo, pues disfruta lo que hace y recibe una pensión mensual del estado, pues trabaja en un programa social denominado “wawa-wasi”. Además dedica sus tiempos libres en la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cerdos y cuyes; los que enseba para luego venderlos con un mayor precio, en las ferias que se realiza en la ciudad de Pampas. Ahora desea expandir su negocio y tener mejores ganancias, pues desea brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Acraquia” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para concretar sus objetivos, además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues se caracteriza por ser cumplida. Elizabeth, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de gallinas y cuyes para su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 35, is a kind woman. She’s lived with Yimi, her husband, for the last five years.  They have two children: Dayana and Celeste who they care for in their own house located in Anexo de Acraquia.  Every day at first light Eli, as she’s affectionately called, goes out to care for children between the ages of 6 months and 4 years.  She cares for them with much love and responsibility because as she states, she sees her own children in them.  She works in a program called “wawa-wasi.”  In addition, she spends her free time raising small farm animals like chickens, pigs and guinea pigs that she fattens up to then sell at higher prices because she wants to provide her family with a better quality of life.

She belongs to the “Acraquia” communal bank and this is the sixth MFP loan where she hopes to have your support to reach her goals.  She promises to be punctual with her installment payments since she’s noted for being very responsible with her commitments.  If Elizabeth were to get your support, she’ll invest the requested money in the purchase of chickens and guinea pigs for her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the material (adobe) and pay for labor for building an oven.

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Teresa, originaria de LEON nos comparte su experiencia vivida con el primer prestamo que lo invirtio para en regrgas de minutos a celulares , compra para surtir su mini pulperia, le fue bien su venta ah crecido poco a poco, es por que esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas de kiva por ayudarle en su inciativa de salir adelante Ahora desea poner un cyber cafe es por ello que solicita este segundo credito para comprar computadoras,usada pero en buen estado e invertir en compra de telefonos porque siempre tiene en mente poner cabinas telefonicas para hacer llamadas internacionles. Siempre buscando la manera de progresar para sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Teresa is originally from León.  She shares the experience she had with her first loan with us.  She invested it in cell phone recharge minutes and bought stock items for her mini grocery store.  She did well with sales; she’s grown little by little.  Because of this she’s very grateful to Kiva lenders for helping her with her initiative to get ahead.

Now, she wants to open an Internet Café so is asking for her second loan to buy computers that are used but in good condition and to buy telephones because she’s also planning to install phone booths for international phone calls.  She’s always looking for ways to make progress and move her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy used computers and to buy telephones.

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es: José De Jesús es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a su oficio que le costo años para recibir su titulo pues el es Veterinario de profesión desde hace como 40 años, por lo que opto en instalar su propio negocio donde el pudiera desempeñar lo que estudio y servir a la comunidad y animales en general. La veterinaria ya tiene 31 años ofreciendo el mejor servicio, en el que vende medicinas, animales, consultas medicas y cortes de cabello a los animales.  Para José es muy importante mantener activo este negocio ya que por una largo tiempo ha sido su fuente de ingresos para el y su familia por lo que desea comprar mercancía como medicinas, animales de diferentes razas, y otros accesorios para sus consultas medicas. De esta manera el seguirá ofreciendo a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: José De Jesús is a very hardworking man, who has been dedicated to his profession. He spent years training to become a vet, and has been in the profession for approximately 40 years now. He decided to start his own clinic, where he could put his experties to good use in serving the community and animals in general. He has been offering an excellent service for 31 years, selling medicines and pets as well as medical consultations and cuting animals' hair. For José it is very important to keep the business going because for a long time it has been his family's source of income. He would like to buy merchandise such as medicines, different types of animals, and other accessories for his medical consultations. In this way he will continue to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, including medicines and other things for his business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora que no le gusta depender de cualquier persona, si no valerse por si misma, por tal motivo trabaja para una maquiladora  10 horas diarias y para tener mas ingreso vende gelatinas de mosaicos que misma prepara para vender en su área para así obtener mayor ingreso. Desde hace 2 años que se cambio a su casa no la hecho ninguna mejora a la vivienda por tal motivo quiere remodelarla por dentro  y fuera para que este en mejores condiciones. Las paredes de enfrente la pintura ya se esta deteriorando por lo que da un mal aspecto para ella, por tal motivo quiere comprar cemento, arena y pintura.
texts.en:
María Isabel is a very hardworking woman, who does not like to be dependent on anyone if she can manage on her own. Because of this she works in a factory 10 hours a day, and also brings in extra income by making and selling "gelatinas de mosaicos" - colourful jelly desserts that are popular in Mexico.

Ever since she moved house 2 years ago she has not made any improvements to her home, and for that reason she now wishes to remodel and improve the interior. The condition of the paint on the front of the house is also deteriorating, which doesn't look good, so she wants to buy cement, sand, and paint.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and pay for labour.

loans.name: Luis Gualberto

texts.es:
Luis sigue participando en el banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa. Luis sigue con el negocio de siembra y cosecha de café, él tambien se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. 

Luis con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho con el negocio. 

Luis requiere el préstamo para pagar a los peones que trabajan en la chacra. 


Luis se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Luis is still participating in Asociación Arariwa’s micro loan unit’s “Qorichaska del Cusco” communal bank.  He still farms coffee and raises small farm animals like guinea pigs.  Luis did very well with his previous loan and was able to obtain good benefits so now he wants another loan because it’s very helpful for his business.  Luis needs the loan to pay the laborers that work his field.  Luis is grateful for the opportunity that’s been provided through this means and commits to make his payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to pay laborers who work his fields.

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es: Leyla Del Socorro de 48 años, se dedica a una pulpería. Desde hace 9 años  en donde ofrece productos como leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún y bebidas. Su negocio lo ha colocado en su vivienda para su seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga para cubrir todos sus gastos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Es por eso que ha solicitado un crédito para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio sea más grande y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Leyla Del Socorro, 48, runs a grocery store.  She’s been in business 9 years selling products like milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna and soft-drinks.  Her business is located at home for security and with profits obtained she’s able to cover her expenses and improve her family’s quality of life.  Because of this she’s asking for a loan to buy more merchandise.  Her only goal is that the business is larger and to have more products in stock to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana sigue participando en el banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas D. la Asociación  Arariwa. Juana sigue ejerciendo su carrera profesional pero en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza. 

Juana con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho con el negocio. 

Juana requiere el préstamo para comprar mas productos D. belleza. 


Juana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Juana continues participating in Asociación Arariwa’s micro loan unit’s “Qorichaska del Cusco” communal bank.  She is still practicing her profession but during her free time she sells beauty products.  Juana did very well with her previous loan and was able to obtain good benefits so she wants another loan because it’s very helpful for her business.  She needs the loan to buy more beauty products.  Juana is grateful for the opportunity provided her through this means and commits to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: La Presa Group

texts.es: La señora Socorro tiene 63 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo ordeña vacas, tienen 10 hijos mayores de edad, 7 mujeres y 3 hombres, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su crédito para comprar aceite, jabón, frijol, azúcar, huevo, papel higiénico, cloro, café, arroz, salsa valentina, chiles jalapeños, etc. Ella inicio su negocio hace 6 años, ella empezó comprando poquito y fue aumentando poco a poco. Su negocio es importante porque se beneficia no se anda preocupando por la comida, a ella le gusta este negocio le sirve de distracción y está contenta atendiendo a sus clientes, ella está orgullosa de su negocio pudo sacar a sus hijos adelante les ayudo a que estudiaran la secundaria, su tienda es popular por el buen precio en la mercancía, las ganancias las utiliza para seguir invirtiendo, para pagar el crédito, ella está contenta con el préstamo que recibió la saca de apuros y le ayuda a seguir comprando la mercancía para vender. Sus sueños y esperanza son que su tienda crezca tenerla bien surtida y poder ayudar a sus hijos. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por su ayuda con sus préstamos podemos seguir progresando, y que se encuentren bien para que nos sigan apoyando con sus préstamos.
texts.en:
Socorro is 63 years old and married.  Her husband milks cows.  They have ten grown children, seven women and three men.

She has a grocery store.  She requested her loan to buy oil, soap, beans, sugar, eggs, toilet paper, bleach, coffee, rice, hot sauce, and jalapeño chilies, etc.  She started her business six years ago.  She started buying a small amount, and she gradually increased what she bought.  

Her business is important because she benefits from not worrying about food.  She likes this business; it serves as a distraction.  She is content waiting on her customers, and she is proud that through her business she was able to get her children ahead.  It helped them attend high school.

Her store is popular due to the good prices of her merchandise.  She uses the income to continue investing and to pay the loan.  She is pleased with the loan received.  It saves her from difficulties, and it helps her to continue buying merchandise to sell.

Her dreams and hopes are for her store to grow, to have the store well-stocked, and to be able to help her children.  The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “Thank you for your help.  With the loans we are able to continue making progress and we hope that all is well so that you will continue supporting us with the loans.”

loans.use: to buy oil, soap, beans, sugar, eggs, toilet paper, bleach, coffee, rice, hot sauce, and jalapeño chilies, etc.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “Nueva Esperanza” tiene más de 2 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas se unieron con el anhelo de  un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación. 
Una de ellas es la señora Cinthia, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles, comenta que sus alimentos se venden mucho, pues tiene muy buenas manos para la cocina. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha logrado salir  adelante y ayudar  a su familia.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación para la compra de harina, huevos, sal, jamón, queso, los cuales son ingredientes esenciales para los alimentos que prepara.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nueva Esperanza" has been operating for over two years, working through the Fundación Paraguaya.  The members got together with a desire to provide their children with a better future, working extra hard to provide them with everything they need for their development and training.

One of the members, Mrs. Cinthia, sells food and says her products are popular because she has a knack for cooking.  Thanks to her work she has been able to help her family get ahead.

She is requesting a loan through the foundation to buy flour, eggs, salt, ham, and cheese which are the essential ingredients for the food she prepares.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, salt, ham, cheese and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Honestas Y Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé. Actualmente el grupo está integrado por 18 integrantes, las cuales están trabajando muy a gusto del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, ya en su segundo ciclo.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Ramona, vive con su marido y sus hijos, ella trabaja en una cantina.  Comenta que tiene buenas ventas, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos. Desea seguir con su trabajo para que de esa forma pueda crecer y aumentar sus ingresos.
Ella solicita la ayuda para la compra de golosinas, como ser galletitas, chupetines, chicles, jugos, gaseosas y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes.  Ella como también sus compañeras está muy satisfecha con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva.
texts.en:
The women from this communal bank are from the city of Caacupé.  The group is comprised of 18 members who are happy to work with the Women Entrepreneurs Program, and they are in their second cycle.

The president of the group is Mrs. Ramona who lives with her husband and children.  She runs a canteen with high volume sales and earns a good income.  She wishes to continue working to increase her income further.

She is requesting a loan to buy sweets such as cookies, lollipops, chewing gum, juices, sodas and other items to have in stock to meet customer demand.  She and her colleagues are very grateful for the economic support they receive through the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy cookies, lollipops, chewing gum, juices, sodas and other items.

loans.name: Willaflor

texts.en:
Willaflor is married. She is 33 years old and has four kids. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.

Willaflor manages her owns garden to make a living and has had this type of work for more than 10 years. Each month, she earns 4,600 Philippines pesos (Php) doing this kind of business. She has requested a loan with the amount of Php 7,000 to buy more seedlings and to purchase fertilizers. 

Willaflor has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. Willaflor will save the returns for sending her kids to school and to provide for their daily needs. Willaflor is wishing that her farm will grow and be more salable in her community.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings to plant and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Bernarda

texts.es:
Doña María Bernarda tiene 47 años y vive en la aldea de Naco. Ella es madre soltera  y tiene dos hijas de 22 y 24 años de edad, las cuales aportan económicamente al hogar. La familia de ella es muy unida. 
La señora María Bernarda se convirtió en microempresaria por motivos económicos. Tenía que mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos de la educación de sus hijas. Anteriormente, Doña María Bernarda se dedicaba a la venta de novedades pero sus ventas eran muy bajas. Viendo, que en Naco no había comedores, ella decidió establecer su propio comedor. 

Comedor León ya está en su quinto año sirviendo a los ciudadanos de Naco.  Empezó vendiendo cocteles de fruta, jugos naturales, licuados y refrescos de su casa.  Fue creciendo la demanda y Doña María Bernarda sacó tres créditos para construir el comedor junto a su casa.  Luego se amplió el menú y empezó a servir una pequeña variedad de comidas. La señora trabaja todos los días, con la meta de siempre atender bien a la gente y servir buena comida. 

Con este préstamo, la señora María Bernarda va a abastecer su comedor con la compra de productos que ella utiliza diariamente en hacer las comidas y  bebidas. Quiere que su comedor siga siendo un éxito y el comedor preferido de la gente de Naco.
texts.en:
María Bernarda, age 47, lives in the Naco village.  She is a single mother, and she has two daughters, ages 22 and 24.  They contribute to the household finances.  Her family is very united.

María Bernarda became a small businesswoman for financial reasons.  She had to support her family and cover her daughters’ educational expenses.  María Bernarda previously sold novelties, but her sales were very low.  Seeing that there were no restaurants in Naco, she decided to establish her own restaurant.

The León Restaurant is now in its fifth year of serving the citizens of Naco.  She started selling fruit cocktails, natural juices, milk shakes, and soft drinks at her house.  The demand was growing, and María Bernarda took three loans in order to build the restaurant next to her house.  She works every day with the goal of always tending to her customers well and serving them good food.

María Bernarda will use this loan to stock her restaurant with the purchase of products that she uses every day in making the food and the drinks.  She wants her restaurant to continue being a success and to continue being the restaurant that the people of Naco prefer.

loans.use: to buy products that she uses to make food and drinks.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano es denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en el ciclo octavo, con 10 integrantes. Es un grupo D. señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se dedican a diversas actividades, pero siempre realizan actividades en conjunto para fomentar su compañerismo y unión. 
Josefina tiene una despensa, por medio D. la cual ayuda a su familia, gracias a los ingresos que esta le da. Comenta que tiene buena clientela ya que la mayoría D. sus vecinos van a su negocio. Entre sus planes está seguir creciendo y D. esa forma seguir ayudándole a su familia.
Ella solicita la ayuda D. la fundación para llenar D. productos su local con enlatados, azúcar, harina, fideos en bolsa, lácteos, y otros, con los cuales pueD. estar preparada para los pedidos D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
San Cayetano is the name of this communal bank which is comprised of 10 members and in its eighth cycle.  It is a group of very responsible, hard-working women who are involved in different business activities.  They get together often to build fellowship and team spirit.

Josefina has a grocery store which provides an income to help with family expenses.  She says she has a good customer base since most of them are neighbors.  Her goals are to continue expanding the business and supporting the family.

She is requesting a loan through the foundation aimed at stocking her store with canned goods, sugar, flour, noodles, dairy products and other items so she can fill customer orders.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, sugar, flour, noodles, dairy products and other items.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda, a married mother of two, is 30 years old and resides in Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur where she owns farmland upon which she raises crops to make a living. In this business more than three years, she earns about Php 5,580.00 each month.

A member of GDMPC for more than two years, Esmeralda has requested a loan of Php 45,000.00 to purchase fertilizer and pay for rice planting. Some of the rest will be allotted for her children's education and saved for the next planting. She will use the additional profits arising from the loan both for her family's daily needs and her rice farm. Esmeralda is hoping that her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for rice planting.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres Unidas es de la ciudad de Luque, se forma gracias a la unión de señoras de otro comité, las que decidieron seguir trabajando con el programa. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que desean salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra Gloria es peluquera, tiene 39 años  está casada con el Sr Gustavo, quien es auxiliar aduanero. Tienen tres hijas una de 16 años quien está en el 2do año de la media, la otra tiene 14 años, ella está en el 8vo grado y la ultima hija tiene 12 años ella está en el 6to grado. Dice que sus hijas son su razón de lucha, que por ellas trabajaría todo el día, ya que desea darles todo lo mejor, para que no pasen privaciones.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de Kiva para la compra de tintes, gel, shampoo, maquillajes, y los otros insumos necesarios para su local. Sabe que esta ayuda la vendrá muy bien a su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Unidas is located in the city of Luque.  The members used to be in another group but decided to continue working in the program through a new group.  They are very hard-working women who want to help their families get ahead.

Mrs. Gloria is a hairdresser.  She is 39 and married to Gustavo who is a Customs assistant.  They have three daughters, a 16-year-old who is in the second year of middle school, another, 14, who is in the 8th grade and the youngest, a 12-year-old who is in 6th grade.  She says her daughters are what motivate her to work hard since she wants to give them all she can and not deprive them of anything.

She is requesting a loan through the foundation and Kiva to buy hair color, gel, shampoo, make-up and other necessary supplies for her salon.  She knows that this support will help her business greatly.

loans.use: To buy hair color, gel, shampoo, make-up and other supplies.

loans.name: Cheer

texts.en:
Cheer is married and has one child. She is 31 years old, residing in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Cheer operates her own cellphone load retail business in their community to make a living, and she has been in this business for over two years. Each month, she earns PHP 900 doing this work. 

She has requested a loan with the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase sim cards for cell phones and pay for a retailer sim card. She will spend some of the revenue sending her one child to school.

Cheer has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Cheer is hoping that her business will grow so she can support the financial needs of her only child.

loans.use: to purchase electronic cellphone load

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Kuña Pyapy Mbarete”, está constituido  por 21  señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de ayuda de las unas a las otras. Actualmente está en el cuarto ciclo, pero comentan que les gustaría poder seguir dentro del programa de la fundación.
Lilian es una de las miembros, ella cuenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano. Dice que sus prendas son muy vendidas y que le va muy bien en las ventas. Esta trabajo es el que la ayuda a mantener su hogar y a su familia, por lo que le gustaría poder seguir.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de segunda mano, como ser pantalones, jeans, remeras, camisas, calzas y otros tipos, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Pyapy Mbarete" is comprised of 21 members from the same area who are very active and supportive of each other.  They got together in an effort to help one another.  They are now in their fourth cycle but say they would like to continue working with the foundation's program.

Lilian is one of the members.  She has a used clothing business that she claims is going very well with a high sales volume.  This work allows her to help cover household expenses and support the family, so she would like to continue this way.

She is requesting a loan to buy used clothing such as trousers, jeans, t-shirts, shirts, stockings and other items which will help her business.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Borrower lives in Cambodia

loans.use: Home renovations

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel is married and has two children. She is 49 years old, residing in Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Maridel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products to make a living. She has had this business for more than 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more products to sell.
 
She has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. Maridel hopes to finish the education of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is married and has one child. He is 28 years old, residing in Dinas Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. 

He operates his own motorcycle to earn a living and has had this business for more than one year. He earns PHP 2,500 per month doing this work. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase new spare parts and maintain his motorcycle. Roland has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. He hopes that his income will provide for the needs of his family and for the educational plan for his child.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 35 years old, is married and has two children, age 14 and 8. Violeta's husband is a fisherman.

Violeta runs a small sari-sari (variety) store in Getafe, Bohol. She sells items like chips, vinegar and canned goods. Violeta also helps her husband sell fish at the market. 

She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, canned goods, soy sauce and soap. Violeta hopes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, canned goods, soy sauce and soap.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina, 53, is a married woman with 11 children. Her children are between 4 and 27 years old.

Esterlina is a farmer working in Talibon, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Esterlina works hard to support her husband in providing for their needs and sending their children to school. 

She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Esterlina hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use for the family and in her business.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto a 30-year-old married man living in Getafe, Bohol.

Alberto runs a tricycle taxi business and has had this business for a year. This business earns 5,000 PHP month.

Alberto is asking for a loan to pay for license renewal and buy spare parts. This will help Alberto continue his business.

In the future, Alberto hopes to have more tricycles and build a new house. He also plans to start a livestock business.

loans.use: to pay for license renewal and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
El Señor Marco Tulio, tiene 62 años,  es casado, vive con su esposa en una comunidad rural de Petoa,  Santa Barbara.
Manifiesta que le gusta mucha la vida en el campo (área rural). Su padre le enseño a cultivar la tierra desde que era un niño, él se siente satisfecho porque actualmente dispone de una parcela de terreno para producir maíz, frijol, tomate, sandia y papaya.
Don Marco Tulio ha logrado producir en todas las épocas del año de manera artesanal (manualmente). Él conoce las labores que debe realizar y siempre esta pendiente del mantenimiento que requiere  cada cultivo.
Los recursos económicos para la producción los obtiene a través de financiamientos. En la actualidad ha solicitado su quinto préstamo el que utilizará para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas y fertilizantes para el establecimiento y manejo de sus cultivos.  
Sus planes a futuro es cuidar de su familia y seguir cultivando y produciendo alimentos para la venta y consumo.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio, age 62, is married and lives with his wife.  They live in a rural community of Petoa, Santa Barbara.

He says that he really likes life in the country (rural area).  His father taught him how to cultivate the land when he was a boy.  He is pleased because he currently has a plot of land where he produces corn, beans, tomatoes, watermelon, and papaya.

Marco Tulio has managed to produce during all seasons of the year working in the traditional way, manual labor.  He knows the jobs he needs to do, and he is always keeping an eye out for the maintenance that each crop requires.

He obtains the financial resources for the production from loans.  He is currently requesting his fifth loan.  He will use it to buy agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizers.  These supplies are to establish and manage his crops.

His plans for the future are to take care of his family and to continue cultivating and producing food for sale and for consumption.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (seeds and fertilizers).

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Yen Phong distict in Bac Ninh province. She is married and has four adult children.  

To making a living, Nga owns and operates a furniture-making business, specializing in bedroom furniture for local businesses and community members. Nga has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Nga joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Nga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,944,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.   

Nga is now requesting a new loan of 9,184,000 VND, which will be used to purchase machinery to expand the business. The loan will be the sixth  taken out by Nga from SEDA. Nga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


 Nga là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống,  Nga Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị trong phòng ngủ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.   Nga thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này,  Nga kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007,  Nga đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.   Nga đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.184.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua máy móc để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.   Nga dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase machinery to expand the business.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who is a rickshaw driver and wants to buy a new rickshaw. His current one has grown old and needs replacing. By purchasing a new rickshaw, he will be able to provide better quality transport services to his passengers and earn more profits. Nasreen is very confident about the success of her husband in his business after the loan investment. 

She is very supportive and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She receives a good number of orders every month due to good quality work. She has given birth to four daughters. All of them left their education after their fifth year and started work to contribute financially to the family. She wants her eldest daughter, who is now 20 years of age, to marry in the near future. She hopes that her husband’s improved business conditions will help her to save some profits every month for that purpose.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 49 years old. She lives in An Ninh village with her husband and three children. Her children are married. 

She is a businesswoman. She sells agricultural materials. She has had this job for four years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2009. The last time she borrowed 6,944,000 VND and repaid punctually. 

This time she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy more tools for agricultural production  to sell.

loans.use: to buy more tools for agricultural production  to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Claudia tiene 30 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Santa Lucía en el departamento de Cortes. Vive con su pareja de 8 años, Alan y tienen dos hijos de 1 y 6 años de edad. El hijo mayor asiste a la escuela. Ambos adultos trabajan en la venta de lácteos para sustentar a la familia. 

 La pareja vende lácteos y chicharrones de forma ambulante. A sus clientes, les ofrece una amplia variedad de lácteos, entre ellos: queso, quesillo, cuajada y mantequilla. Trabajan todos los días por necesidad económica. Ellos esperan que con su esfuerzo, van a poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles una mejor vida y una excelente educación. 

Con su primer crédito, Doña Claudia logró aumentar su clientela y algunos empezaron a comprar exclusivamente de ella. Con el préstamo actual de L13,000,  ella va a invertir en los insumos de los lácteos y los chicharrones para poder expandir el inventario. Su trabajo se hace difícil sin tener un coche propio, pero la pareja va a dedicarse mucho a su labor para salir adelante. En un futuro muy próximo, esperan tener algún local fijo donde pueden vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Claudia, age 30, lives in the Santa Lucía village in the Cortes department.  She lives with her life partner of eight years, Alan.  They have two children, ages one and six.  The oldest child goes to school.  Both adults work selling dairy products in order to support the family.

The pair sells dairy products and “chicharrones” (fried pork rinds) in an itinerant manner.  She offers a wide variety of dairy products to her customers.  Cheese, fresh white cheese, curds, and butter are among the products that they sell.  They work every day out of financial necessity.  They hope that with their efforts they will be able to get their children ahead.  They also hope to give them a better life and an excellent education.

With her first loan Claudia managed to increase her customers, and some of them started to buy from her exclusively.  With the current loan for 13,000 lempiras she will buy supplies for the dairy products and the chicharrones in order to be able to expand her inventory.
