Their work is difficult without having their own car.  However, the pair will devote themselves to working a lot in order to get ahead.  In the very near future they hope to have a fixed location where they can sell their products.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the dairy products and the chicharrones.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is widowed and has three children. She is 66 years old, residing in Poblacion Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. 

Florita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting vegetables like squash for sale. She has had this type of business for more than five years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. Florita has been a member of GDMPC for almost two years and it's her third loan. Florita is hoping that her business will help provide for her family's daily needs and for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Её муж уехал в Россию, чтобы зарабатывать денег на содержании семьи. Более 14 лет Саида занимается купля продажей женских одежд и нижнее белье. Раньше она помогала сестре, а потом открыла свою торговую точку. Постепенно расширила свой бизнес, и  сегодняшний день имеет дополнительные торговые точки там, где работают 5 человек. Для дочки создала рабочее место, и она рада об своих успехах. Благодаря «Имон Интернэшнл» и Киве она достигла много успехов и от всей души благодарит всех вас за вашу поддержку и помощь. Саида запрашивает займ для покупки женских одежд.
texts.en: Saida is married and is the loving mother of three children. She is hard-working, honestt woman. Her husband went to Russia to earn money to support the family. For more than 14 years, Saida has worked as a retailer of women's clothes and undergarments. At first, she helped her sister, and then opened her own stall. Gradually she grew her business and today has additional retail locations, employing five people. She has created a job for her daughter, and is happy with her achievements. Thanks to IMON International and Kiva she has succeeded in many ventures. From her heart, she thanks all of you for your support and your help. Saida would like a loan to purchase women's clothing for retail.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing for retail

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 9 years old.

Irene sells bamboo products to the people in her community. She has been in this business for nine years. 

Irene also raises chickens, pigs and ducks. She plans to use her loan to buy more bamboo and ducks. 

Irene plans to use her profit to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo and ducks.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Chinda is 29 years old and her husband, Chamroeun is 32 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2002 and have three sons. Two are in school and another one is still young. 

Chinda and her husband sell ice. Chinda sells ice from home and her husband transports ice by his remoque to sell in other villages. (A remoque is a motorbike attached with a trailer at the back.) But his trailer is old which is why Chinda decides to apply for her first loan of $1,000 to buy new trailer for her husband. She will also use a part of the loan to buy additional ice to sell.

loans.use: To buy a new trailer for her husband to carry ice for sale.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Channy and her husband, Bin, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2005 and have two young daughters. Channy sells grocery items at her home. Her husband used to be a Tuk Tuk taxi driver, but he quit the business and he is now a wedding caterer. Channy is asking for her second loan in the amount of $1,000 to help with her husband’s business. He will use the loan to buy food on credit, and then after the wedding he reimburses the food vendors.

loans.use: To help with her husband’s wedding catering business.

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than is 56 years old. She lives in the village of An Ninh. She has four children who are married. Than and her husband are farmers. Her main job is farming. Besides this she also sells popcorn to earn more money. She feels happy when she participates in SEDA because she can save money every week. She has borrowed money from SEDA since 2009. The last time she borrowed VND 8,288,000 and repaid this loan punctually. This time she would like to borrow VND 9,184,000 to buy corn to make popcorn.

loans.use: to buy corn to make and sell popcorn

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal (in the photo), 29 years old, is a weaver. Her husband, Long, 30, is a farmer and does construction work when he is not at the farm. They have been married since 2006 and have two young daughters. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophal is asking for a loan of $300 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business and to assist in her husband’s farming business.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business and to assist in her husband’s farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a second hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat is 47 years old and her husband, Sihak is 36 years old (pictured together).  They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and have three daughters who are in school.

Sophat and her husband are rice farmers and fishermen. Sophat is asking for her first loan of $800 to buy a boat and boat motor because she has a small boat and uses a boat paddle, which is why it’s difficult for her to move her boat from one place to another.

loans.use: To buy a boat and boat motor.

loans.name: Bình

texts.en:
Bình is a 43-year-old woman living in the Yen Phong district of Bac Ninh province. She is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To making a living, Bình owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Bình has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately VND 5,000,000 a month from these activities.

In 2007, Bình joined Kiva's partner, SEDA, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Bình has successfully repaid a previous loan of VND 4,256,000 from SEDA. This previous loan was used to renovate the existing shelter for her livestock. Bình is now requesting a new loan of VND 6,048,000 which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the sixth loan Bình has borrowed from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Bình là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Bình Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Bình thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Bình kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2007, Bình đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Bình đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng nâng cấp chuồng hiện tại cho gia súc của người vay.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua con giống.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Bình dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy (in the photo), 41, is a garment worker and her husband, Savy, 41, is a rice farmer and fisherman.  They have been married since 1989 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. One is a garment worker, two attend school, and another one assists his father in the business. The family lives in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Savy hopes to supplement her new tailoring business, so she is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 to buy a sewing machine. She will also use another part of the loan to buy fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and to buy fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha (in the photo), 35 years old, and her husband, Ban, 44 years old, live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1991 and have five children (two sons and three daughters). One is a garment worker, three are in school, and another one is still young. 

Sokha is a farmer, while her husband has full-time employment in a bakery. Sokha is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase seed, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain her farm, and to buy a water pumping machine.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain her farm, and to buy a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
Hoeurn (in the photo) and her husband, Nay, are rice farmers. They have been married since 1975 and have six children (two sons and four daughters). Three are married and live outside the family home, two are garment workers, and another one assists his parents in the business. The family lives in a village about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Hoeurn is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,200 to continue her farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide. She will also use a part of the loan to purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and buy additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Burul's Group

texts.en:
Burul is the leader of this group. She is 50 years old and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised four daughters and a son. Her two older daughters are married and have their own families, the third daughter works as a teacher in Bishkek and the younger children study at school. In order to earn money, the family cultivates agricultural products and breeds cattle. At the moment they keep four cows, four calves and fifty sheep. After selling some part of the harvest, Burul spends the profits on purchasing cattle. With the money received from this loan, she plans to purchase a bull-calf for breeding. In the future Burul wants to purchase a hectare of land, half of which she will use for growing wheat and the other half for cultivating potatoes. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a bull-calf for breeding

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên is a 55-year-old married woman living in the Yen Phong distict of Bac Ninh province. To making a living, Liên owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting mushrooms for sale. Liên has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately VND 5,000,000 a month from these activities.

In 2007, Liên joined Kiva's partner, SEDA, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Liên has successfully repaid a previous loan of VND 4,256,000 from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Liên is now requesting a new loan of VND 6,048,000 which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  This will be her sixth loan from SEDA. Liên plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Liên là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình.  Để kiếm sống, Liên Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ trồng & thu hoạch nấm để bán.  Liên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Liên kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2007, Liên đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Liên đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua phân bón như phân chuồng.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua hạt giống bổ sung, cây giống & cây con để trồng.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Liên dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim is a weaver. She is a widow and a mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of her children are married and the other one has full-time employment. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yim is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to continue her weaving business by purchasing weaving materials.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Chanthol (pictured above) and her husband, Ty, live in a village about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They are married and have eight children: five sons and three daughters. One of their children is married, one is a garment worker, two have full-time employment and the others attend school. 

Chanthol and her husband are farmers. They grow vegetables on their farmland in the village where they live. Chanthol is requesting another loan of $500 to continue her vegetable farm by purchasing seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Theng is a 57-year-old farmer with 8 children. She grows rice and beans on her farmland to support her family. She has been growing rice and beans for 32 years. This is her first loan from Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Theng requested a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her plantation. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields with good quality and to sell for high prices in order to earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her plantation

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en: Thoa is 30 years old. She is married with two children. They are still small. She not only grows rice but also sells pork in the market. She has been doing this for two years. She earns a monthly income of about VND 4,000,000. She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed VND 8,288,000 and repaid this loan punctually. Now she would like to borrow VND 9,184,000 to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Mahliehon's Group

texts.en:
Mahliehon is 23 years old and she is a nurse. She lives with her parents in a small village called Aravan, which is in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Her mother also works as a nurse and her monthly salary is 6,000 soms. Her father is in Russia and each month he transfers about 5,000 soms to meet the family's needs. In order to earn additional money for the family budget, Mahliehon cultivates agricultural products. With the money received from this loan, she wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for growing potatoes. In the future, with the profits gained from selling the harvest she plans to build a summer kitchen.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers for growing potatoes

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Chhon is a loving mother of three children and lives in the Ang Snoul district. She is a farmer cultivating rice crop. She spends about six months of the year working on her rice field and with the rest of time she turns to raise and look after her cow for calves. She is an industrious woman and a good housewife as well. From her farming business, she is able to earn around $3USD per day to solve the financial necessities in the family. 

Currently the public electricity network has a direct link in the vicinity of her commune. Chhon is seeking funds from HKL and Kiva in order to buy electric wire and to pay for electric connection fees. This loan will provide Chhon’s family a comfortable living. She would like to say thanks to all who help fund her loan.

loans.use: to buys electric wire and pay for electric connection fees.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a married man with four children who are enrolled in school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Rashid has operated a dry fish selling business for the past year; in addition he runs a motorbike transportation business. His potential clients are his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge with rising commodity prices in the market. He aspires to expand his business.

With this KES 10,000 loan, he wants to increase his stock of fish for resale. He decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu Microfinance, because it offers loan facilities with low interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Gulsifat

texts.ru: Гулсифат проживает в районе Джиликул. Она вдова. У нее пятеро детей. Она занимается выращиванием овощей для продажи. Кроме того она сажает фруктовые деревья. В этой области она 40 лет. Гулсифат 64 года. Она берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и селитры.
texts.en: Gulsifat lives in Dzhilikul region. She is a widow and has five children. She grows vegetables for sale. In addition, she also plants fruit trees. She has been working in this area for 40 years. Guslifat is 64 years old. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is married with three children. She is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Laura owns and operates a general store, selling food and daily use products in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 20 years and earns PHP 20,000 per month. Laura requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional products to sell. Laura has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for more than three years and this will be her eighth loan cycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business and finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a single man who owns a house with piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself. Philip has operated a retail shop for the past four months; his potential clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge in transporting his goods from the point of purchase to his place of business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this KES 15,000 loan, he wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, soap and fuel for his shop. He decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu Microfinance, because it offers good financial services to its clients.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, soap and fuel for his shop.

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.ru: Мошариф жительница района Джиликул. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Мошариф 52 года.  Ее муж и старший ребенок находятся в Российской Федерации. Сама она занимается растениеводством и скотоводством. В этой области она 36 лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Mosharif is a resident of Jilikul region. She is 52 years old. She is married, and has three children. Her husband and eldest child are in Russia. She works with crops and animals. She has 36 years of experience in this area. She is applying for a loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 28 years old. She is married. 

Jenelyn is engaged in fruit and vegetable vending. She also sells onions, garlic and other spices, and packed seasonings. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more fruits, vegetables, onions, garlic, spices, and packed seasonings. 

Jenelyn joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables intended for sale.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в районе Джиликул. Он женат. Ему 24 года. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается выращиванием овощей. Этим видом деятельности он занимается восемь лет. Кроме того у него имеется сад, где он сажает фруктовые деревья, в том числе гранат. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных и органических удобрений.
texts.en: Jamshed lives in the region of Jilikul. He is married. He is 24 years old. His wife looks after their home, while he cultivates vegetables. He has been working in this area for eight years. Besides this, he has an orchard, where he grows fruit trees, including pomegranates. He is applying for a loan to buy mineral and organic fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with ten children, six of whom are enrolled in school, two have completed school, and two are still too young for school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.

Hamisi has operated a café for the past three years; his clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of lack of enough sales due to the low population in his area. He dreams of expanding his business to a hotel in the future. 

With the loan of Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase furniture for his café and also add more stocks of food for his café. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it offers loan facilities with low interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his café and also add more stocks of food for his café

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari is a married man with eight children, six of whom are enrolled in school while the other two are adults. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Omari has operated a goat meat selling business for the past 15 years; he sells his products at the market. His biggest challenge is livestock disease and sometimes even death. He dreams of expanding his business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase more goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of their favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional fruits, vegetables, and spices intended for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with four children, two of whom are still attending school while the other two have completed high school. His wife is a teacher who contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Peter has operated a goat meat selling business for the past five years; he sells his livestock at the marketplace and his clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of rising prices of livestock in the market. He aspires to expand his business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, he wants to purchase more goats and also some cattle for resale. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it lends loans with low interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase more goats and also some cattle for resale.

loans.name: Amirsho

texts.ru: Амиршо житель города Душанбе. Ему 37 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его дети учатся в средней школе. Амиршо имеет высшее медицинское образование. По профессии он фармацевт. Уже два года как он открыл свою аптеку в городе. Он берет кредит для приобретения необходимых медикаментов.
texts.en: Amirsho is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. He is 37 years old. He is married and has four children. His children are in middle school. Amirsho has a degree in medicine, and is a pharmacist by profession. He has run his own pharmacy for two years. He is applying for a loan to purchase medical supplies for his business.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with two children who have completed high school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of their family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Samuel has operated a poultry business for the past four years; he sells his livestock at the market, and his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces the major challenge fluctuating commodity prices in the market. He dreams of expanding his business.

With his KES 30,000 loan, he wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its short loan processing time.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Zyonnie

texts.en:
Zyonnie is a 30-year-old single woman. She lives in Mantic Tangub City. In order to help her family, Zyonnie owns and operates a general store in her town, where she sells a variety of products. She has been in this business for more than eight years. Each month, Zyonnie can earn PHP 8,000 from her business. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000, which she will use to purchase products to resell. 

Zyonnie has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year and this is her first loan cycle. In the future, she will use the profits she earns for her daily needs and to help her family. Also, she hopes that her business will continue to progress.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Dzunga

texts.en:
Dzunga is a married man with two children; one is enrolled in school, while the other is too young for school. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the provision of their family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Dzunga has operated a meat goat selling business for the past three years. His potential clients are people from the slaughterhouse. He faces the major challenge of livestock disease, or sometimes even livestock death. He dreams of expanding his business. 

With this KES 40,000 loan, Dzunga wants to purchase goats and cattle for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because he wanted access to loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cattle for his business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 43-year-old married Kenyan lady with seven children. She is in the business of selling general items and cereals at her retail shop, and her customers are those living in the same neighborhood. 

The business is located in a commercial area. She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale one and her dream is to educate her children to the university level. 

The main challenge she faces is poor roads and that means delay with the delivery of her store's stock. She is using her loan of kes 20,000 to increse the stock of cereals in her shop. She is interactive and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cereals for selling at her retail shop

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy is a 31 year old farmer and is married with two children. She also feeds cows, raises pigs, and works for others for additional income. She has been a farmer for more than ten years. 

Channy requested a loan to cultivate her rice paddy and to buy food for her pigs. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and feed her pigs so they are healthy and fat and so she earn more income to support her family, to have some savings, and also keep her children in school. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund.

loans.use: To cultivate her rice paddy and buy food for her pigs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Juvilee

texts.en:
Juvilee is married and is 42 years old. He has six children and he resides in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Juvilee operates his own motorcycle business as a means of transportation to earn a living. He has had this business for more than 20 years. Each month, he earns Php 8,000. 

He has requested a loan of Php 25,000.00 to repair his existing vehicle for better service. Juvilee has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. In the future, Juvilee will keep the returns for the educational plans of his six kids and to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman with four children; three are enrolled in school, while one is too young for school. Her husband is a teacher who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Josphine has operated a fuel selling business for the past three years. She also operates a grocery. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces the major challenge of fluctuating commodity prices. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this KES 40,000 loan, Josphine wants to purchase fuel to resell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it offers quality financial services to its clients.

loans.use: to purchase fuel to resell.

loans.name: Thourk

texts.en:
Thourk is a 51-year-old widow with six children. She is a farmer, and also raises ducks and chickens to generate additional income. She has been farming on her farmland for 20 years. 

This is Thourk's first loA. with VisionFund. She requested a loA. to buy fertilizer for her farmland and food for her chickens and ducks. With this loA., she hopes to increase her crop yields, to feed her chickens and ducks to make them healthy and fat, to buy some necessary household items, and to have some savings for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and food for her ducks.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Siyarkul

texts.ru: Суяркул женат имеет двоих детей. Жена домохозяйка. Он сам является членом дехканского хозяйства и владеет  небольшим участком земли. На земле выращивает сельхозкультуры, занимается виноградоводством и садоводством. Селхоз работы приносят хорошие доходы. Отходов производства не бывает. Так как отходы от селхозкультур идут на корм скота. С появлением кормовой базы крупного рогатого скота он стал заниматься выращиванием крупного рогатого скота на мясо, после откорма он сдает скот как мясо. Доходы хорошие. Он хочет получить займ для продолжения своего бизнеса, если не закупить сейчас корм и скот, он подорожает к зиме. Суяркул хочет получить займ и закупить оптом корм для скота и несколько голов скота. И откормить их к праздникам. Он надеется на благородство  добрых людей. Спасибо!
texts.en: Siyarkul is married and has two children. His wife takes care of the home. He is a farmer and owns a small plot of land. On this land, he grows crops, grapes and fruit trees. His farm brings him a good income. There is no waste produced by the farm, as any by-products are used to feed the animals. Since a new cattle feed supplier has opened, he has started raising meat cattle. He fattens animals and sells them for meat, which provides him with a good income. He would like a loan to support his business. It is important to purchase feed and more cattle now, as prices will increase closer to winter. Siyarkul would like a loan to purchase cattle feed wholesale, and a few heads of cattle that he can fatten up in time for the holidays. He is hoping for the generosity of kind people. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sarah, 27, resident of Dasmarinas Cavite, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Sarah operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from these round palm sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Sarah's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Sarah is requesting Php12, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Sarah hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат занимается торговлей на рынке района Дж. Руми. Она в основном продает овощи, зелень и чаку. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 15 лет. Саодат вдова. У нее четверо детей. Ей 45 лет. Она берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Saodat works as a seller at a market in the region of J. Rumy. She mainly sells vegetables, fresh herbs, and chaka (a fermented milk product). She has been working as a seller for 15 years. Saodat is a widow and has four children. She is 45 years old. She is applying for credit to increase turnover.

loans.use: to purchase beets, radishes, Korean salads, chaka (fermented milk product), and cabbages

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a Kenyan lady age twenty two years, married with four children with ages ranging from one to nine years old. She runs a beauty salon which is located on the estate where she lives. She has been in the business for three years. She will use her loan of kes 20,000 to buy the salon equipment. She hopes to grow her business and open another one in future. She also hopes to give her children a good education to the university level. Florence is very religious and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane, 44, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines.  She a widow and a mother of eight children, two of whom are already working while the others are still in school. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her remaining children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Mary Jane as she herself has been an elementary graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Mary Jane operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php8, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Jane dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is a twenty seven year old single man who lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for himself and house rent.

Kumba has operated a retail shop for the past three years. His potential clients are his neighbors and passers by. He faces a major challenge of transporting his goods from point of purchase to his shop. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan Kumba wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for his shop. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it helps small scale business owners by giving them loans to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for his shop.

loans.name: Emina

texts.ru: Емина жительница района Дж. Руми. Она замужем. Ей 59 лет.  У нее двое детей. Ее муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве, прорабом. Сама она занимается торговлей на центральном рынке. В основном она занимается торговлей овощей. Этим видом деятельности занимается 30 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Emina is a resident of the region J. Rumy. She is 59 years old and married. She has two children. Her husband is a farm foreman, while Emina works as a seller at the central market. Mainly, she sells vegetables. She has worked as a seller for 30 years. She is applying for a loan in order to increase turnover.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 39 year old a married woman who has five children, all of them in school. She has a business of selling clothes in Kator, South Sudan.
Anna requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is a 35-year-old single man. He owns a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for himself and electricity bills.

Kumba has operated a boutique for the past 15 years. His potential clients are the local area residents. He faces the major challenge of seasonality, where demand is high during the festive seasons. He dreams of expanding his business.

With this KES 20,000 loan, Kumba wants to purchase more clothes to resell. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it is a good financial service provider.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.ru: Руслан семейный способный молодой парень. Он женат имеет одну дочь. Для содержания семьи он занимается выращивание скота, растит виноградник и собирает старые металлические изделия как  металлалом. Жена дома занимается пошивом женских платьев. Они стараются экономить, чтобы улучшить жилищные  условия. Руслан  любит труд, ведь человек который трудится всегда живет в достатке. Он хочет поставить свою дочь на ноги дать ей хорошее образование. Он хочет получить займ и закупить крупный рогатый скот. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Ruslan is a young, capable, family man. He is married and has one daughter. To support his family, he raises cattle, runs a vineyard, and collects old metal objects to sell for recycling. His wife sews women's dresses at home. They spend carefully, so that they can save and improve their living conditions. Ruslan enjoys hard work, and as they say, a man who works hard is not left wanting. He wants to give his daughter a good start in life, by providing her with a good education. He would like a loan to buy cattle. He is hoping for your support, and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase animals

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and has two kids. She is 31 years old and resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Grace manages her own venture selling fish in their barangay (neighborhood or village) to make a living. She has had this business for more than 12 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 Philippines pesos (Php) doing this kind of work. She has requested a loan in the amount of Php 10,000 to purchase additional fish to sell and materials for the boat. She has been a member of GDMPC for more than two years. In the future, Grace will use the profit for the needs of her two kids, especially for the educational plan of her kids. She will do more to make her business progress.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell and materials for the boat.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 32 years old and single. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past four years. She gets a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the business.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to purchase charcoal for resale. She will reinvest in her business the anticipated profit she will get.

Her dream is to have a stable income by being the best charcoal supplier on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: to purchase stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Zainiddin

texts.ru: Зайниддин занимается на протяжении многих лет выращиванием зерновых культур виноградоводством и садоводством. Он также занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота. Жена вместе с детьми помогают мужу по бизнесу. После реорганизации колхозов в Дехканские хозяйства они вместе с женой стали членами дехканских хозяйств. Иметь троих детей это значит иметь большую семью. Чтобы содержать семью надо много работать. Они стараются получать хороший урожай, обрабатывают землю сеют лучшие семена. Они также занимаются садоводством и выращиванием на мясо крупного рогатого скота. Он приобрел земельный участок. Зайниддин хочет построить новый дом. Для постройки нового дома ему нужны средства. Он хочет получить займ и начать закладывать фундамент нового дома. Он надеется, что добрые люди поддержат его и помогут в строительстве дома. На полученный займ он купит стройматериалы: цемент, гравий и камни. Он ждет поддержки. Спасибо!
texts.en:
For many years Zainiddin has grown grain crops and been generally involved in horticulture. Additionally, he breeds large cattle. Zainiddin's family helps him run the business. 
After the reorganization of the collective farm (kolhoz) system into dekhan farms, Zainiddin and his wife became the owners of such a farm. 
Having three children means a lot of responsibility and one must work hard to support them. Together, Zainiddin and his wife develop the land, plant the best seeds and try to gather the most bountiful harvest. Also, they tend an orchard and breed large cattle. 
Zainiddin bought a plot of land that he wants to build a house on. To accomplish that, he needs some funds. He hopes to receive the loan and begin laying the foundation for his new home. He hopes that kind people will support him in his endeavor. He's asking for the loan in order to purchase building materials, such as: cement, gravel and stone. He's asking for your support. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase cement, gravel and stone needed to build a house.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
This is Geraldine, who is 35 and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Samuel, and is the mother of three children, one of whom is in high school while the other two are in elementary grades. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her remaining children all the way through college — a dream for most Filipino parents like Geraldine as she herself was only a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Geraldine operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs from those round palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Geraldine dreams to be able to give all of her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. And she also wants to have her own warehouse for the rugs that she is selling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old and has four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling soap, soda, and sugar in Kator, South Sudan.
Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soap, soda, and sugar for sale. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soap, soda, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Rhodah Kavutha

texts.en: Rhodah is a Kenyan lady, and she is 27 years old with two children. Her business is selling second-hand clothes. She has had the business for four years. She also sells fruit juice and ice lollies. She intends to use her loan of kes 50,000 to expand the business by buying more clothes. She hopes to employ one attendant to help her run the shop. Her future dream is to open a boutique. The challenges she faces is the lack of enough stock. Rhodah describes herself as cheerful.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last four years. She is 30 years old, married, and a mother of two children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this is her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs as well as for labor purposes.

In the future, Teresia hopes to expand her farming skills and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs as well as for labor purposes.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a thirty-two-year-old married woman with one school-going child. Her husband Martin is a businessman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child.

Racheal has operated a retail shop for the past five years. Her potential clients are passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar for her shop. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar for her shop.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is married with two kids and they lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.
Imelda sells different kinds of RTW (ready-to-wear) clothes in their barangay (village) for their daily livelihood and has had this business for over 3 years. Each month, she earns Php 5,000 doing this type of work which is enough to provide for the most important needs of her family. She has requested a loan in the amount of Php 10,000 to purchase additional clothes to sell. 
Imelda has been a member of GDMPC for more than one year. Imelda wishes that her small business will grow and become stable in their barangay.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 33 years old, married and a mother for four children.

Haifa has been a tailor since 2007. She makes and repairs women’s and men’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of the local consumer and she has good experience and is well-known in her area.

Haifa decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to rent a shop. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: rent a shop for her tailor business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
This is Lucia, 49, resident of Dasmarinas Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Froilan and is the mother of two children, both already working. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover her everyday expenses.  

Lucia operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus, there is a need for this service, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 32,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts, and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. 

Lucia dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance needed in her computer business

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married, and lives with his wife.

Since 2006, Haydar has owned a shop selling knitting needles, tailoring accessories, buttons and fabrics. He has experience in this field. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there is a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to redecorate his shop and to add more stock. He aims to make more profit so he is able to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate his shop and to add more stock.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two children, one of them in school. She has a business of selling onions and tomatoes in Kator, South Sudan.
Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to buy onions and tomatoes for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to buy onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years.  She is 23 years old and single.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers during marketing and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs for use in her farm.

In the future, Hannah hopes to improve and expand her farming business as well as make more profits and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 29 years old and is a married woman with 3 children aged 6, 3 and 2. She sells baskets and other products made of bamboo. She has been running this business for 5 years. Marites earns about 3,000 PHP per month. Marites also raises pigs in her backyard. She plans to use her loan to buy more bamboos, bolo (a large Filipino cutting tool similar to the machete) and piglets to raise. Marites hopes to have a stable income to help support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more bamboos, bolo (cutting tool) and piglets to raise

loans.name: Norjamol

texts.ru: Норжамол жительница района Шахритус. Ей 59 лет. Она замужем. Она имеет четверых детей. Ее муж работает в хозяйстве. Норжамол сама занимается выращивание овощей. У нее при доме имеется участок земли. Она берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и покупки семян лука.
texts.en: Norjamol lives in the Shahrituz region.  She's fifty-nine, married, and has four children.  Her husband is a farmer, and she grows vegetables  She has a parcel of land by her house.  Norjamol is getting a loan to buy fertilizer and onion seed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and onion seed.

loans.name: Kenga

texts.en:
Kenga is a 49-year-old widowed man with three school-going children. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Kenga has operated as a weaved-items (mats, baskets) seller for the past 10 years; he sells his goods from his home and at the market. His potential clients are his neighbors, friends and relatives. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of opening a shop where he can sell his products.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase more weaving materials for making his products. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it helps people by granting loans.

loans.use: to purchase more weaving materials for making his products.

loans.name: Lobarhan's Group

texts.en:
Lobarhan is the leader of this group. She is 37 years old and divorced. She is raising a 10-year-old daughter who studies at school. Lobarhan works as a school teacher; her monthly salary is 6000 soms. She is also engaged in the cattle-breeding business. Through selling dairy products and some of the animals after fattening, she earns an additional 5000 soms to meet her daily needs. With money received from the loan, Lobarhan wants to purchase a calf for breeding. In the future, she plans to purchase a piece of land on which to build a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru: Махмуд женат имеет четверых детей. Жена домохозяйка. Вместе с женой для содержания семьи они открыли лепешечный цех.17 лет они занимаются выпечкой национальных лепешек. Полученный доход не может покрывать все расходы большой семьи. Поэтому дополнительно он занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота. Он хочет получить займ для покупки нескольких голов крупного рогатого скота и корма для него. Также на приобретенный займ он хочет закупить сырье для лепешечного цеха.
texts.en: Mahmud is married and has four children. His wife takes care of the home. To support their family, Mahmud and his wife opened a flat-bread bakery. For seventeen years, they have baked local flat-breads. Their income does not cover all the expenses of their large family, so in addition they raise cattle. Mahmud would like a loan to buy several more heads of cattle and feed for the animals. Also, he would like to use the loan to purchase supplies for his bakery.

loans.use: to purchase, cattle, animal feed and supplies for a bakery

loans.name: Nawar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single and lives with five family members, two of whom work.

Nawar has owned a car workshop since 2009, repairing cars and balancing wheels.  He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation, and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2000 loan in order to purchase a wheel balancing machine for cars. He is aiming to increase profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a wheel balancing machine for cars.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. All of them are in school. She sells charcoal in Kator, South Sudan. Mary requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal for sale. She hopes to pay the school fees for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rakel

texts.en:
Rakel has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 26 years. She is also involved in dairy farming. She is 49 years old and is married to Peter. They have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers; this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs and enhance her farming.

In the future, Rakel hopes to improve her farming skills and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin has operated his retail shop in Naivasha, Kenya, for the last two years. He is 47 years old and is a father to three school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers; this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock to sell in his retail shop.

In the future, Martin hopes to expand his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her food stock, buy a refrigerator, and improve the location where her goods are sold.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is 29-year-old farmer from the village of Kheoti, South Georgia. Amiran is married and lives with his family: his wife, Maya, and two children, a 5-year-old son and 3-year-old daughter. Maya is a housewife. Amiran earns his income through his family's agricultural activities. In particular, he grows different vegetables on family-owned land. The harvested products are sold in Akhaltsikhe, a nearby town. The family's total average monthly income is 500 Laris. 

Amiran requested credit for purchasing additional land (approximately 0.5 hectare). He will be able to grow more vegetables and increase his family's income. Amiran plans to use increased income to ensure a better future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah has operated her retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years.  She is 38 years old and a mother to one child.

Leah was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock for her business.

In the future, Leah hopes to expand her business to wholesaling and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy  sugar, washing detergents, sweets, and maize flour

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married, and the father of four children.

Alaa has been an owner of a shop for the repairing and maintenance of water pumps since 1995. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay annual rent and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a thirty-two-year old widower with three school-going children. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.

Emmanuel has operated a motorbike transportation business for the past two years. His potential clients are area residents, and his major challenge is the rising cost of fuel. He aspires to own a transportation service shop and have as many motor vehicles as possible.

He plans to use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase spare parts for his motorbike and pay for its repair. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it understands its customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorbike and pay for its repair.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 24 years old and is a married man with 2 young children. He is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He earns about 4500 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from fishing. He is able to provide for his family through fishing. He works hard to improve his earnings and save for his children's future.

John has requested a loan to repair his fishing boat and purchase fishing nets. He hopes to have another source of income soon.

loans.use: to repair his fishing boat and purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Azraa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 28 years old, married, and a mother of two children.

Azraa has been a tailor since 2009, making, repairing, or altering clothing professionally as suits, coats and trousers for women. She has a sufficient experience in this field , a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is being well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for an $1800 loan in order to purchase a tailoring machine, an embroidery machine, and a generator. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine, an embroidery machine, and a generator.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 32 year old married woman who has four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling fried fish in Kator, South Sudan.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish to sell. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Dalmacia

texts.en: Dalmacia is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has a furniture business. She and her husband design tables and chairs made of bamboo. They sell their products at their town's market. Dalmacia has requested a loan to purchase more bamboo, nails and varnish. She hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo, nails and varnish.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 41, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. Separated from her husband, she takes the whole responsibility in raising her four children. Two of them are helping her in the business when not in school. At this point in time, she is starting to educate them in the value of hard work and patience in running a business.

She is into a food vending business. She purchases raw meat and vegetables from the market, cooks it into different meals and sells it in her neighborhood and the local community. She has a small stall just a stone’s throw away from her residence. It is located in a crowded area where selling food is not hard at all. She’s also into selling barbeque at night, as well as being a rug maker, and these businesses add up to her daily income of about 800 Philippine Pesos. 

Rowena is requesting a loan amounting to Php10,000 that will help as additional capital. She will spend it to buy additional raw products she needs in her business. She will prioritize and purchase raw meat for her barbeque business since there’s a clamor for it in her area. 

She dreams of seeing all her children finish their studies and have a good life. She wants to secure a good education for them even if she is all alone in raising them up. The weekly fellowship* made her change the negative attitude she had in the past. It gave her time to read the Bible and share her own understanding from it. She learned to be more disciplined because of CCT.  

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is married with 5 siblings. She is 48 years old from Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in her community to make a living, and she has had this business for more than two years. Each month, she earns approximately Php 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan in the amount of Php 15,000 to pay for new spare parts and maintenance. Nenita has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She is hoping that her type of business will last. She will use her income for sending her five kids to school and to support their daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for new spare parts and maintenance.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyanzi is a 52 year old married woman with seven children who are all grown up. Her husband Sanga is a businessman, and he contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and water.

Mnyanzi has operated as a traditional alcohol (mnazi) vendor for the past year; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to buy more storage containers for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more storage containers for her business.

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira is the leader of this group. She is 56 and married to a teacher. Together with her husband she has raised three sons and a daughter. Ten years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms Damira purchased a cow. Her husband and the older son help her in cattle breeding.  Every day Damira sells about 5-6 liters of milk, and in this way she earns about 2,000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she wishes to open a small, nice shop.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is 36 years old and married, and has a 17-year-old child. Benjamin is able to support his family through his business. He works hard to improve his income and save for his child's college education. He requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other supplies. He hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other supplies.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hoi is 53 years old. She lives in An Ninh village. She has two children. She has a general store. She sells groceries. She has been working this job for 5 years. She has a monthly income of about 3,500 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008 and repaid her loans punctually. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is a 45-year-old farmer from the village of Kheoti, South Georgia. Gela is married and lives with his big family: his wife, Lali, two sons (22 and 21 years old), daughter in law and parents (retired). Gela works as a teacher in a local school. Lali is a housewife. His elder son works in Security Police. His younger son works as a sawyer in a local joiner’s workshop. Gela’s daughter in law is a student.

Along with his main job, Gela is leading the family's agricultural business. They have 3 milk cows. Lali produces cheese and sells it locally. Along with the dairy, the family is also busy with potato growing on a family-owned plot of the land. Harvested potatoes are sold locally to green-grocery retailers. The family's total average monthly income is 1200 Laris, including Gela's parents' pensions.

Gela requested credit for purchasing potato seeds. He will purchase quality seeds and sow potatoes. He will work hard on the plot during the winter months and hopes that will get a good harvest in the spring. Gela will use the received income to pay the study fee of his daughter in law.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Mrs Loan is a 41 year-old female living in the town of Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has 3 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Loan owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a butcher shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork in the local community.  Loan has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Mrs Loan joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  she  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7.840.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 9.184.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Bích là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Bích Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Bích thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Bích kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, Bích đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Bích đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.184.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Bích dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:
